UnrwsyhcCf8ZH30hAVt61Q.text: Great food, great serving staff. That's all I can say as far as what was good. We had a group of 10 waiting to get a table after being told 15 minute wait. They told us 20 minutes later it would be another 30 minutes because they were backed up even though they were seating smaller 3-5 group tables ahead of us. We even offered to split our group up to two tables to get seated sooner and were told that they can't do that. It took over an hour to get seated. When we did I counted 10 open tables and booths, two of which could've seated our entire group. We were the last group in there and when we were done we were the only ones in the restaurant. They could've done a better job getting us seated sooner and when I mentioned this politely to the manager and how long we waited and how frustrating it was, he said he would let them know and appreciated the feedback. I did not ask for any discount. The proper thing to have done would have been to apologize and over at least something. But nothing was offered and it felt like he was just placating me and not taking my feedback seriously. We won't be back- certainly not as a group. They lost business due to simple lack of organization and courtesy.

-9JW_gyFm1b2p30Ai6cTKg.text: My chicken Benedict was huge! I leterally had to cut it half. It was alright tasting.  Parking lot was empty I didnt know if they we even opened.  The service was nice. Totally coming back with the family to try different items.

nrithqepZV0XRJOksGA_wQ.text: My wife and I had a couple of hours to burn before our movie so we decided to hit this place up because the food looked good and it was close by. We went to a couple of other places first but the lines were too long so we chose Hash House. When we pulled up the parking lot was mostly empty. Hmm? Anyways, we went inside and were seated right away. Our waitress took our order and brought our drinks quickly. We ordered the Sage Chicken with Eggs and the CrabCake Bennies. The food looked amazing on the other tables so our expectations were high. Our food arrived fairly quick and we dug in. The food portions are insane, I would suggest sharing a plate and maybe get a side. The lowdown on the food: the chicken was perfectly fried and placed over a huge helping of mashed potatoes. The chicken was crispy and moist. The potatoes were perfect! It came with a syrup reduction, on point! The wife's CrabCakes were tasty. They were also huge and covered with a spicy Benedict sauce. They were served over delicious biscuits. The food was worth the money, and you won't be leaving hungry. But that's about it. The service was lame. We had to wait for everything once we got our food. We needed more drinks, which didn't come until we were ready to leave. There were tables that hadn't been bused since we walked in. Our waitress appeared to have been also working the bar area and was occupied with people there. The other half of the restaurant was empty except for the manager sitting at a table working on staff schedules. The hallway to the restrooms also is conveniently used as a storage area (Not amused....) Overall, the food was good but the service was lacking, therefore leaving a negative experience. Service is just as important as the food...  Saturday, 2pm

a72zJ9Zv0A3i5zOUXv0oqQ.text: I used to be a huge fan of Hash House. I would drive at least once a month to the Sahara location for the fabled fried chicken benedict.  When we found out a location in Henderson was opening we were stoked.   The truth of the matter is that management in this location is non-existent. From 20 minute waits for drink refills or the check, to under seasoned, smaller than Hash House portions, service is sub par for any restaurant, let alone one in Vegas.   My poor experiences in this location are making me contemplate whether I even want to bother going to the original location.

ASfOgccjo3l45bG3uebndQ.text: The worst dinning experience ever!  First of all, the food server seemed short and not very friendly.  I asked for waters for my wife and I and she brought one water.  I had to ask twice for  the water.  We ordered our food and my dish arrived and my wife's food  arrived 13 minutes later, with no apology.  I order the chorizo and jalapeno hash with an extra egg, cooked over easy.  They were cooked over hard.  You would think a place that specializes in breakfast items would know how to cook over easy eggs!  The hash was not very good, just marginal at best.  It seems as if there no leadership at this restaurant.  Eight months from now look for this place to become a PT's Pub or a Dotty's.  This Hash House a GoGo sucks!

W9SewfPJq5RJX_7h0VSGmw.text: The food is delicious here but be prepared for extreme crowds not being able to get through to place a to go order and a snotty bartender. We do take out to avoid the crowds but have had multiple issues with the phone sending us to voicemail making it so doordash or grubhub could not even get through to do a to go order. Then there was the time I put in a to go order to pick up myself and one of the bartenders informed me that if its been over an hour, they throw out your food and then have to remake it when you get there because the cold stuff sat out too long. Don't they have refridgerators that keep that cold stuff until its time for pick up. BTW they quoted me it would be ready in 15-20 min and I got there right at the 50 min mark for pick up, not over an hour.

CZ5saDjqepZYGvtuwvD8MQ.text: When I have guests in from out of town, I love to take them to eat at Hash House to blow them away with the extra-large portion sizes. Their food is also top-notch, and although not super cheap, it's definitely worth it and splitting a meal is always an option. My personal favorite dishes are the Bacon, Avocado, Onion, and Swiss Egg Scramble (the biscuit is so big and fluffy) and the Kokomo Meatloaf Sandwich (bursting with amazing flavor). Dishes I've tried that were not my favorite were their Sage Fried Chicken and Waffles (surprisingly, because it is normally one of my faves at other places - it just had a weird taste) and Andy's Sage Fried Chicken (I wasn't a fan of the spicy sauce that's all over it, although I know others who love it). Definitely recommend this place!

qcpydDzpsr8x6vx-LyoPKA.text: You'll need a wheel chair leaving this place! HUGE portions of awesome high quality comfort food. The sage fried chicken and waffles with a Bloody Mary is a killer combo! If you're near one, you should go!

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Henderson, NV, United States. Andy&#39;s sage fried chicken

at6S9sO7UnTaNlIzSyD0yQ.text: Always the best food big dishes and great prices customer service is fantastic  Jessica is  great and always smiles  my favorite  is everything o the menu Tell people from around the world it's a must stop in Vegas

SR8Gm6wBUs6eCf1bmyhQTg.text: Took FOREVER for us to be greeted and get our drinks... ordered 2 bloody Mary's and they were not good at all! Mine was ok but my boyfriends tasted awful! The food portions are huge and ok, but service was awful!

UF1oPcfkKC3BAjF8_GYsBg.text: I have been here twice, once on a Saturday morning at 9 am and the second time a Sunday evening around 5:30 pm. Both times we were greeted promptly and seated right away. The waitress arrived within a minute to take our drink orders. I have not had an issue with service at all. Both times the wait staff was friendly and quick. The food was amazing both times with the exception of the rosemary sprig stuck in my burger. I hate rosemary so this was a turn off. Next time I will have to just remember to ask for no rosemary on the plate. The huge honey biscuits with butter and fresh strawberry jam was the bomb. I could of just had that and been satisfied. I will be back again due to the huge menu and there are a bunch of dishes I want to try. The prices are great. A dinner for 4 cost us 63.00. That included our soda and ice tea.

II0swxLwhjt0RHjohcdgXg.text: Food was alright , service can improve. Food came or wrong as ordered , but she made it right. She refilled our drinks without us asking for a refill. There is not a hash house in California so gave it a try. After this experience unlikely will go back, however , I can now say I tried it. Paid $21 for a burger, drink , and tip.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Henderson, NV, United States

J6VpZjhJ4mpg5G9WRK99yg.text: Came here to get our Bloody Mary fix on but service and quality at this location pales in comparison to the location in The Linq and on Sahara! I can see why this location has the lowest rating on Yelp! Servers complaining and using profanity too...and we're no angels, but come on! Take heed to those 2 & 3 star reviews! Wish we did!!!

1rAvXzK6LoqpAbarcTMsQw.text: Yesterday morning was our third visit at this location and most likely our last, although we might try other locations in Vegas if the opportunity present itself.   While the service was just fine, the food is really lacking on so many levels. I ordered the smoked salmon Benedict and the eggs were simply cooked in a pan overmedium style and while I expected the salmon to be the kind you find in a bagel lox and cream cheese, it was chunks of plain steamed salmon. Just to make it worse neither my dish or my husband's were hot AND they came separately.   For a $50 breakfast (with tip) We should of went across the street. Very disappointing for the money...

0G81-NOaqLn5Srp1QwQqag.text: This is my first visit to the Henderson location of this popular "Brand" restaurant. We were surprised to find it fairly easy to get seated at 630 on a Saturday night. But I soon learned why.   After a brief two minute wait at the hostess station while she figured out which empty booth to put us in, we were seated in the bar area without being asked if we had a preference.   After a few more minutes our server Jes???  arrived to take our drink order. She was quick to deliver our ice teas and then we did not see her for twelve minutes while we had questions about the menu. I finally asked a buser and he cleared up the fact that they dont have a real dinner menu or even real appetizers.   I should have done my homework.   When our server arrived to take our order I had a question about an appetizer. She answered, I ordered and we also placed our entree orders at the same time since we had been there so long.  A runner brought our appetizer,  the pork tenderloin with bbq creme sauce out in a metal basket with sweet potato fries. Too bad we didn't have plates. Then once we received plates to eat our appetizer in less than five minutes we had our entrees. First the runner brought my husband's chicken pot pie then a few minutes later my kokomo sandwich which is a meatloaf with cheese sandwich.   The food overall is under seasoned. Most of their entrees are served with rosemary sprigs as decorations but some salt would be better if used.   Neither of us had managed to get even half way through our entree when our server walked over and committed what was the final sin to us both.   She brought us the bill. She didn't ask if we wanted dessert, which they do have on the menu and which we had planned to order. At that point I through my hands up, leaned back and we both tossed our napkins on the table. Our server did assure us when she brought our bill that we didn't have to rush ,that there was no hurry but in my world when you get a bill the restaurant is pushing you out the door.   Its the ultimate in restaurant rudeness.   To top it off, she noticed us leaning back while she was behind the bar and called out asking if we wanted to go containers. A good server would have realized that there was no way we had finished eating and maybe we were just a bit upset. My face might have told her I was not happy.  Then a runner comes around to show us desserts. TOO LATE ...I am already paying for my half eaten dinner and appetizer.  I did tip the server. 10 %. Then I  wrote a very brief note about why she only received 5.00.   I didn't judge her for the not great food. But bad service is the servers fault and it can't be blamed on being busy. They weren't.  The manager was there. He stopped by our table and asked how things were. How do you tell the poor man that it will be the last time we  come in because the server doesn't know the basics.

l2EAkyyEnFqH7IyM1cOK0A.text: Oh...my...goodness. Sooo good!! I love a place that has tons of stuff made in house (Their meatloaf is NOMMY!!!) Their portions are HUUUUGE (be warned...my man and I easily split a Chicken Eggs Benedict)  Their Bloody Marys are soooo yummy (upgrade the vodka for 50 cents if you don't like well) I could go on and on, as other reviews have done...but really...just eat here....dooooo it!!!

_hoaUkxoFtp7ZJ3ouujPaw.text: The service was pretty good ... We liked the food for sure we will come back... it wasn't real busy a turn off was my food came with a biscuit they brought the jelly and butter no biscuit and when i said something to him he said oh do u still want it ... well ya i hadn't even started to eat yet and i am paying for it ... so i said yes please .. but never got it ..the table also was sticky.. i would go back to see how it would be the second time around

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Henderson, NV, United States. Eddy was our waiter he was fantastic
Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Henderson, NV, United States. Home potatoes mmmmm
Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Henderson, NV, United States. The biscuits and gravy ... Omg sooo good

BTNk_YRqPZ55mKv5XgaB7g.text: I ate the best breakfast skillet ever, and I've eaten quite a few.  Yvette, my server, did a great job explaining her menu favorites and taking care of me during the meal. I had the Michigan Hash, which was a $14.95 brunch special.   Brunch ran until 5pm the Tuesday I was here. I'm all about trying to get my daily intake of vegetables and fruit.  This skillet had it all. Here's the ingredients right off the menu: Crispy potatoes, garlic chicken sausage, roasted red & yellow peppers, fresh asparagus, and goat cheese all topped with two eggs and served with a fresh buttermilk bisquit.  There was a fresh fruit garnish too. The array of flavors really stimulated my taste buds and it was hard to push it away when I was full. The Hash House has a lot to offer on their menu, a well stocked bar and well placed televisions with sports broadcasts.  I'll definitely return

qt-Pg9MgCeTD0_7gJJ70wA.text: Mashed potatoes fried chicken and bacon and eggs im full as a tick great service btw i will try this again

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Henderson, NV, United States. This dish fried chicken eggs bacons and mashed potatoes killer

Gm1R5SBR3sfjj3pTbl3JBQ.text: This place is a great four star breakfast place, and a three star lunch place.  If you wanna have an awesome breakfast, please go here for sure!  1. Breakfast  a. The Wait - If you come on Saturday or Sunday, be prepared to wait up to one hour starting after 8:00 am. This place is packed.  b. The Sun - If it is the weekend and in our summer or when warm, this restaurant faces the morning sun so be sure to grab a space to wait inside.  Little kids and older folks may not be comfortable.....  c.  The Food - Amazing. On various visits now, my wife keeps ordering the Sundied Tomato, Goat Cheese, Smoked Chicken Scramble. I have had the Mushroom,  Artichoke, tomato and spinach Hash House that was mixed up with a bunch of goodness and that was amazing too. Kids have had various meals here from Flapjacks, Skillets and all have thoroughly enjoyed it.  d.  The Food II - The key to this food is good ole farm fresh food. Proteins, Eggs, Meats, Veggies. Flapjacks and all designed to give you energy that last an entire day.  The presentation and service is also fantastic.  e.  The four star is due to fact that the breakfast food is great yet the service and waiting time suffer due to being so busy.  Service and waiting time strongly influence a meal...  2. Lunch a. The wait - After about 1:00 am, the wait is much better. We came in at 3:00 pm and it was perfect on a Saturday. Not sure why they stuck us behind a pillar by ourselves, which was hidden from a good service view, however, there was no wait.  b.  The food - The wife ordered the griddled Meatloaf with eggs and mashed potatoes.  This is a huge and amazing dish that she could not finish. I had a taste and the eggs are decent, the meatloaf a bit stiff / hard , not bad but not melt in your mouth. Potatoes are very good. And the biscuit was nothing to die for at all.  I was going light as I was going to have dinner. I ordered the Warm Spinach with no cheese and vinaigrette on side. I think that the waiter should have mentioned that this salad in this set up is bagged spinach, 6 cherry tomatoes and about a tablespoon of diced onion with about 2 tablespoon of bacon bits.  This was something both uninspiring and also unappetizing. The waiter should know their food and help because this was absolute nothingness of a food order.  My son had the Roasted Pork Tenderloin Hash house and well, he did not eat all of it. By the way, the biscuits they serve look like they would be awesome with some butter and jam.  Where are those at?  c. Perhaps - Maybe it was the time of day, maybe it was an ending shift. but the food was not great at this time, the waiter was nice yet non-existent, and the price was not really worth it.  I will be back for breakfast, and perhaps give them a chance for lunch again. Yet, I am not excited about the lunch and perhaps will order something decadent on their list as they may be better at that!  No flavorful healthy choices here that I found.

7NZAzqMFQEXxEBpSB-58iQ.text: The hostess was the only good thing about this place, overpriced for the quality of food you can't substitute anything and it shows when your hate your career of choice through your service 1st and last time for me!!!

EmMFxYypRyPBtBOgaY0wCQ.text: I visited the Hash House yesterday for the first time and I was pretty impressed. I got the bacon and avocado scramble with potatoes and it tasted home made. Our server was very kind (unfortunately I don't remember his name) and always made sure my coffee was full, which is definitely number one on my list! The only down size is that the portions are monstrous! It definitely tests you self control!

aPhpjt1a58iRB2IH1DA7Yg.text: Suggestion for all wait staff in the restaurant industry....when your customer orders over medium eggs and they arrive runny its logic they are getting sent back. When the eggs come back from the kitchen and then they are burnt, they are getting sent back. Whitney, don't just flip the eggs over and say "okay....how do these look?" They are still burnt! Do your job correctly and you will get better monetary tips than tips from yelp.

oNt_LQiTXvXFkHvxdEtgVg.text: Fresh jam, fresh fluffy biscuits & gravy, bacon bloody marys, chicken & waffles, gourmet coffee & huge portions.    Nuff said!  Don't bother from 9am - 2pm on weekends though, unless you like waiting 2 hours for your table.   You'll see the crowd outside and think "perhaps someone is giving away free money in that building" but no, it's just french toast & pancakes that they are waiting for.

0GreeEavExWY1ffRqFKtAA.text: Came for Father's Day breakfast. Food came probably five minutes after we placed it.  My wife and I both ordered skillets. The only that thing I'm sure they cooked to order was the eggs. Everything else was barely warm. Not one to complain, we ate our meal, tipped the server 20% and walked out. Service was good, wasn't the servers fault the kitchen/management are ok with serving below average breakfast. But for $50 for two people, it is a joke that they prep everything hours in advance. I get it, it's Father's Day, you want ticket times to be quick. But at least make sure your food comes out hot and fresh. This place is a joke and I will not be coming back. IHOP is even better than you guys

1hdmqBthc5J3TeVm83rQqw.text: Great breakfast.  First time we ate at this location,  we'll be back for sure.  Service and food was great!

myVhRkXnaUQntF6nid-vwg.text: Large portions, great ambiance, but the food seemed to lack flavor.  Maybe they have changed their recipes, but I thought it used to taste a lot better.

Pm7lxYpZsTkY6gSDnysBVg.text: A friend recommended this place for "the best and biggest breakfast ever". Boy, they weren't kidding! The food was excellent and there was so much of it! Our waiter, Myron, was on the ball. He came back several times to check on us. The general manager, Tyler, came over and chatted with us for a while. He is, rightfully so, very proud of his restaurant. We will recommend the Hash House a Go Go in Henderson to everyone. One warning though - come hungry.

-ioH3-w5P9Q47yjF4Ivrlg.text: This location is disappointing. I went to the one on Sahara years ago and had a great experience. This one in Henderson, is not well managed. Places is always dirty. Servers don't check on you. You ask to try a couple sauces and they bring you full soup bowls full and then charge you for them. I could go on....

giGKvKH2EhX88t89mM9cpQ.text: Food is good but if you're looking forward to praying as a family you're in for a huge surprise because food doesn't come out all at once and good luck with management helping BOB the one in charge tells you that that's one thing customers NEED to understand that we have to sit and wait for the food because that's how they work. Never going back there again!!!

CZrjPJtFf9pxdU8r9PiPPA.text: World famous Bloody Mary"- I have had better, I have had much better, for a lot less. Had the Pub Crawl sandwich they put mustard all over the plate, silverware and sides of plate. Simple breakfast was good but very expensive. Good service . It will be a long time before I consider coming back. Or be able to afford to come back.

625YGTMKBxS4sroL9RKRtQ.text: This food was brilliant ! Food is brought out on Large plates with large amounts of food. Enough for the hardest of food consumers. Will be exceptionally overwhelmed with uncommon variations to satisfy the taste pallet. Almost incredible!

Z1bvRIHJHIcq7xQu55vOUg.text: Went on a Friday afternoon.  Busy so we sat at the bar.  All staff seemed overwhelmed.  Coffee was good plus they had a good coffee menu.  I had regular, gf had some iced sweet thing she loved.  Got the twisted burger.  Mine came out 5 mins or so after hers.  Was good.  Cooked on flat top the way burgers should be.  Was well done, server didnt ask for temp.  Expected burger to be stuffed like a juicy Lucy not 2 patties with cheese in the middle.  Really big burger.  Bun was good but not the best I have had.  Biggest down fall of the visit was the bathroom.  Completely trashed.  Paper everywhere, trashed overflowing, just dirty.

N6WAhCnDkk_QJojo13ijig.text: My review is only based on the service of our waitress, kris. She was the worst waitress I can honestly say I have ever had in my life.   My boyfriend and I regularly eat at hash house. We were excited to find there was one closer to our house. So typically we HAD to go.   Walking in they quoted us 30 minutes which is fine, they even sat us in about 10 minutes, even better!!! When we got to our table, I believe it was the manager and she took our drink orders right away and everything was great. Then comes kris. We had our friend with us so she was still browsing the menu. She made her feel rushed to make her decision. Then I proceeded to order what I've ordered every single time I've ever been to hash house, andys sage fried chicken Benedict. Delicious! Usually. I don't like scrambled eggs something about the texture, but whatever. I always get them over-easy no problem. Kris told me I wasn't able too because it would ruin the quality of the dish... When I told her I didn't like my eggs scrambled she then offered to put them on the side and I was totally fine with that. When the food was brought out, it was made with scrambled. When I reminded her I should have had over-easy on the side she began to argue with me saying that I never told her that. She then told me it would be a few minutes and the manager was fixing it. When my food was brought I had my eggs on the side but the original plate was still made with scrambled, so I picked it off not trying to be difficult. Maybe 5 minutes after I started eating she came over asking if we needed to-go boxes... "I don't know yet, we're still eating?" She then brought the check.   Every time she refilled my boyfriends soda she must have spilled it or something because his cup was so sticky he didn't even want to touch it.   I'm a strong believer in tipping and excellent service deserves a hefty tip. We tipped her $1.69 just to even out our check. I didn't even agree with that.   I hope this review is read and kris works on her customer service, I've worked in customer service a very long time. And two of the top rules is never tell the customer they're wrong and especially don't argue.   I don't know if we'll ever go back.

mUjFMo3U9uv0tqO1_ItK7Q.text: Food was very good!! Our waitress(Kara, I believe from Illinois) was very polite, and on top of things. It was my first time, have heard lots of good things about other locations. So when this one open close to my house, couldn't wait to try it. Only issues was the wait for the table, it was slow and there was a lot of tables. Also I don't like onions, chives and whatever they throw on the potatoes and the waffle and chicken. I would of order it with out it, if I knew. Didn't say anything about it on the menu. Chicken and waffles was very yummy!!

fcYkqjtmTEIj6NRA3JMHYg.text: Worth the wait!  Generous portions and excellent service.  Never had a dish I didn't love at HHAGG!

Gt6WTqEoMPdmepHCOl_XKw.text: Great food ! TONS of great food.  My vegetarian daughter even found items to make her happy.  Wait was not bad.  Will go back !

1Dvp_pIFOg5-udoGhoyhyw.text: LOVE this place and LOVE the location.  I was sad to see the one inside the M resort shut down, but this location is nice too.  The staff was stellar.. The food is amazing.  My husband decided to try the mac n cheese for 1.00 more with his meal, OMG YES it was that good.   Excited that we have one of our favorite restaurants near by..

WzkOGFj8gOOaeBFpiJwdYA.text: I always take family and friends here for breakfast, especially when they build a new one in Henderson! I had the chorizo hash. A bed of red potatoes topped with chorizo, tomato, jalapeno and cheese........delicious.

vT53hIgTK9JAzjP8G7YAfw.text: We were so excited to see a hash house on our side of town. No more driving all the way to Sahara. I've only eaten breakfast at these locations, but it's always delicious. We take out of towners here to  impress them with the portions, the price and the quality. Anyone complaining about service or wait times should give them a chance to settle in or go at an off time. It's worth it, I've had a bad meal or experienced poor service when I've gone without it being busy. No restaurant is going to taste good after a 75 minute wait. Seriously, it's ridiculously good food.

QfzKNK2giSIk1f_PYSMyZg.text: This was my first visit to a Hash House a Go Go location. At first, I was a little bummed by the slightly more expensive prices (compared to similar chains) but the hearty portions made up for it.   I'm so glad I only ordered a pancake. Our waitress asked if I wanted to get a combo, and I declined. It was the right choice because the pancake was bigger than my face. My husband and I split it and we still have some leftover.  I ordered the Snickers pancake, which was absolutely delicious. I also ordered a hot chocolate, which was good but a little awkward to drink on account of the chocolate syrup drizzled everywhere.  The service was great and fast, and our waitress was incredibly friendly. I'll definitely be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Henderson, NV, United States. This pancake is bigger than my whole face.
Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Henderson, NV, United States. Hot chocolate

yLajQr9O7OwFlCAkZBNBOQ.text: I had breakfast there with my family a few years back and it was amazing. When we go back to Vegas we will go back.  Make sure you bring your appetite when you go the servings are tremendous and delicious.

bfyghfRQw8pdoely_MhMOg.text: So I went here and it was such a huge disappointment. During the time I went it was hot outside and they informed us that their a/c wasn't working which we didn't think was that bad but oh I was so wrong. It was so hot in there and the only thing that would have made it better was the food but that was a complete fail. I order the ribs which looked so delicious but had this tangy sauce that was horrible. The wait was fine but then again there was less than 5 tables being taking during the time that we went. Wouldn't recommend.

5L8tJSOoHwjpfGhRR5MmdA.text: Never one to shy away from a coupon, I received a BOGO entree coupon for the Henderson Hash House a Go Go location's anniversary and we made a drive across town to take advantage.  Breakfast is my favorite option at Hash House so I opted for the chicken, rosemary and asparagus hash. The food at this location is consistent to other locations I've been to in the past.  Our server was attentive and friendly and we had a decent meal. Consistency is the key with chain restaurants and this location stays True to the rest of the locations.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Henderson, NV, United States. Rosemary garlic chicken hash with scrambled eggs

1LyO6o_Ddt7bpbD6iJblxg.text: This was recommended by my brother in law. There was a great selection to choose from.  I was really glad I went and found one.  We ate lunch there before heading back to Utah. My fussy daughter and her shy friend found something that they could enjoy,  as well as my picky wife.  So that says a great deal.  Food quality and service was excellent. I really enjoyed my meal,  but unfortunately they didn't leave room for dessert.  It was a fun atmosphere.

JsTY45TxLfspQsTUqO06lA.text: Amazing service from our waiter this morning ( sorry I don't remember your name , definitely blonde lol)  Me & my boyfriend enjoyed the breakfast fried chicken & quesadilla! With a lemonade & cinnamon coffee ! Our server was great & we got a free dessert for wearing VEGAS KNIGHTS GEAR !

oVrBk46AKdbK_VeocgepSw.text: Portions are gigantic and the food is really good! Definitely worth a try- especially if you're visiting and tired of buffet food.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Henderson, NV, United States

gmJeAmZXUHwjl6n7kid-Fg.text: Wow what a waste of money, had high expectations because baby stacks was busy. My husband ordered the chicken fried chicken, there was no flavor. Ordered a burger with NO ONIONS, and guess what was on there, you guessed it onions. Not only that but we had to get the manager to find our server when we sat down due to the fact that people that were sitting there after us got there order and drinks before us. When I told the server about the onions, she said she would go "yell at them"?! Really, where is the customer service?  Beautiful presentation and the kids enjoyed their food but the lack of customer service and inability to follow simple directions give this review a 1 star!

BAxix9H8BPQeEGI3gGl0pQ.text: Dat chicken and waffles. Wow. It's really good but it's a huge. It's a dish for sharing. The portions are huge.

agHXuvADtX4F1m_9WP87DQ.text: EXECUTIVE SUMMARY: I won't be going back.  Tractors, tractors, tractors, everywhere. OK, I get it, the farm-to-table concept. Enough, already. Enough!  My first visit to HHGG was WAY-back-in-the-day of its first Vegas locations' soft-opening, West Sahara, at the invitation of an acquaintance of part-owner Jim Nyberg (whom introduced himself while we were there).   The roof was leaking over our table (hey, it WAS a soft-opening, forgiven), but the portions were huge, so I left impressed.   I don't remember being run over by any tractors.  Fast forward almost a dozen years, my next visit, this evening.   The A/C was broken. I get that, things happen. So, going-in, I wrote off off the 7pm empty parking lot to that situation, rather than as a referendum on the venue itself. (The parking lot is a rule I generally use as a deciding factor going-in, but I was curious where HHGG is today).   On the other hand, the A/C is impacting revenue, so someone should be paying the premium needed to get the HVAC guy on-site after-hours. I caught a break, my booth at the far back had a portable fan running right next to it.  The special was a ten-buck chicken fried steak, veggie, mashed potatoes, biscuit. I fronted it with a $4 side salad.   The side salad was a shocker. The bowl was the size of a 4"x6" index card with sides only about 3/4" of an inch high. Yeah, that china was certainly chosen to make small look full. I just knocked back a tasty side salad (for the same price) at Village Pub the other day that clocked in at about three times the volume. And by that I mean the normal volume for a side salad.   Penny-pinching on Iceberg lettuce and Roma tomatoes -and get this - ONE cruton. A big one, but one just the same. And it was as tough & chewy as a kitchen sink sponge. Come on management, what is this place facing bankruptcy or something?  The CFS plate was huge, part of the central concept/draw of this chain. The CFS itself was a much-larger-than-average portion, but the presentation is designed to make things look even bigger, as it was draped over a huge pile of potatoes. My guess is that there is about a pound-and-a-half of food on this large oval plate.  Unfortunately, the CFS was a not-so-fun cut/quality of meat, and it clearly had to be heavily tenderized to qualify for serving. The potatoes: just potatoes with some garlic and cheese thrown in to give them some flavor. Overall, pretty bland. But a-whole-lotta bland.  The biscuit represented more cheap carbs contributing to the plate's weigh-in. Over 2 inches tall. Chewy-tasty enough, when drizzled with some butter. Jam would have been nice, I shoulda asked.  The veggie was four -- count 'em four - little string beans, or maybe they were asparagus. They were so puny & shriveled up I wasn't exactly sure. I wolfed 'em, of course, and I still don't remember any actual flavor telling me which they actually were.  After tea & tip, I was in for a twenty. For the "special." That being mostly a massive plate of bland mashed potatoes.  Bottom line: Really big, really filling, but not all that scrumptious. Maybe this is why the parking lot is light, after all.  Maybe this approach is your cup-of-tea, or a lot of folks' cup-of-tea. But it doesn't work for me. If I want to top-off-the-tank with low-octane-fuel, I can just hit the low-end casino buffets for seven smackers at lunchtime.   And there I can fill a whole plate with salad.

3uwTWp1gDR8Bn5gP2x1UIg.text: The food was good! They give you a lot for the price! It was recommended that I try this place for brunch since I love brunch and it did not disappoint. The service was good and the food was tasty! Give it a try!!!

I got the BLT which makes for great FB photos but it's a sandwich that you cannot eat without taking it apart and actually making a manageable sandwich. 154s6EL0IYGaRnyI5M3p2w.text: We've been here a couple of times before our visit today and have had some good service - nothing to write home about, but reasonably good service and good food that the husband loves.   I decided to bring him here for Father's Day brunch since he loves their country fare. Boy, what a day to bring him on a special day ...   Service: We had a reservation so were sat fairly quickly. However, we never had a server come to the table to get us drinks. It was 115 out today and we were hankering for water! So I had to ask someone bussing tables to see who was handling our area. Then, three people came to get our drink order out of confusion. We finally got in our water order, but juice was brought instead of mimosas we'd ordered since there were "too many cooks in the kitchen." Three times someone else came with food not meant for our table. We put in an order for my mom and myself to share the chicken and waffles and no share plate was brought. So, we asked the person who brought our food for one and he never came back. Again, I had to get up and ask the bartender to help with our drink order and for another plate (not his job.)   Food: here is where we had no issues. We enjoyed our food we ordered. The portions were huge and there was plenty to share. Luckily hubby loved his chicken pot pie and had plenty to spare.  Environment: it was a nice casual day full of dads enjoying their special day on Father's Day. Many servers told them happy Father's Day ... but my husband was not one of them. It was obvious too since our daughter was between us in a high chair and he was taking time with her throughout.  I'm not sure we will be back. Of all days, this is a day we should see great service to someone like my husband celebrating Father's Day and it seemed like the restaurant was overflowing with people and mega busy when indeed it wasn't. The food is good, but I would rather wait longer at a smaller restaurant who takes more time to care about their customers.

UxZBI94fz9kX-OkNUeEExg.text: Go when you are extremely hungry and/or bring a friend to split a plate with. Really great comfort food!  It is a ton of food for the price! I highly recommend you try it.  The staff is kind, helpful and quick.

Q77n0JvN3orNZk8lI1Fbow.text: It was my first time eating at Hash House A Go Go and it was AMAZING. I came here to celebrate my 30th birthday and I have to admit the food was delicious. The portions were huge and I underestimated how the food was going to taste. I got the Tractor Driver, everything was seasoned well and I absolutely LOVED the potatoes. To make the time even better, Nicole our waitress was so nice. She made sure all of our food was up to par and she was just a joy to have.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Henderson, NV, United States

kU5f4dH294ZEsMrhwuopfQ.text: This is an awesome place for breakfast!!!! But you better come with an appetite. My husband and I stopped in on a Sunday morning about 9am. Clean and Cool farmhouse vibe. Got seated right away and our server Nicole R. was excellent. We enjoyed/shared a signature HH Bloody Mary (in a crooked souvenir glass)...Perfect! I enjoyed (1) blackberry granola flapjack. These suckers are HUGE!!!! The servers wear T-shirts with an "actual size" picture of the pancakes.....the pancakes are BIGGER and delish! My husband had the Tractor Driver Combo with French Toast dipped in a banana cinnamon cream served with pecan maple syrup. Only finished half the French Toast. Would love to try their lunch or dinner menu items. If only they had a Hash House in Phoenix.

5sBybPnQcxv8OtfnMh33cg.text: First time at this restaurant at the recommendation of 2 friends, on our way out of Vegas. Overall I'd recommend this place if you are a local and want great, creative cuisine food, but if you're passing through, I'm not sure I'd recommend it. I  likely will not return. I'll start with the positives, the place was clean and the atmosphere relaxed and fun. I LOVED that I was able to make a reservation for a Sunday morning, the prior day via an Open Table link on their website. There was clearly a wait when we arrived, but we were seated in accordance with our reservation nonetheless. Staff were all really friendly and seemed to enjoy their jobs. The food was AMAZING (I had the crab cake benedict and my sister ordered the chicken and waffles). Everything about the experience was amazing BUT their portions are INSANELY large. I get that it's part of their appeal and is probably great for locals who enjoy leftovers as much as I do. However, for folks who are passing through town to or from Vegas (we we visiting from Arizona), taking leftovers just isn't an option. When I asked whether they offered half plates, I was told they do not. I thought that unfortunate as I knew I'd not eat even half of the entree I paid $19 for, and would be wasting enough food to feed a small village in the end, which always breaks my heart a little. I really wish they would change that policy. I just found it wasteful and unfortunate. Unless they do, sadly, I won't return. Photo is of the benedict mentioned above. Beyond delicious.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Henderson, NV, United States

H1O5LJ4FwPWRqBB_qSfO0w.text: All I can say is OMG!! Traveling in Vegas we stumbled on this place in Henderson.  I've been to the Hash House on the strip but didn't know they had a second location. Amazing good food and beverages.  I don't usually order breakfast but this was a real treat. It was hard to decide what to order because they have so many options.  Warning... the portions are huge  I will definitely go again and try something different.  Even though we waited a while to get our drink order it was worth it.  Just don't be in a rush and enjoy.

LFBqF3K5m66Lsek8gG6IEw.text: Went here quite some time ago when they opened and just didn't get a chance to review it. I heard a lot about this place and was looking forward to it . I was not a happy customer :((. I ordered hash with potatoes and it was served rustic style but it was all in big chunks not cut up in any way. I had difficulty putting a mouthful in my mouth because it was so chunky. I didn't like how it was presented. I took a few bites and took it to go knowing I would not eat it as a leftover later. Even my baby brother's meal was huge, (he just got the pancake combo with eggs and bacon). Everything was delicious!

7ra5ddLoZqLH2mbKRRG-0Q.text: Presentation is everything and wow we were impressed by the size of the Texas looking portions! We went in as a group of 11 around 7ish and didn't wait long at all, maybe 3 min. Not busy at all on a Sunday night! Once we gave our drink order we didn't see our waitress for a while. I had to start asking what everyone had ordered for drinks that was taking so long. I wish she had offered appetizers bc I really wanted to try the fried green tomatoes but by the time she came back with our drinks I forgot and everyone was ready to order. The food didn't take too long but long enough to know it was made to order. Those plates were beautiful presented. I don't think anyone's good stood out on the flavor scale except my nieces French fries. Those were spectacular ! Everything else tasted the same as if u made it at home... except bigger. The atmosphere was alright, I could've used some modern country music to liven it up and really bring that southern feel out.  The restroom was pretty clean and didn't smell. Waitress was polite and not overly checking on us but just enough. The plate prices averaged around $10- 20 for the most part. When u see the size of the plate you will see why! Also the best part.. they support the troops and give military discount if you bring your ID!

8FxBo-DK9APgnybYJoqQKw.text: I simply cannot say enough good things about this restaurant.  The food quality and quantity is amazing, but what has impressed me most of all was the customer service.   I have been treated so we'll both times I have visited this restaurant.  You can tell that management truly strives to make your visit a memorable one.   Out meals have been delicious and trust me, they feed you more than you can eat.     Thank you Hash house and especially Alliison for making our visits wonderful.  We cannot wait to come back and try something new.

0oskBXJw1WV6o6EqMZ3lNA.text: Food is great. Nicole was an amazing server. The staff are super nice and I highly recommend this place.

5BXSOXZ8Hf2adakv3q2X7A.text: Great service. Food was above part. Very little wait time -- on a Saturday evening. Whatever the bad experiences that transpired in the past from previous Yelpers at this Hash House A Go Go I did not have them today. I usually go to their location at the M. The Henderson location is every bit as good as the M's and I think it's too bad that others have had bad experiences. I was treated well by everyone, the place was great and my food was very pleasing.  Accommodations included a hip regular eating section and a sports bar dining section. The sports bar dining section has full on bar with wide screens on the walls and behind the bar. Decor featured memorabilia citing accomplishments and famous guests. I've seen many places do this it speaks well of the joint to have entertained so many honorable guests.  I ordered the chicken pot pie that came a pie crust separated from the pie. The crust was the size of a small hat! Very tasty and savory, too much to finish at one sitting. The kiwi watermelon lemonade was a delight: Light, sweet but not too much, reminds me of spring. I also tasted my wife's meatloaf sandwich. It was big, meaty, reminded me of mom's best right out of the oven. All dishes were strongly represented.  What's my bottom line? I'm convinced that Hash House A Go Go is better as breakie/brunch place than a dinner place. While what I had was great, their breakfasts are killer! These are two of their featured dinner items and they did not disappoint. Tiny deductions only because much of what they did or tried has been done before but what they did was done very well. I'm going back again for more. My actual rating is a solid 4.5 stars...

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Henderson, NV, United States. Wall of fame
Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Henderson, NV, United States. Meatloaf Sandwich
Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Henderson, NV, United States. Sports Bar panoramic view

kWmcqiMpFF2vj8C9THoWpw.text: If you think quaNTity is more important than quaLity, Hash House A Go Go is your type of restaurant. Yes the prices are rather high for your average breakfast chain restaurant, but the portions are huge (Stand outside the door and watch the customers walk out, you know the portions are big when you see 200+ lb customers carrying out to go bags).  The 2 things worth eating are the Andy's sage chicken and the brown sugar banana flapjacks. I've tried other things on their menu and they've all been disappointing (Chicken and waffles, the Hash). Andy's is a bunch of chicken, potatoes, egg, etc. etc. layered on top of each other with sauce dripping down. Its good- maybe share. The brown sugar banana flapjacks are sweet enough to not need maple syrup. YUM.  The restaurant has a bar with TV (happy hour!!!!) and tons of seating. Show up on a Sunday and the Manager will be there greeting and asking you how service was.

MDIToIcM-ciD7BNjeeXeAw.text: I would like to give it 4 stars based on the generous portions, but the service rubbed me the wrong way. We went on a Thursday night and were kind of surprised when we were told there would be a 10 minute wait. I guess it's still somewhat new, so people are eager to try it out.   I ordered an Italian soda and a minute later a different waitress stopped by and asked what flavor I wanted. I responded I didn't know they come in different flavors. She said, oh yes, there are 10 different flavors that are listed on the menu. I handed her the menu, and she flustered because well, the flavors aren't listed. She struggled to name three and I settle don butterscotch.  We ordered the chicken and waffles and chicken pot pie. The chicken and waffles was awesome, but I didn't dig the pot pie so much. I didn't like that the crust was separate from the filling, and it was made from dry tasting crackers instead of a buttery dough. If you're not a fan of leftovers, I recommend sharing an entree otherwise you're likely to end up with leftovers.   A few minutes after the entrees were delivered, the waitress brought us our check. What????? Even though she was all smiles and told us not to hurry, it still bothered me. Unsurprisingly, she never stopped by our table to check on us again until we were ready to pay.

2jm3GafeLFPKMHYcamsFqg.text: Probably my favorite restaurant. Split portions if you don't eat much or be prepared for leftovers!

gERtez7p3nEzTqW3Jyl7WA.text: Why is it every time I go to one of these places there's something amiss. I went to the one in the Linq a couple of years ago and the food was HORRIBLE! Hulls of lettuce and brown lettuce in the salad, fried chicken seemed like it was cooked earlier and thrown back in the fryer (I owned a restaurant, I know what it looks and tastes like). Now I'm at the location on Stephanie St in Henderson and here we go again. The coffee in the urn wasn't hot and they have two bartenders working (wait for it) the whole bar, service bar, take out, AND three tables in the bar area. Way too much. Poor, poor management. It's not even that busy and these poor girls are being run ragged. Stay tuned, my food just came.  Too salty, my god! Huge portions, though. Food was not that hot, either. I got the bacon, avocado, scrambler. It's 4 hours later and I haven't stop burping my meal (sorry, gross. I know). I just can't give this place another try. Won't be ever coming back.

Bxum6D2i7Ep8QZ3q3jkX1Q.text: Their food always feels unique and fun and we've been here a handful of times to try something new! We've never had a bad dish.

GW3unP3C9_yoZV80vmwbSw.text: I've had a few people recommend this restaurant to me and finally gave it a try.  I'm not big on chain restaurants so I had my reservations.  Coming in on a Sunday,  I thought we'd have to wait but we were seated quickly and in the area we asked for which was nice.  The server came over a few moments later, I  believe his name was Josh, he was nice,  nothing special. I had the Andy's sage fried chicken Benedict and he had the salmon Benedict. Both were good but again nothing special. The serving sizes were impressive. I took home half of my plate but he finished his. To spend $54 on breakfast I would have expected to be wowed but it was just a mediocre experience all around. I'd go back if someone else wanted to go there but probably not on my own free will.

CA_6POVZKwfDNFEZR-tgvw.text: The chicken pot pie was great ,as usual, hot and very large pieces of chicken.Could just about finish it. My date had the expensive steak. Dry and over cooked. I would NOT recommend it !! Especially at $32.95. Now for the worst part. Dessert , my favorite part of any meal. The waitress was unable to provide a menu other then verbally of the 3 items. I skipped their Famous Bread Pudding as I have ordered it on other occasions and always found it to be about the worst I have ever had worldwide . Skip it !!  The waitress offered Chocolate cheese cake. Sorry again. It was a large slice of a non cheese cake mostly made up of chocolate chips. Just about stale . Should have returned it. Sorry I didn't.

t2S3a9d7QzCH0hNvVBiEgA.text: 10/12/18 This was the worst service I have ever received in my life.  We went here with my family to celebrate with my brother.  The sign outside says happy hour everyday 4-7 we get there at 6:45 and my brother and I decide we'll get a beer before dinner. Go to the bar table the male bartender (never got his name) tells us happy hour is 3-6 and walks away from us. I go outside and double check the sign thinking maybe I was mistaken because he went and asked another server to verify the happy hour time. I come back inside thinking they will honor their sign they tell me nope 3-6 only and he walks away again with complete disregard for us as customers.  We get seated and he is our server and he realizes we are part of the table of six and tries to be more kind. My wife tells the man he should apologize for disregarding my brother and I. He says " I don't make the signs I don't have to apologize for anything and I'm not going to take your attitude". We got up and left immediately. This is one of the only posts I've ever made like I said it was the male bartender working Friday night at 7 pm short hair and about 6 foot tall totally unprofessional I was with my parents, wife, grandmother, and brother not a rowdy crowd. I would like to add this was the first time I ever went here and was truly excited to try a new restaurant but sadly I will probably never go here again. Went next door to outback steakhouse and had wonderful service.

drJzzOmwEofuPwlJo14bGQ.text: French toast was hittin! The banana with pecan complimented it very well. Diced Potatoes were great and I got a side of savage baked chicken and that was icing on the cake! Couldn't even take a picture it was so good and all the flapjacks are huge!

JPiKLaTGLxo9rXli9U2DvQ.text: Great food at the Hash House!  I've been hooked since we first tried this place.  Just moved to a new neighborhood so we tried out the North Stephanie location.  And Wow!  What a great bunch of people they have at this location! Food was amazing as always, but this time the service was above excellent!  Nicole R was our server and we basically felt at home! She was so nice, helpful, and knowledgeable about the menu!  Could NOT have asked for better service!

r3CDFl3uBuh10C_-410JUg.text: Crab cake Benedict....wonderful and HUGE!!!! Well worth the share!! Will come back for sure!

Bren was amazing from start to finish!!! Everything was ordered and brought out promptly and correctly!!! His attitude was by far the best IV seen!! UJVoCr6qf_uBt_fM62pU3A.text: This is a very nice place to eat. Although it was fairly busy, my brother and I were seated right away. The menu is a bit confusing if you are not a regular customer. However, our server, Jessica, made it very easy to navigate. I had the basic breakfast which includes eggs, choice of bread (toast, biscuit, waffle, pancake, etc.)  choice of meat (bacon, sausage etc.) I had the bacon and potatoes. Warning: the portions are very sizable.   I will definitely add this spot to one of my local favorites. The cost for 2 people and tip was very reasonable and the food, service and atmosphere were very satisfying.

I def didn't overeat but my stomach hurt a bit after eating it, which says something about the quality of the ingredients, or lack thereof.   Service was nice though. A++++ in that department.

There is inconsistency when ordering the same dish too. The chicken pot pie is usually very grateful and comes with this inedible bowl of dough which will eventually soften up and become edible. My daughter loves the pancakes, great flavor selection and huge.

7zTtiqpzbnNVR3Te_-q-IQ.text: I love this place. We order the Chicken fried steak and the chicken and waffles.  Always great service and food.

iCPw1JDbazM1neGFZ7Rz8A.text: Food was great! Service was great! They have a lot signature dishes that are unique and delicious. The servings are so big that you can easily split them. Really love this place.

h2KdVbr4D8XSF2dgpf6R-g.text: I visited this place because I read that it had one of the best happy hours. When we got there even though there was hardly anyone we did have to wait  more than usual to have our order taken. Once they did though the food came promptly. I had read from previous reviews that the portions were big, so I decided to just purchase one plate and share it with the hubby. I am glad we did because we both ate and had leftovers. We ordered the man vs food challenge which consisted of fried chicken, eggs, mashed potatoes and biscuits. The food was pretty good and we enjoyed it.   As far as the happy hour goes, I think they did have some pretty good drink specials. I ended up ordering a drink which I enjoyed. I don't recall the name though.   Even though this is not the best breakfast in town, the food was good enough that I would come back.

ujwKTPR9YqVKrlKMmn0-AQ.text: Family enjoyed meal. Excellent potatoes. Pancake was over cooked and tough on one side. Bacon was under cooked. Fried egg was overcrowd.

_o-GZvVKqdA_rhxyJAHrJg.text: Arrived at 1030am Sunday morning. We didn't have to wait too long to be seated even though it was busy. Ordered our food about 1050am but didn't receive our food until 1130am. I understand it was busy, but, 40 minutes to actually get our food is too long. Either staff better or offer a menu that can be supported. The savior was the food was good (or we were just hungry) and the manager seemed to be on top of the issue. He apologized and helped the staff with getting our food. The waitress didn't seem to help the situation either. The impression is she didn't want to be there. In the 1.5 hour we were there, besides the basic communication, she only asked us once if everything was ok and no water refills.

X9BolRDiU5ePQsp971Fh3Q.text: Went here at around 1:30 on a weekday.  We were left waiting for 35 minutes and there were quite a few empty tables in sight.  The "Hostess" walked back and forth and just ignored us.  We left and will never go back.

I told the hostess we we had an Open Table reservation and she didn't know what that was, but acted like she did. It was weird. The waitress did take care of it for us. Service was a little slow, but the food was good. Pretty quiet location. I don't know how long it will be around.

NozkmYRjQHFKd-OK6lTVsQ.text: We decided to eat lunch here because I had a yen for a burger and thought this might be good.  It wasn't.  It was one of - if not possibly the - worst I've ever had.  They have what they call "stuffed" burgers.  Dear Hash House:  A stuffed burger is a hamburger that is - guess what? Stuffed!  This was two pieces of meat smashed so flat beyond recognition that I'm surprised they didn't fall apart when they removed them from the grill.  Not a 'burger' by any stretch of the imagination.  Flat, tasteless pieces of meat.  Perhaps they should actually go places that serve hamburgers; you know, where you can actually taste flavor.  By the time they were done squashing the meat (there's no other way to say it) any semblance of flavor it might have had was gone...kaput.  I also thought I ordered the Swiss cheeseburger, but what might have been cheese at one point was cooked into the "little holes" that this thing that passed for burger had (because they, again, smashed it to smithereens).  There were probably three or four mini mushrooms (I think), and could not be considered anything close to what it is labeled.  Plus, the bun that they use is entirely too small - meat stuck out everywhere, making it impossible to pick up without getting greasy meat all over your hands.  Good thing they brought a knife, so I could at least cut this thing up.  I should have been suspicious when our server didn't ask me how I wanted it cooked (you know, rare, medium, etc.  Only fast food places never ask you because they cook them one way - badly).  Here's how you cook a hamburger:  You form the patty, put it on the grill, and turn it ONCE only, without smashing it like you're trying to kill all the flavor.  When it is finished (according to how someone wants it) you remove and place on a bun that fits.  You place the tomato, lettuce, onion and pickles on the side so the customer can stack them in the order they want, not throw them on the bun before you even place the meat on it.  Although this thing was billed as a "stuffed" burger, it was nothing more than two pieces of overcooked meat that they had somehow fitted a small piece of cheese and a few mushrooms between and called it stuffed.  It wasn't.  To make it worse, the server told us to order their "fantastic" fries - which were nothing more than store bought frozen (or tasted like it) seasoned fries.    Will I go back?  Probably not, since if they can't make a burger - which is pretty simple fare, then the rest of the food probably isn't that great.  Bigger isn't always better, and just because portions are big doesn't make it good; it just means you're paying more.  (Also, just wondering:  why was there a sprig of rosemary in the bun?  The burger nor the bun was flavored with it, so it seemed odd).

3Y9AP9Cb4xgoSwzjGPligg.text: Three of us wanted to have lunch here since we've only eaten at the Sahara loc. But the wait was almost 10 minutes, and that's for the bar area. We were behind another party of 3 who waited a little longer. Two more groups came in after us. So we're all crowded at the entrance with 7 empty tables, not including their closed off areas.  I asked the cashier are they shorthanded in the kitchen too.  No, we just have 2 servers.  Food was good not great...big portions

PFTWfDHBbAiiZDTnJ0260Q.text: Absolutely wonderful experience.  We're new to the area, and decided to try this location.  The food was delicious!  But even more importantly, the service was just amazing.  Nicole R is one of the sweetest people I've come across since moving to the Las Vegas area about one year ago.  Her personality just absolutely shines.  Completely made me day, after a very long and exhausting moving day yesterday. I can't wait to go back to see her, and have some more delicious food!

beBtJvN40mOEu48oY3BhlA.text: Wow, how disappointing this visit was. Upon first arriving, we were greeted and sat right away. We requested a seat in the bar, that was our first mistake. The bartender was less that thrilled to be waiting on us, but I think that is her overall personality. The we ordered an appetizer, guacamole, salads and chips. The guacamole was very, very dark colored. Looked old and unappetizing. We mostly ate the chips and salsa. Then we ordered 2 entrees, which took a very long time to arrive. I was surprised too because it was 2 in the afternoon and only 1 other table and 1 guy at the bar. We ordered a burger and a hash. My hubby said his burger was not tasty at all and only ate half. The hash was good but the presentation didn't look appetizing. Keep in mind we have been car shopping and were starving, so we didn't have much a choice but to eat the food we ordered. To top it all off, we could here a meeting going. It was like every employee was airing their grievances which just made the whole lunch regrettable. I see other reviewers commenting on the service here and it seems to be a major problem for this location.

DoOKVrm3kKfTi09t7Uc2dg.text: First time here for a nice brunch. I'd say that this place is mad nice. There wasn't a wait at all but then again we did come on a Tuesday. I don't know how this city is on a Tuesday with their brunch but I'm from Florida and usually on a Tuesday it's not that busy. We didn't wait long for a seat. I tried out their kiwi watermelon lemonade, which was great! Initial taste was very tangy but after that I couldn't get enough of it. The watermelon that came with was sweet too. As for the food tho! When I go to a restaurant and I see that they serve crab cakes that is the first thing I get. I want to be able to try all crab cakes and compare it back home. This crab cake Benedict is by far one of my favorites (pretty much in my TOP 3) I'm usually someone who always have something to say about anything. The fact I have nothing to say about this dish says a lot. I just didn't know how to attack it, because the dish was huge! I usually don't eat asparagus but when I took a bite of that I couldn't get enough. The chili cream sauce that comes on the plate is GREAT. My friend ate it with her brown sugar banana flapjack and she says it gives it a sweet and salty taste to it that tastes amazing.   All in all most def would comeback to try out their crab cake sandwiches on saw on the menu.

NhmFR6tq3-rLH3O6q7ix-Q.text: I've come to this location twice within the last year. Let me just say....Outstanding! I've never had to wait to be seated, the food is always made to order and hot! Not to mention, the waiters have never given me a reason to NOT want to come back. They are always so kind, willing, and helpful. When I'm stuck on what to order they have a list ready of their favorites which aren't the most popular items on the menu.   I have had the pleasure of introducing people to this restaurant and turned them into fans themselves. Let me just say - their meatloaf is out of this world!

3LdxjlGeYiDFM5idVyn0RQ.text: Had a great meal here.  Drove into Vegas from AZ and stopped at the Henderson location before heading to our hotel. It was about 2:30 in the afternoon and pretty empty, which was awesome.  Seated right away.  Menu is extensive and takes awhile to look through!  Portion sizes are very large.  They match the price.  We loved their take on chicken and waffles.  The fried leeks on top added a great flavor element.  I wanted to try the Chicken pot pie but our server told us it wasn't good (lol).  I appreciate the honesty.  Pancakes are HUGE!  I think we found our go-to stop for when in Vegas with the kiddos!

njjpukItv4KRlSrIm12TYQ.text: We were looking for a breakfast spot and the menu looked interesting.  We split the corned beef hash - and we each had fresh orange juice. That was plenty!  I also had a coffee.  The hash was just OK. It was thin sliced corned beef cut into strips - not ground or diced meat. A bit odd and I did not appreciate the texture of the dish.  The potatoes were rather large chunks and although it had some swiss cheese in the dish - pretty nominal.  Not a bad meal, but not likely to return to this chain.  Maybe a better lunch spot - but given that it has "hash" in the name....

We ordered HH stuffed meatloaf, chicken pot pie, crab cakes Benedict, smoke salmon, and burger dish.  I had the meatloaf.  It was delicious, hearty, and flavorful.  No one finished their meals. Ask for Nicole! Working in the industry a long enough time I am very picky about the level of service when I dine out. Nicole was fantastic!!! Her recommendations were spot on and passionate. Food came out quick and my drink was never even low. One of the better dining experiences I've had in quite a while. jZPiONUlIt8Zej5lE1qxKA.text: Delicious food everytime! Service is always great and GM Tyler is the kindest & humble guy you ever meet.

jICyb-T9kj5VnoDlWt-etQ.text: Having been to the location in San Diego a few times, I knew what to expect and was not disappointed.  My partner and I arrived around 7:30pm on Wednesday evening and were immediately seated at a booth in the bar area. We perused the menu for quite a while and when the waitress arrived, we were prepared with both our food and drink orders.  I had the chicken and biscuits with vegetables and a cold brew coffee on draft.    Again, we sat for quite a while before our drinks were delivered. The cold brew was very good, a rich robust flavor expected from a properly steeped brew. The one minor caveat to their cold brew is the lack of regular sugar packets. Aside from the chemical sweeteners, they only offer the coarse natural sugar, which isn't a problem for hot coffee, but in the cold brew it does not melt and I ended up with a mouth full of sugar granules with every sip through the straw.  I finished the first glass prior to our food arriving and was not offered a refill until after we were already eating.  The chicken and biscuits is amazing and did not disappoint. Stacked high atop a bed of mashed potatoes and a huge biscuit was a perfectly grilled chicken breast covered with a vegetable puree topped with a fresh sprig of sage. On either side of the massive plate were perfectly cooked carrots and flash fried green beans, both with amazing flavor.  The puree, chicken, mash, and biscuits made for a different taste with every bite and each one better than the last. Needless to say, there was way too much food for a single sitting, maybe even for two sittings. But the leftovers were just as tasty!  My only reason for not giving 5 stars is the amount of time we sat waiting after we were seated.  Waiting to order, waiting for drinks, waiting for refills, and waiting for food. Because we were seated in the bar area, the bartender was also the waitress for those tables and it was clearly too much for her to keep up with both.  It was obviously not her fault, but I suggest maybe the bar tables not be seated if it is busy and only one bartender is expected to take care of the entire area.  The food was great and we will return.

UFpqBa1cQyjFCWzSGvL5BQ.text: Better come hungry!  HUGE portions that two people can easily share. The food is very good and reasonably priced.

WHts96KHiKq1M1qjPtCKeQ.text: Service was good but the food... how the hell anyone can eat this crap is beyond me. We had three in our party and the bill was $65. For what amounted to a Dennys upgrade. The menu is also complicated with certain dishes only served after 5pm.

UI74ekBDZJ7fmByHmO3L4Q.text: We have not been back to this place in a very long time because of the horrible experience a couple of years ago when we tried going for dinner on weeknight and had such bad service we left our beverages on the table and walked out.   However, we had a ticket for a free pancake and decided to give them another chance and they certainly made up for the last bad visit.   My husband and I shared an apple cinnamon pancake which of course was HUGE and perfect to split in half.  We ordered some bacon with it and coffees.  Our server Nicole was super nice and attentive and couldn't do enough for us!    We are hesitant to return for dinner but can definitely see us coming back again for breakfast!

zgiuhoAhbPolDJcO1lELDA.text: We just can't seem to replace the hash house at the m.  We've tried the Fremont and not Henderson location.   This menu must  be hard to replicate or something.    Table for 5.    My husband loves all food.  I don't think he actually tastes any food.  He also loves chicken pot pies and was excited to order it.   He barely touched it and said it was not good at all.  Again, he has never left a morsel of food on his plate or mine.    I ordered a fave  of mine the Kokomo meatloaf sandwich.   It was fine, but the meatloaf could have been fresher and was slightly dry.  Sweet potato fries were piping hot and very good though.    A friend ordered a salad.  She ate it, no complaints.  She doesn't complain.  But I didn't hear any extra this is so good.    Her husband ordered the pork tenderloin sandwich I believe.  Same response.   It was their first time at the restaurant and while pleased, I didn't feel enthusiasm from them.    They were pleased were the bloody Mary's.    At the now closed m location, we were addicted and ate their several weeks in a row because we loved it.  It closed a few months after we found it.

zQ5eR2HNsQwCvq7sv-aigg.text: Can't go wrong with this place. Food is a hearty size. Make sure you go here with an appetite. For the price, amount of food and quality this place is highly recommended over any nearby restaurants.

hkapfOX8HYh19FFtTfjRoA.text: To say I'm a picky eater would be an understatement. Have eaten at 2 other locations and wasn't excited when the boys picked this place.  To my astonishment I have to say best breakfast ever. Banana pecan pancake, egg whites and ham was each the best I've had in my lifetime. Waiter gave credit to the chef also the waiter was impeccable with his service felt like a gourmet experience all around.

V3ik0fpmue3l5VwGBwexhQ.text: This is a chain and most chains are average.  This place does have LARGE plates for the price but not all the food is that amazing.  I had the chicken fried steak for dinner and it was not even close to being good.  It was overcooked and just did not have a great taste.    The other food ordered in our party was chicken and waffles and like the steak it was overcooked.  I don't know if they cook was having an off night or what but nothing was coming out tasting that great.  The service was also very slow and for a place that was not really full that had more servers then tables at the time, the service should have been a lot better then it was.  Overall this is not a place I would rush back too.  I have eaten at other locations around town which served way better food then this location.  We were looking for something different but something that was good and this was a disappointing visit.

Everyone in my group tried to like it, especially since we've been wanting to eat here...but in the end. We all said it no bueno. My boyfriend ordered blackened chicken & he said it was just grilled chicken it was nothing special about it.  Well now I know don't order chicken next time.
