6GzFGn_Yt2Me6JSyxQHo2Q.text: You can't beat their happy hour specials. They do not serve everything traditionally , almost all of the dishes are offbeat. The chicken pot pie has a huge cracker on the top for example. Just check it out.

otiY5dLHWZ8vdhicgDZ12g.text: Had a wonderful meal for brunch with my husband this Saturday. Our Server Myron was very helpful in explaining the menu and making recommendations to us as it was my first time eating here. The owner Tyler even came over to see how our meal was and spent some time telling us about the restaurant. He even gave us some recommendations to try for dinner next time. The frosted mint latte is delicious and the french toast combo was very tasty and well worth the money for the size. YOU WILL DEFINITELY LEAVE FEELING FULL! We absolutely recommend this place for breakfast, lunch, and dinner. Great environment for families as well. We will be back more.

oE_b9O9UzoB8rxaF2NEMuw.text: Have visited this location before and it was great, but last couple times I've been coming the service has been slow and even when not busy, still took 15-20mins to be seated, 10 mins to get drinks and orders, another 25mjns for food to come in, drinks took forever to be refilled... it was slow and was rather disappointed in the food. I had ordered the "chilaquiles" plate, and it has to be one of the most disappointing plates I have ever ordered ANYWHERE. I got a bowl of cold, soggy, dry chips, that had too many jalapenos thrown all over and very little chipotle sauce all on the bottom. I understand sometimes understaffing is an issue but the food has always been great and this time it was way below an okay standard. I can't recommend this place to other.

vLEEBRJG_gzpUvKirxXXcA.text: I went and had lunch today at Hash House A Go Go. Wow the food and service was great. It will be my go-to place when you crave crazy farm house food.  Thanks for. great afternoon.

_5y2r8OLvDUy7jbL0Sk_1g.text: Another great trip to HHAGG, seems we are stuck in a rut here.... Again, I had the Blue Crab Cake Sandwich & my wife had the Chicken & Waffles. Both were great again, tasty and more than enough food. The Blue Cab Cake Sandwich has a hamburger patty size crab cake! It is huge. And, has plenty of crab in it. I had the Sweet Potato Fries for an extra $1. The Chicken & Waffles were huge as always, nice light fluffy waffles with crispy fried chicken. Service was a little lacking this trip, our waitress was trying, but they seemed to be short a server or two for a Saturday night dinner rush. No alcohol this trip, but they do have a full bar, with 5 beers in tap. ( I was surprised that they had no local beers on tap, with all the great Breweries here now) We will be back again

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Henderson, NV, United States
Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Henderson, NV, United States. Blue Crab Cake Sandwich

-L2rCDv8iLY13PdjNz4uGg.text: I finally got a chance to taste this place for the first time. After going here, I can say that this is the place to go when you are extremely hungry. My fiance and I came here and loved the food. We ordered the famous Andys Sage Fried Chicken and Waffles. As well as the Crab cake benedict. Andys sage fried chicken is to die for. Juicy on every single bite with a bit of fluffiness from the waffle. As for me, crab cakes were so tender and the benedict part was mixed in biscuits at the bottom. These are the best biscuits on top of all the ingredients that mixed in with the meal. To top it all off the sauce, is bomb.com. whom ever came up with this is genius. The only reason why I gave them a 3 star was the food got cold quick and our waitress did not come to check on us or give us refills. Overall the eating experience, I would come back every week if I could.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Henderson, NV, United States
Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Henderson, NV, United States
Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Henderson, NV, United States

jRmjpx4jYlhBZqyjHFeuFQ.text: Super cute restaurant.  We went for breakfast and didn't have to wait too long for a table. Our waitress was very attentive and sweet. The food - portions are huge!! The pancake really are "bigger than your head"  but it also makes then very thick and a little dense and chewy. The breakfast scrambler was delicious! Breakfast potatoes were a little bland for my taste.  The coffee is good when fresh and my friend loved her banana latte.  The lunch menu looked good and had a lot of yummy sounding drink options.  We will definitely be back to try lunch or dinner.

thULNshN_DvoP5lcfcjmKA.text: My wife and I absolutely love Hash House A Go Go.  We discovered the original in San Diego what seems forever ago.  I've taken sales groups there, held business dinners, and even family parties.  Food is always delicious and fresh.   This weekend we found ourselves in Vegas and we're looking for a good breakfast place out in the Henderson area.  We just randomly happened to be at a stop light and looked to our right and saw HHaGG.  And lucky we did.  Busy busy as usual, but worth the wait.   My wife went with the cinnamon and banana dipped French toast and I went sun dried tomato, spinach and feta scramble.  As usual huge portions that everyone is snapping photos of as they arrive at their tables.   Thank you again Hash House.  You will forever hold a piece of our heart.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Henderson, NV, United States
Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Henderson, NV, United States
Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Henderson, NV, United States

VfiJc96kdZhmGf-XhcfWpg.text: delicious food and friendly people. It's a very loud restaurant though, no matter what service you're there for. I was hoping dinner would be quieter but I was wrong. The food was still worth it and the environment is very entertaining.

_jDRjAcQzPPooxX3Mm0PxQ.text: I've been to hash house on the strip and in San Diego.  Whenever I'm near one I have to go! My dad, husband and I came for lunch on Saturday afternoon.  There was no wait.  I ordered the hammered pork tenderloin sandwich and my dad and husband both had the stuffed burger with mashed potatoes and bacon.  Service was good, food was huge and great. Overall you can't go wrong here! Plan on sharing or bringing home leftovers, I feel like it's impossible to clear a plate!

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Henderson, NV, United States

De2HA1Cb50ALmqiCPnl5RA.text: I could not eat this. Everything smells like throw up. I should of got the chicken & waffles

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Henderson, NV, United States. The meat loaf. I was starving. It smelled like throw up. Staff is nice

ugjdRTTOHWkxUZf9JmJijg.text: The best breakfast/lunch place in Henderson! They also have a location at the Linq hotel on the strip. They have huge portions so be prepared to take left overs or share a plate. Everything they serve is delicious. I love their lattes too!

iX909wOBKFl6yxa2qd16Vg.text: Only giving this two stars because the wait time was OK walking into the restaurant there was no diversity at all. the hostess seated me and my boyfriend i the corner I ordered a lemonade  Mimosa it came out to be $15 for a pint which was a large glass  Food rarely had any flavor. And the table had tiny bugs walking around on my napkin . So disappointed. Will not recommending to anybody . Wish I never spent the 60.00 & would like refund .

CYewLPZ6_TpwstGdUQKcLA.text: Delicious!  I had chorizo hash with eggs and a biscuit. I could have split this meal easily, the portions are so big.

i9_CRkKykNyVGBOsx2M7hQ.text: This was probably the worst experience I've ever had at hash house. It was very slow only 3 tables yet it took us almost 25 minutes to get our drinks. When we got our food I was excited cause it looked great but then I was horrified. The bacon tasted like chemical, the pork was dry and tasted like it was reheated in the microwave. The French toast was the only satisfying food we got.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Henderson, NV, United States
Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Henderson, NV, United States
Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Henderson, NV, United States

UPoSfBADQupNw7uKF4Qorg.text: The barnsy look on the outside of the building is nice nothing to exciting but it's nice it's different. The inside is very well kept dim lighting I enjoy it not a huge fan of too much lighting. Well I guess it all depends where I'm at during the time.   Let's get started with the menu,  They are a bunch off options I do not drink alcohol but holy moly some of the price were outrageous up to 16.99 for once 12 ounce drink and I'm sure the glass was mostly ice. Although they give you the complimentary glass you can keep it for that price I don't know how the bar there can keep up.  Breakfast and brunch was being served during the time I arrived it was around 11:00 am so I ordered a burger #5 it was outrageously huge I must say. The prices were somewhat okay but I just wish they had more pictures of the meals.  I think they only have the highlight dishes in the menu but it would be great to have a few imagines in each section of the menu it just makes it this much easier to order. The burger was enough for 3 people seriously if I would have known I would have split it with my party. It had god flavor was just to huge for me. All in all the food was good.  My tab was about a 100$ I was a bit shocked I never spend that much on breakfast. Not even the buffet.   The server nonetheless was very nice an attended us very well the staff was very nice   Bathrooms are clean.

JgOjIhCa7d1yyMNWxwhgVQ.text: Checked in with Open Table reservation and Server Jess was very nice to us. Thank you for your hospitality.

k10FM3eOQXO83DQs2v7noQ.text: Always a great time. Food portions are big enough to share or have leftovers. Service is always spot on. The bloody marries are always great.

BkjVcuZI0n19hLWbrxrG1A.text: First time here and it was amazing, portions are big u can share them or just take it to go if U don't finish it, very good service and the OJ it's pretty good specially there new watermelon drink and the cold draft coffee

4u3ZmNxrPEIGgzaujGKfFg.text: S'mores moca so good! Great and fast service and the food was delicious. Consider sharing plates their servings are huge!

mc_1XTBE7wID6-MzvWeYrg.text: If you are hungry and tired for buffets, give this place a try, everything here is huge! Pancakes were good, waffles were food, all the other food was good, and we ordered a lot!  Went off the strip because we didn't want to go inside casinos to eat. Nothing else to say here just bring you appetite and eat, you will be happy and overly stuffed at the end.

0BPmpie8kIRK22FGN0fH5A.text: The amount of food you get for the price is really incredible and most importantly the quality is great. I recommend sharing each dish between two people because it's impossible to finish. The flap jacks are delicious, s'mores coffee drink was great but the crabcake Benedict was my favorite. The only reason it doesn't get 5 stars is because everyone at our table got their food brought out 15 minutes apart.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Henderson, NV, United States

oUZUo8nAWHBKxnqtySkl8A.text: Limited menu and have not yet been impressed with the food.  I have been to the West Charleston location previously and really liked it; the Henderson location I have been twice, and not sure what all the excitement is about.

i8EUbJ2KTeFcWNtLeaotfw.text: Dirty dried on food stuck to the bottom of my plate. Oh look my silverware is dirty too!!! And to top it off, lip rouge on the glass that I am supposed to drink out of. The waitress was great, she said that things like that happened all the time there and that the restaurant manager didn't care, but she would see what she could do because it was so disgusting. Manager did nothing so she comp'd our drinks. I would never go to this location again. The one that is located in the M resort is much better.

4BlG1su6FXlbpR-t6YVMXg.text: Worse service I have ever gotten in my life, I have to say. I am very disappointed.  My first time at this place. My friend brought me to the Henderson location for my birthday  because I was craving chicken and waffles for breakfast and a really good bloody mary. We came in and were  seated right away, which was nice but they also didn't have many customers. As we are looking at the menu five minutes later our waitress comes to take our order. I ordered a non alcoholic bloody mary and my friend orders  a regular bloody mary along with chicken and waffles.  We get our drinks and I noticed I got a small glass and my friend got a really large glass. I call our waitress and ask her if I could get a bigger glass since all I wanted  was tomato juice. She tells us she doesn't know if she can do it and when I ask why do they put the same drink in diffrent glasses when its the same drink but with out the alcohol, she says that it's  so they can tell the difference between the two and won't get our drinks mixed up. Mind you little does this lady know I am a casino bartender and I am also a casino cocktail server and I have a lot of experience on drinks... I said,  you can just put a different straw, which they had. She gave me a lot of attitude and didn't seem to care to help me so I asked for the manager.  He comes to our table after we whatched them talk about us at the bar as the waitress kept rolling her eyes,  his approach wasn't very nice either.  We asked him if we can get a non alcoholic drink in the same glass as the alcoholic drink since it is the same drink but with out alcohol and he said he would have to charge me for double drinks. Smh. Made no sense and he was rude. When we said we'll cancle our food and pay our drinks  because we wanted  to leave, he said if you want to leave go. Wow! Couldn't believe him. We were going to spend a lot of money and we are very good tippers. First and last time I will ever come here. What a shame because I only live five minutes away and would have came with my husband and kids. Their loss!

BWZmMN5cHmTH7MRQQmUM2w.text: Worst service ever! Waiter was rude! Staff and management were unorganized. Never going back.

x8EcwEEjz3g2FYcaJWXXKw.text: My father in law wanted to go here for Father's Day. My wife, kids and I agreed to go for my Father's Day as well.  We arrived with a group of 9 (4 adults, 4 Children, and an Infant).  We waited around for 25 minutes in a restaurant that was about half full, but do to the fact we had a large group we awaited a table.  This is understandable by no means did I expect to get seated right away.  Once we were called for our table I told the hostess that I would need a sling for my infant carrier and she acknowledged me and said "OK".   Once we were seated I waited there for a few minutes with an infant carrier on my lap awaiting the sling.  When the waiter arrived I mentioned to him that I asked for a sling and one was never brought to the table.  When he comes back he brings a high chair drops it off and walks off quickly.  I then walked the high chair back and just grabbed a chair to set my child on at this point.  When I go out to eat the main thing I am looking for is service.  I can cook I have done it professionally for many years.  The service was starting off bad and there were not any drinks or food on the table yet.  From the drink order to the order the server was very efficient and helpful with the menu except I asked if I could remove sun-dried tomatoes from the dish.  I wanted to replace it with roasted pepper since my wife has acid problems.   They off course made a big deal and charged me $2 extra for an ingredient that less expensive.  One by one the dishes arrived to the table in about 1 to 2 minute increments.  This I was assuming to keep the food from sitting in the window and becoming old and cold.  Once all of the food was on the table everyone oo'd and aw'd over the portion size we all expected.  What I didn't expect was those roasted peppers I had asked to ensure they were hot for my wife's Hash would come out ice cold and not mixed in.  I sent these back immediately and they ended up very disgusting they had a sour taste like they opened up the can 6 days before.  My wife's eggs were also cold so I sent this back as well the new eggs came out quickly and correct.  My father in law asked for syrup and the waiter brought him honey instead and he had poured it over the waffle already.  He scraped it off and asked for the waiter to get him maple syrup again.  I was surprised after my father in law explained what happen that a new waffle did not find its way to the table.  That is just simply bad customer service.    Now to my dish I had ordered the Sage Fried Chicken Benedict which looked amazing, so of course I immediately jumped in and to my surprise it was cold I was so frustrated by this point that I did not even bother sending it back because apparently this staff has no idea how a restaurant is ran.  I can deal with cold food to a curtain degree but it was so under seasoned it was making me sick.  My family and I also went half the meal without our drinks being refilled.  I saw one of the managers hiding in the back not checking on tables, nor did it look like he was trying to run the kitchen.  With a restaurant being so new to the area and everyone having hopes for it to live up to Hash House name you think the staff would be trying a lot harder.  If things do not change at this restaurant I do not foresee it being in Henderson very long.  If they can fix these issues sooner than later they will be a great success they have location, descent pricing, great portions, and well-known brand.  Now they need to focus on the DETAILS, DETAILS, DETAILS.

wpZ9UFMaM18dJPZEfRIxXw.text: Food was horrible and over priced. Even the peach iced tea was bad. I'm not real sure how you screw up a ham and spinach scramble but they were able to do it. Even the crispy potatoes that came with it were tasteless. My mother had a Ruben. It came with 2 HUGE slices of bread that you couldn't even fit into your mouth if you wanted to and was covered with globs of mustard. Service was fast and friendly but I will NEVER go back. Save your money.

yokPNthBw7_Gp3LDsVdFVw.text: Extremely friendly staff and the chicken and waffles are the last word in tasty and delicious!  It's a favorite spot for us!

E7oBO94MuZH3NAMdazoUvQ.text: I was not at all impressed with the food. I ordered a chicken pot pie and it was first of all huge but second of all it was not at all flavorful. if you are a huge lover of rosemary (the herb that is) then this is the place for you!  I have never seen so much over use of rosemary sprigs everywhere sticking out of the burgers sticking out of my pot pie it was even baked into the crust of the pot pie! Over kill!!! my friend took me there to celebrate my birthday and it was not a very pleasant experience.  I returned my food to the kitchen and ordered a burger instead.(it was OK)  as we were enjoying the rest of our beverages a waiter who was not ours,reached all the way across me to grab a napkin that I had used. I consider that to be very rude. there are words that he needs to learn such as excuse me. since I had returned my dish to the kitchen our waitress had a $10 coupon that she did give to us which was nice of her. needless to say we will not be returning

2XjqztlXYd9JQDV5y1n3tQ.text: We tried this restaurant for the first time today, 4-11-15. It was overpriced all though you did get a lot of food. The food was ok and so was the service. We went early on a Saturday morning so it wasn't busy yet. I would probably go again but there are better places to choose from. We had the Basic and the Grilled Meatloaf.

slJXE4UX3Pfh1X6zYwm0Cg.text: Tried Hash House a go go about 8 years ago on the other side of town and it wasn't to bad. Liked the fact that everything was huge portions. But our recent visit to the new location in Henderson on 4/5/15, was so awful. The restaurant layout is not toddler friendly, (if you bring a baby and he/she is not able to sit in a booster chair, prepare to wait, aaaa longtime!.We specifically stated when we arrived that our little girl would not fit in a booster seat and would need a highchair. They stated it would be a 10 minute wait...45 minutes later we sat. The hostess stated we don't like to put highchairs to close to other tables, because our plates are so heavy. (Thank you, but why is that my fault your restaurant layout is not kid friendly?, why did you state 10 minutes wait, only to have us wait 45 minutes, then?). By this time i was very agitated and we were just about to leave and they finally sat us.   Then the fun started, The waitress that waited on us was clearly swamped with tables, tons of bussers and hostess running around, but the wait staff was clearly in the weeds. We ordered 10 minutes after we sat, (not bad). we waited another 30 minutes for our food ( a bit much, but understandable because of the amount of people and it being a holiday). But....My daughter got her food first and myself, my wife and the other member in our party didn't get our food at the same time. The waitress stated the food is being staggered because of the volume, again (why is this my fault?). So 1 person in our party gets to eat all their food and then gets to watch us eat when we finally get our food, does that sound right???so again we wait, 5-10 minutes longer, my daughter is half way through her meal when ours finally comes out.  Bottom line in all this, is the manager clearly does not understand how to properly staff for busy times, the restaurant layout is not toddler friendly, the hostesses need to be properly trained to accommodate busy times and provide customers with accurate time frames. I have been around the restaurant business for 30+ years, so i know a thing or two about how a restaurant should be properly ran during slow times as well as busy times / holidays. Unfortunately i will not be frequenting this restaurant again until some serious changes have been made.

xt8P0bsqzqd_2dHH4U8kVw.text: we went for breakfast. we ordered this type of eggs benedict, it was the hash house original. it came out covered completely with this red pepper sauce so that you couldn't see what was underneath. not appealing to look out, it was just an egg patty on their biscuit halves which were pretty hard with some spinach leaves and tomato slices, over mashed potatoes. you had to scrape the sauce off to see what was underneath, it was a little overwhelming. they asked if we wanted some of there homemade jam, we got a little serving size which couldn't have been more than a tsp. anyway, they need to back off on the sauce, you couldn't taste anything else.

17jlHUgH5dn8OrCK43hjfQ.text: The worst meal I've had since arriving in Vegas 6 weeks ago.  I ordered the chorizo & eggs & there was enough jalapenos on the chorizo to cover an entire order of nachos.  I pulled at least 30 off of it.  My husband ordered the hash & eggs & the hash is stringy & soggy.  Not "crisped" at all.

tw4U20I5c8Qgg-iRB2PwXQ.text: We went on a Thursday night and arrived at 4:55 p.m. The hostess had to finish her private conversation before taking our name. We had a wait of 5 minutes when it was obvious that more than sufficient seating was available. The font on the menu had to be a 10pt. and difficult to read. Our waiter, Robert, who it turns out was also the bartender was busy with the bar and we waited an additional 5 minutes to place our order. I only knew his name because I had to ask since he had no name tag. He caustically told me it was for me to ask him his name so we could build a relationship. What? It was more like being at Walmart when the ambiance consisted of some one screaming out, "Order up! Runner".  It's not like we will ever go back because of the food. The bbq chicken sandwich was cold and on the pink side. And, bbq was a misnomer since there was less than a tablespoon of sauce on the entire bun. When we asked for mayonnaise, that was another tablespoon. Again, we will never go back again. What a waste of our money. Upon leaving I asked for a comment card and was told they could give me a piece of paper to leave a note.

Ex8vLbGGnR-ky4BMhZZeJQ.text: The items on the menu looked different and delicious so I was disappointed when my food came out with a long hair in my biscuit, twisted around my bacon and resting on my eggs. My girlfriends salmon Benedict was cold and not as great as it looked. I didn't finish my basic breakfast combo because I had lost my appetite seeing the hair in my food (which I know was a mistake) but the waiter had showed little remorse and still proceeded to bring us the bill not mentioning anything about the meal being taken off the check. The next time the waiter came around he gestured to the check asking if it was ready, that is when I told him we were not paying for a meal we didn't consume. He then got the manager, the manager then came, talked to us and said everyone in the kitchen wears a hair net and that she'd go check the kitchen and be back momentarily. She had us waiting no joke 15 minutes. I placed what was owed for my girlfriends meal in the check presenter and left. The costumer service was really disappointing, I would have gone back giving the food another chance but unfortunately the staff prevented that.

pmqIuz10e5cW2Mm6l_9riA.text: I was here on December 27th...& I'm finally getting around to writing this review. My mom sis & I stopped in after our long drive from California to Vegas we had time to spare before checking into our room so hey why not try this place. Umm ya disappointment. We were so excited to finally try out this place and it was seriously lacking. The food portions were huge but the flavor was not there. The pancake was gigantic heavy and thick, I had to soak that thing in syrup. My sister got the meatloaf which she didn't like ,& my mom got the chicken and waffles and was the only one completely satisfied out of the 3. Being ur 1st time here it took us awhile to order but if the waitress would have explained the menu it wouldn't have taken that long at all. For whatever reason the waitress ended up giving out table to the bartender after our food came idk what that was about. All in all I was not impressed by hash house a go go sadly, maybe I'll give their San Diego location a try & see if they can redeem themselves.

Em2wgMcA-_1wTSbfjs4ygg.text: Don't know if this is the right restaurant to review.  There are five other reviews spots for this one location on yelp... and boy they didn't have a good experience either.  This is my second time at this location.  First time my boss wanted me to go for lunch.  I have to say luckily I was with my boss because our wait was over 30 minutes.  The food was OK but the portions were big.  I ordered the Pork Tenderloin.  I guess I am a snob when it comes to this sandwich.  I grew up in Illinois/Indiana and I have to say this was the most bland pork tenderloin I have had.  Thank God for the ketchup and the pickles.  The breading was not great.  The music was very loud... loud enough that we had to scream our order to our waitress.  Our server was Nichoal and she seemed friendly and attentive.  For that visit I would give about a 3 star.  But my family wanted to try this restaurant so we went today.  I WILL NEVER BE BACK.  Our food was slow and came out in shifts.  First plate came out and then my plate which was the last one showed up about 25 minutes later.  My waiter Mike was very apologetic and tried to be accommodating under the situation.  It was still just as loud. I asked for a manager and they acted like they couldn't care less.  You really shouldn't belittle your employees in ear shot of your customers and you probably shouldn't use that same attitude to then speak to your customer.

DxFFC6qp_aFYxUxk2dFHwg.text: My boyfriend and I decided to give this place a second try. We had previously been to another location. The review I am giving is based upon what we ordered. My boyfriend was craving hash so he ordered corn beef hash with scrambled eggs. I wanted an omlette but they don't make omlettes. I thought this was strange. So I ordered a healthy option scrambled egg whites with peppers and mushrooms which was supposed to come with assorted fruit.  OK so the hash wad a big disappointment.  It was only shredded corned beef over wedged potatoes with a little cheese. Not what we expected. Mine egg whites with mushrooms came with red peppers which I didn't really expect. They should probably specify that the peppers are red not green because they taste very different. Instead of an assortment of fruit, my meal came with a watermelon wedge and two orange slices? Eh. They use watermelon wedges and orange slices as garnish on their drinks do I got a side of garnish. We didn't order specialty drinks but saw a few pass by and they looked good. Also saw a really large sandwich pass by us. Maybe you just have to know what to order at this place  a large OJ was $5.99. This place was over priced for us and I doubt we will be back,  though the service was good.

G_nOcnzXVlqm6j3aqB3QYw.text: If I could rate this zero stars I would. My husband and I both worked as servers in the past so we know how things should be done....and we aren't divas. We understand being in the weeds. But that was far from the issue in this place. We called ahead for our table of six. For 5:30. The place was nearly empty and they still weren't ready for us. It took nearly 10 minutes to get water. And another 10 to get drinks. They messed up my daughters order twice...and when we asked for the chicken we ordered to be on the quesadilla to actually be on it instead of on the side that said they don't do it that way until my husband threw a fit. When we finally got our meals 40 minutes after we sat down they were fine. Just fine. Not enough to make up for the TWO dirty wine glasses, fork that was knocked on the floor by the server and just set back on the table, server arguing with the bartender and SIX employees standing outside the kitchen munching on fries and high fiving each other while we were waiting for service. We will never go back to this location. And there's no way it will survive in its current state anyway. So, next time we want a chicken Benny we will fight the strip rather than the employees.

lzPEgJycEK28MyHOopY8sw.text: My boyfriend and I had been wanting to try this place out for a while now, having heard how great it was. Well. Our experience was not all that great. We came in around 10:30 on a Sunday morning. We were told the wait time was about 20-25 minutes, which was fine. 35 minutes later... we were seated and noticed a LOT of empty tables and we were left wondering why the wait time took so long if there were so many open tables. Whatever. So by this point it's 11:10 when we finally get situated and start looking over the menu. I wanted the egg scramble with sun dried tomato, basil, and goat cheese but wanted to add some avocado and mushroom. I asked our server if I could add those two items to my meal; apparently the chefs are "unable to change the ingredients." What?! Adding TWO things to my scramble was that much of an inconvenience? I've never heard of such a thing, and I eat out A LOT. She finally relented and made it happen but it was still odd. 35 minutes later we're still waiting for our food and I notice that two groups of people who got sat AFTER us were getting their food BEFORE us. As soon as I was about to ask where the heck our food was, long and behold it finally came. Side note: I asked for fruit on the side, which ended up being ONE piece of honeydew melon... um seriously? That's all the fruit on the side I get? My boyfriend didn't even ask for fruit on the side and he got the same exact thing. Overall, the food was okay at best. Wasn't anything super spectacular. Don't get me wrong, it was good. But not worth all that wait. Service was slow, they weren't very friendly, and the food was okay. That was the first time I went to Hash House A Go Go, and that'll be the last time as well.

NlLk2Dv_D-eP-t8eatyW9w.text: Not a good place to come- you'll wait for days before they seat you (they have plenty of open tables) and when they do seat you - you will still wait for any waiter to even acknowledge you. Save yourself the trip. IHOP's service is better than this!

GrnOWpSP8q7bAKYHcEwhsg.text: We ate at a Hash House A Go Go in San Diego and REALLY LOVED IT... So we decided we must try this one while in the area too.  it was nice, but not as nice as the original one in San Diego.  The menu was just as wild and it's fresh too!  Food was nice and tasty.  Service was great, the server was happy to be there, happy to explain the various dishes.    The restaurant was decorated nicely and very clean.  If you've never been, you should give it a try!

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Henderson, NV, United States. Healthy Egg Whites w/Spinach &amp; Mushrooms
Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Henderson, NV, United States. Corned Beef &amp; Eggs Skillet

jjLMVoWXpiwVGCGIhNh2zQ.text: Large portions, great drinks, and nice atmosphere what else can you ask for... This was my first time here and it was great. The food was good and our server Aimee was a complete pleasure.   Most definitely will be coming back for round 2 ... :D

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Henderson, NV, United States. This is a cute place... The decor throughout was well thought out...

5ZURX8UQufAZ4r0uu9Z6KQ.text: Hey so first of all the waitress was Fantastic!!! Now the food was good but...we arrived and ordered 2 of their take home glass twisted drinks my boyfriend ordered a Long Island ice tea and I ordered a watermelon kiwi something or other and to my shock the said here is your drink but the liquor that is so pose to be in the drink came as a tiny shot on the side!? So I ordered a extras shot and poured it in but didn't get charged for the shots so that was awesome, then we ordered our food and the portions were crazy, to say the least.  Well let's just say my food was cold and my boyfriends was hot but that didn't stop me from devouring it needless to say over all very very good!!

hrA4S3Vmi5Ca1kdcrtqN_A.text: We arrived around 3:30pm, the restaurant wasn't very busy. Our waiter with the twirly mustache was great. Sorry I'm bad with remembering names. Clean and organized restaurant. We ordered apple smoked bacon mash potato burger with sweet potato fries and corned beef sandwich on rye bread with salad. They were very tasty.  Large portions!!!! Be very hungry.

kB7s9SrKL3xjtHXbGtsrNA.text: My Thanksgiving with a view of my football games at a table instead of at the bar.  I loved the sweet potato tucked under the turkey & I had a ham on the side from the brunch menu.

957a62zMVU_geGtDkT24gA.text: HUGE portions and awesome food... the service is a little slow for how empty the place was the last times we went, but food is always great!

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Henderson, NV, United States. Chicken pot pie and spicy chicken
Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Henderson, NV, United States. Chorizo hash and chicken fried steak

Ze3Iscu23Rfa6Z7CPoAJEg.text: The breakfast proportions are GINORMOUS, which would have been okay if I knew about it. This is my first time eating here, and the server did not tell me about the food itself. I'm a very small person--with braces-- and I couldn't even bite into the BBBLT. Once I tried to cut into the sandwich, it fell apart and was completely unmanageable. The Mac and cheese was decent but it was sort of gritty and flavorless. I told the server that I couldn't eat it and she ignored me and gave me the receipt. If you don't have a big appetite, I wouldn't suggest eating here.

DoSJeuUua6xTKKZ2_4eGTg.text: Came in the Las Vegas for a convention and had to grab me some hash house. I had never been to this location but we're staying near. Our server Megan was the best. She had very professional and great service. If you come here see if you can get her is your server you won't be disappointed. By the way the food is amazing.

m1EetHJ1-lm0wUheUUAHOQ.text: Not impressed, Henderson is batting 1 for three as far as new restaurants go in the area. Miller's ale house is terrible, outback is pretty good, hash house was marginal,   My wife had the chicken pot pie. ..it was pretty ok. I had the chicken and waffles. ..the waffles were good  (hard to screw that up ) but the chicken tasted like cardboard. ...blah  Service was terrible, but everyone is new, so I give them a pass in that...I'll give it another try and update this as needed   GL

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Henderson, NV, United States

_s9Pl5wGUH1N1yAZ_tVdSw.text: I have been a bartender/ server for 6 years so I understand when someone is in the weeds (overwhelmed with too many tables), which Rachel R. seemed to be.  But when she would come to the table she almost never even looked at us. She would pass by and ask "is everything good" and immediately be walking away before we could even think of a response. I felt almost offended by her inability too take even a moment with us.  That being said she did get us what we asked for.  On to the food. If you like potatoes and starches this is the restaurant for you. The giant oversized portions are heavy potato and biscuit with little care to the actual vegetable or protein on the dish.   Chicken fried steak was a big burnt piece of gristle with a ton of potatoes and a giant biscuit. To add 2 small eggs that meal is 18.99.  Corn beef wasn't terrible but again a ton of potato and a big biscuit take up most of the skillet for 14.79.  My grandmother had this monolith of a quesadilla. 13.99.  It looked good at first but yet again a ton of potato  inside the quesadilla but for good measure a giant heap of mashed potatoes is underneath. Which is why people probably complement the portion size here.  All dishes came with a sliver of  cantaloupe. We also had a titos bloody Mary 11.99 and a blue moon 5.95.    I have no problem paying 70 dollars for a breakfast if it's delicious or even if the service is good but I left feeling very disappointed. It's called hash house but their hash is really just big cubes of potato. (Maybe I'm crazy but I thought shredded potato with a bit of seasoning was hash browns. Just preference I guess). I dont see myself coming back here again especially since there are so many better places for breakfast/ lunch for less price.  I recommend The Cracked Egg instead.

uBBerAd7466f2_BKe9X_3g.text: I actually thought the response from Hash House a bit on the insulting side.  If the couple had reservations then why were they told it would be 20 minutes. And why walk them an unusual route behind the bar to a table not 30 feet away.  Ya, I suppose I buy all that.  Will definitely never return now!

XPeyI8fr71SxRJokYNgk6Q.text: Food was good, huge portions as everyone has said. I got the pancake. Yes singular, and that was more than enough. I ate about 3/4 of it. Other items on the menu looked good too.  WIsh the service was a bit better, but it could have been worse. Check it out, its really close to the Sunset Station Hotel/Casino

pF62RRVmcoVZHcnJd3FQDg.text: So I decided to come back and give the place another chance to see if it had settled in a bit. Great news: it has!  Improvements were immediately noticeable, servers were able to take and deliver orders well, tables all over the restaurant were being used, only a small line to get in (which was being handled orderly and quickly), etc. This has become a place that I would actually recommend, especially for breakfast in that area. The food was great and I will likely be back! Job well done.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Henderson, NV, United States. S&#39;more mocha, a fun drink to try.
Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Henderson, NV, United States. Burgers are delicious.

-rmNteq5sbm5S9rKv1y1fQ.text: Huge flavorful portions!  Prompt and courteous customer service.  We go to Hash House A Go Go every time we visit Las Vegas and have never been disappointed.  Eat and Be Merry!

Ko8NRUzNgPH5fRInITtSKw.text: A genuine culinary adventure. Great menu with a unique and diverse selection.   Be prepared for a wait on Sunday.

q_CHTgNmqk38ZjWZfPlP2w.text: The food was good but service was so-so. The coffee drinks are not worth the price. The caramel mocha tastes just like the one from McDonald's. It took them over 15min to bring us one after we were done with our food, when they finally brought the drink, they did not apologize for the wait nor did they try to do anything special when they were aware that we were there for a birthday.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Henderson, NV, United States. Biscuits and gravy with scrambled eggs.
Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Henderson, NV, United States. Close up of the Chicken Fried Steak.
Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Henderson, NV, United States. Chicken Fried Steak with sunny side up eggs.

QQ2IxlWg-3p0t3osNbFYfw.text: How this place how 3 stars is beyond me! I knew and loved this place from when I lived in San Diego and now that there is a brand new location right by my place in Vegas I am beyond thrilled! The best part is this one is open all day not just breakfast like I've always known it to be in San Diego. Had a happy hour cab wine which was good, and the Mac and cheese with bacon yum! The food is ginormous, so if you are not hungry or you are on a diet this would be a bad place for you... Although I guess you could just do a side of oatmeal :/. I have never had a bad meal here and the presentation of the food is just so fun! Great place to bring out of towers who don't know about this gem of a restaurant. This location is great, it's new and clean and the staff was supper nice.

TmhJtbCYLnlpZnzDDi2x1Q.text: Great food great service would recommend to anyone traveling to Vegas the staff is friendly great atmosphere fun for family a must when you travel Vegas landmark

arp6EneIa40OGDsBEKQ3uw.text: Everyone was very nice from the walk in to the table. Great service. Tracey was our server and she was both friendly and funny. Delightful lady. Good food good service

IhtsEA6l1YN2pVLe5ynq_Q.text: Went with a pretty big group and the staff was able to accommodate. The portions were HUGE. I had the skillet with crunchy potatoes, chorizo and eggs. The chorizo was pretty spicy.  Other than the healthy portions, I wasn't too impressed. Maybe I should've tried the House special. Everyone in the group was very happy with their meals. Bold flavors and not to mention the fresh fruit we all got.

1Cm7Z98fCVAh6Bq3Uk3JQw.text: Nice environment, awesome waitresses & service. The food is fantastic and portions they serve make it worth the money.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Henderson, NV, United States
Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Henderson, NV, United States. This just opened so not all the busy, just the way I like it.

TOQH4jS56Jc1aIhpIiw4Tw.text: Food was amazing as always with large portions. Would always keep going back. The alcohol glasses are nice. If you buy the drink you get to keep the glass.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Henderson, NV, United States
Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Henderson, NV, United States

-UbWve6Yh_hKpVmN9F18vg.text: Just tried to eat there but we were turned away. There was hardly anyone there with empty tables everywhere. We had 6 in our party and they said they only could use one table and we would have to wait for them to finish eating before we could be seated. Really?? An EMPTY restaurant with tables everywhere and you can't seat a family of 6. We waited 5 minutes for someone to even acknowledge there were customers even waiting to be seated. We left and will NOT be back to that location! No wonder the parking lot was empty! Worst customer service ever!! Save yourself and go to a different location!

b0vpLbWebazMoKHWzKrkBA.text: I've been here before, not only is it good, you definitely got your money worth, I say this because they ultimately give you very large portions of food, example I got a Hamburger the size of the plate, I cut it like a pie,four parts, ate section by section at a time till Gone! Could not believe it myself, and other couldn't believe either, I was completely Full.

p0hXGxnt89b8mLtVujp6Xw.text: The food was cooked to perfection. The portions were large. Our server Michelle couldn't have been nicer or more accommodating and the environment was fun and upbeat. We will return.

sdS0rFhS6Jm-zBMZVB--6A.text: Went here for breakfast around 8:15 am had Rachel as our server I'll tell you that girl deserves a raise she was hostess server and our busser she was so pleasant food came out fast and hot she was always there to top off my coffee. Ordered the tractor combo which is a banana pancake potatoes and eggs over easy... my boyfriend got the waffle with bacon inside eggs and potatoes was soo good everything... They were out of Oreo cheesecake so we got a chocolate one instead which was phenomenal would definitely come back love that girl Rachel and her amazing service!!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Henderson, NV, United States

QNbeluxM-WHiMKKWWvUtSQ.text: This place is definately geared for the instagrammers and bloggers. The food is mediocre at best, but it looks interesting and photographs well. I personally wasn't impressed with the food, but the Irish coffee was really good. It's "twisted" (whatever that means) farm food, so don't be surprised when they don't have white toast, or when your chicken and waffles comes stacked on top of itself for some reason. Additionally, I am looking forward to the sassy clap back of "sorry you didn't enjoy our twisted farm food, it's just not for everyone #sorrynotsorry"

N5NfrpAMUqzUA2dOHVAiqw.text: This place is great!! Huge portions so don't for one person you almost have to share. The price is just right especially if you share your meal.   Service was excellent and drinks were tasty.

t54h5xmhiwWq9VyqIZ7duw.text: If I can give 0 stars I would!! 3 hosts in the front desk we're rude and didn't even know how to handle a seating for a party of 10. We came in and and never had any issurs. This location is just terrible personal. We didn't appreciate that. We had Family members from another country visiting us and thought we could take them there. But it was an embarrassing situation for us. Never again!!!asked to get seated for a party of 10. 1 said ok, the wait would be about 45 mins. So we said how about separating our tables. We don't need to sit together. So we are standing there for literally at least 5 mins with the 3 hosts in front of us "talking in a lower voice" about where they can seat us, blah  blah, blah. Apparently they go ask a waiter and we overhear them say the waiter didn't want to take a large party. Finally the lady (don't know her name, 1 of them was Stephanie though) Comes back and says, "actually the wait is 45 mins to 1 hour." It was bad service on the hosts and apparently the waiter.  I actually thought that restaurant waiters/servers have to do their job whether its a party of 1 or a party of 10. Didn't know it was optional to accept a large party. Never again!!

qc5F1Q3r0LtuSUwfHMS5Jg.text: We live right around the corner.  When we moved here 4 years ago, we were thrilled that there was a Hash House opening right down the street.  It was an awesome stop on the Strip whenever we visited.   Awesome!!!  The thrill ended there.  This must be the place where they train staff to go work at the Strip restaurant.  We have gone a few times, with hopes each visit would be better.  NOPE.  While the food is "decent" maybe 7 times out of 10, and the servers are generally friendly (yet, don't plan on seeing them much, and don't plan on them dressing properly for the job), the restaurant itself is a complete joke.  Henderson, NV is in the Mojave desert, but plan to be seated on the "bar side" of the restaurant.  ...The side where the a/c barely works, if at all.  It's RIDICULOUS.  We've been there at prime dinner time more than once.  You WILL be sat next to the bar, whether you want to or not, where the temp hovers around 80-85 degrees on a GOOD day.  However, if you make your way to the bathroom, you will find the other end of the restaurant (the deserted end) is at least 10 degrees cooler.  Oh, and speaking of the restrooms.  We will NEVER return.  The first stall was blood soaked.  And I am NOT exaggerating.  It looked like someone was massacred in this stall.  Blood everywhere.  How's that work for your appetite of overstuffed food on your plate?  One of the most disgusting restaurant experiences I've ever had.

MkSzEznKFtaMkXbV4wy9tQ.text: I feel I must update my previous review.  My wife and I stopped for lunch on Sunday.  We got in with a minimal wait.  Service was a little slow but they were busy.  My wife ordered the pot pie.  Wow what a pie.  The crust was shaped like a sombrero and it was as large as many sombreros.  The filling was scrumptious and creamy with large pieces of carrot and potatoes and a pile of red skinned mashed potatoes hidden underneath.  I had the cobb salad with a side of bacon. The salad was very large and was filled with wonderful blue cheese, bacon bits and large chunks of iceberg that were fresh and crispy.  The tables around us were filled with happy eaters.  We had a great experience and will definitely give another try!

KCzifPzcgnI1NhXbuMEhaA.text: I LOVE the food here, keeps me coming back... BUUUUTTTT,...  I've NEVER had good service. That might not be exactly True, just at the Stephanie location, others have been fine.  Are my expectations too high? I don't think so.  Saying "hello" when I arrive isn't too much, is it? I know it's busy, it's brunch, it's Sunday. I expect to wait. Waiting doesn't bother me. How about no greeting when I arrive or whatsoever? How about serving customers that arrive after me? Specifically that my GF and I grab a seat at the bar, the girls behind the bar discuss what they should do next. We can HEAR them. One changes the channel on the TV, March Madness ya know, she's got to keep up with games. We've been sitting for a bit, it's Sunday, right, that's ok. The last straw is serving customers arriving at the bar after us first!Whaaaattt? The vibe for me is that my business is a burden and bothers the servers. We left and found another brunch place. There isn't a shortage in Henderson. I eat out regularly, more than most, it'll never be here again though.

TZlBM7WWljgEEDRA0n8hQw.text: My boyfriend and I had breakfast here on a weekend and I was immediately impressed with how well they handled the rush and how quick and attentive they are with service. It's a little cramped and very loud, even for a full house.  I tried their signature Bloody Mary and was unfortunately not very impressed. They don't use horseradish which is a little odd, it was just bland and averagely garnished.   The portion sizes were huge!! You won't leave hungry. And I would say style and quality is comparable to a decent diner, the waffle was the highlight of the meal. I'm an eggs Benedict freak and I felt they take a little too much liberty with a classic, without offering anything close to a True classic version- as in Hollandaise sauce and an English muffin. All and all, we will most likely be back in the future, but not with any urgency.

FRh8IT0S4MwFQV_kQOvFiQ.text: I ordered the biscuits and gravy and scrambled eggs with fries. The portions were huge. The fries were crispy and good. The biscuits were okay, but did not have that buttermilk, southern-style taste I was looking for. Also, I did not like that they were drenched in gravy and sitting in a massive pool of it.  Why not drizzle some gravy on the biscuits and then put some on the side to enable the customer to add more if they want to?  I asked for my scrambled eggs well done (as opposed to having an undercooked yolk) and it came back slightly browned and over cooked. The cuisine may suit most, but it is not good enough for me to return.

Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Henderson, NV, United States. Biscuits, gravy, scrambled eggs, fries, tea, and potatoes
Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Henderson, NV, United States. Scrambled eggs, potatoes, bacon and a biscuit

6Xwt0NbRHsNI-waXuAzSvQ.text: Pass by this place allot while shopping or eating near Hash House, but finally made it in and we were pleasantly surprised! A different twist on dishes and so much food you could split what you order. We had the HH Meatloaf hash with two eggs over med and it was scrumptious. We will definitely revisit from time to time.

BNGuAjCtU49XbpQzNZel0w.text: Was there last week for the second time in 18 months. Got the corned beef hash with onion and swiss over a bed of potatoes with 3 eggs. Just as good as I remembered with one exception, it came out luke warm at best. It was a lot and this time I was unable to finish. The left overs the next morning,  when heated properly heated, were so much better. Not gonna sing the food on one experience of cold food tho. It's a "gotta try".

UGXxVzYRuetk2XPxBJFJ_A.text: I've been to the location at the Linq on the strip and service is better at that location.  I asked for my booth seat to be wiped down, because it was wet from the dish tray that was clearly imprinted on the seat.  The greeter just got a wet rag and smudged the seat down and walked away.  So, I took the napkin from the table, wiped it down before I could sit down.  Our waitress was okay, nothing special from the norm.  If it's your first time, I say get a burger.  I tried the pork sandwich which was a crazy 10oz of meat that spilled over on the plate.  Overall, this place offers dramatic displays, with decent food.  This pork was not my favorite, but it wasn't terrible either.  Stick with the burgers.    The fries are great, I get them well done and they do a good job on cooking them.  By the way, they only serve that gigantic, free honey biscuit during evening hours.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Henderson, NV, United States. Pork tenderloin, definitely need to share this one.

piBoBOOiEK4jlTO-dHawwA.text: Country home comfort food, generous portions for a great price not to mention the gigantic pancakes that brought us to this place. Cooked in a griddle, crispy outside and fluffy buttery inside, delicious! Definitely a place to visit when in Vegas!

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Henderson, NV, United States

tmTmRIVMwVOlbOOW8LSJBA.text: Amazing service today given to us by a gentleman named Bren!!!!  Absolutely one of the best servers I've ever had and the food was delicious.

ykuFBCJE2d_LoyZzt9MKmA.text: Gave the place a second chance. They have redeemed themselves!!! Service was a lot better and the food didn't take forever. I'll chalk up all of the issues on the first trip as growing pains

mJvO0DQGWhqcjIBjR6Kg9Q.text: Oh... how I missed the Hash House a Go Go that was located at The M Resort & Casino... until I "discovered" the tractor while driving on Stephanie, right before this location opened.    I was delighted to see the new location and decided to give it a try... as having tried 2 other locations, I was not thrilled.  This location has the right combination of REALLY GOOD food, CLEAN facilities and GREAT service.  Please keep it up!!!

p3Ust0TkXe2GRkgLh2LwVg.text: Today my friend and I decided to go exploring and came across this restaurant. We waited 5 minutes to be seated and then ended up waiting some more. We were in there for at least 15 minutes and nobody came up to us. It was empty in there too. They didnt offer us water or anything. We ended up leaving without anyone noticing up. We went to Outback where we were seated immediately. Won't be going back to Hash house a go go.

aNpsBl5ovTXCnSa4YXZ7fg.text: Was kind of a disappointing trip. Food was very mediocre and our server didn't seem on top of letting us know it was taking longer than usual. We asked to reduce our order because we were on a tight schedule and suddenly our food was going to be 'ready in a few.' We ordered 4 dishes and the portion was out of control. If there was ever a next time....I'd order just the banana pancakes for 4. That is the only dish worth eating again. Saving grace is they comped our drinks and our pancakes and apologized for the wait.

P9u_KByWmxeyq-Z1jbMk9Q.text: Love hash house. The food as they call it is farm sized  portions, it's literally as big as a farm. I have tried several times to finish the eggs Benedict with sage fried chicken that was on man vs. food. I was told that they even made his portions larger. The whole plate weighs in at 32 oz. that's two pounds of awesome food.

WbH4xJHqX6rtMszEeUl7Xw.text: I love love love this place, the first time my boyfriend took me here I was shocked to see how huge their pancakes were. He almost finished it which was a real shocker. The only downside was they didn't have regular ranch & only had cucumber ranch but definitely will be back here again

jFSYgF8zFFKyN17G2NUE6w.text: Went a month after this place opened. Line was long... Waiter an hour.  Sat down and had to request to get ketchup, sugar, refills, etc.  New location so this is typical of new restaurants.  The most disheartening sight was seeing the managers (or supervisors) of this location taking a booth to eat their lunch while there was still a line of customers waiting to be seated.  Tsk tsk.

7VniRXhui0woUz8z1m2muA.text: Best breakfast place I have been to! Tucked away in the cutest upper corner. Staff is very friendly and attentive. Dad ordered the man v food Benedict and claims it is the best breakfast in his life. I ordered the goat cheese omlette and if you love goat cheese like me defiantly recommended. The portion sizes are more than generous and not a bad price. This is a must try in Vegas and strongly encourage the man v food breakfast! We were not even hungry until dinner... Saved us money!

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Henderson, NV, United States. Goat cheese omlette
Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Henderson, NV, United States. Banana French toast
Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Henderson, NV, United States. Man v Food Benedict... GET IT!!

nor09Wj4rPaw6Sm-BCVaOQ.text: Went here on a Friday night with a large party and expected a long wait and to our shock got right in.  The wait staff was great and answered all our questions about the menu.  The portions are definitely HUGE and can be shared if you have a small appetite.  My daughter and I shared the avocado cheddar burger and it was delicious, perfect for sharing. The bloody mary is delicious and has a bunch of goodies in it, one of the best I have had eating out in a while. My father in-law had the chicken pot pie and t was huge and delicious.  Will definitely come back again!

ZenrKrrDQioRw8LVTIr_ig.text: 8:30a on a Saturday.  Expected a crowd., but it's fairly empty. Seated immediately and waitress was attentive and brought beverages quickly. We ordered eggs over and fried chicken and my wife got eggs and bacon.  We waited 15 minutes for the food. My fried chicken need some additional time in the fryer. It was soggy. Eggs were cold. :(   My wife's order for crispy bacon didn't work, but her eggs were warm. We weren't impressed with the texture and taste of their super biscuits either.   If it wasn't for our excellent waitress, I'd have given this place one star.  We won't be back for pricey and poor food.

9KXAO9bnBXS0XENl11D1cw.text: Food okay service lacking ... had the spicy chicken sandwich which was good however I opted for a salad over french fries.  Plate delivered to table with fries so I informed the server ... she apologized and said she'd fix it. Fifteen minutes later brought it up to the girl refreshing drinks.  She said she'd take care of it but nothing.  Meal done and our server asked if we saved room for dessert so I pointed to the fries and said no ... and I now don't have room for the salad you never brought.  Paid and left but after three trips to different Hash House restaurants I've decided they aren't worth the money ... huge portions of so so food isn't worth my money or time.

VvPtPtLeBsUaPyU3qZkwKg.text: Excellent experience. Very kind waitress. I ordered the HH original Benedict. It was excellent and huge portions. My boyfriend went for the French toast and he loved it. A little on the pricey size but well worth it. Portions are big enough for sharing.

ipTA_vpmFpa7zrTqmSg47w.text: The food is not great. The potatoes are overcooked, greasy and over salted. The corned beef hash was boring. Not much more than stringy beef and cheese over the potatoes. Service is so so and the food is overpriced.

xAvKdZ6TqCL6RVz7MJUZvg.text: This location like all the Hash House a Go Go's is AWESOME! You just can't beat the Chicken Eggs Benedict (my fav) or really anything on the menu! If you haven't eaten here before you will be shocked by the size of the portions (just check the pics)... The food tastes as good as the size too. Burgers are awesome, waffles, pancakes, biscuits are delicious, and BBBLT is amazing (you will Love the Amish milk bread this, and some of the other sandwiches comes on!) One last advice, order a Kiwi Watermelon Drink to wash it all down!

SrZWiqYgHvyVxLydfrSY9Q.text: Have been here multiple times for lunch & dinner...always happy!  Great servers, bar tenders & manager.   Pot pie, country fried steak, breakfast & salads...all yummy & amazing portions!!!

FIu_udwMGR1BUYMtkDxKcA.text: Amazing food! Great waitstaff!! Everyone was friendly. Big portions and great drinks!

Y1RrjIkOAMlAzFckg5FXhw.text: okay. the portions here are simply TOO BIG. the food is really good but I didn't eat anything else for a day. and I had less than  half of my chicken and waffles.  I tried two of their espresso drinks! the pistachio one and the mint one. both iced. both great! taste is strong. two shots of espresso in each.   I am looking forward to going back and trying their happy hour 4-7pm menu.   friends got fried chicken Benedict and also fried chicken and eggs plate. basically three different rendition of fried chicken menu items. all great. all too big. none of us finished! but it tasted great.

UZECqYbHVrA7ZxT-am-BYg.text: Every time I come here I always have the BEST experience and BEST food! I haven't had anything on the menu that isn't great.. Everybody is extremely friendly too! :)

ogtoKW8v-7j9MyBHcGzoaA.text: Went for my daughters 13 th bd dinner. No "happy birthday" nothing. Wanted to charge us extra for pickles with our hamburgers.... Really? Service horrible, food just ok. Could have saved $50 and went to In and Out. Extra pickles for burger =free

og9Vk-takqkL2Dro9RKuNg.text: Food was very good. Awesome service!  I moved my table three times to satisfy my kids...staff never lost their smile. Waitress Arieanna was about as good as any fine dining front-waiter.  My 8yr old went to bathroom...wandered...stopped at podium to ask adults for directions. The man there took her, not pointed, took her to the door of the bathroom. Nice touch even though he thought nobody was watching. He was the manager. The food portions are too big, basically making everyone by two meals each...but there ARE leftovers that rock the next day.

o5zYALgJsDLsAv7fIpUjbQ.text: Amazing food and are server Amy was fantastic thank you guys for the great service. I will becoming back next time I am in town.

A2lXd7s9rSNsCuC9hejXRw.text: This was my first, and likely last experience at a Hash House A Go Go. It failed to live up to the hype in my opinion.  My husband had biscuits and gravy, which he said was "fine." That doesn't seem to be an impressive review for the price. I had the buttermilk flapjacks, which apparently is one large flapjack. The problem there is that it seems to get cold too quickly. Mine apparently was already cooling before  they plopped down the ball of butter on top, because it didn't melt. I dragged it around the top for awhile, then just scraped it off to the edge of the plate. I was kind of expecting thick, light and fluffy flapjack(s), but what I got was more of a McFlapjack if you know what I mean. It had that heavy and a little rubbery consistency. It may have started as flour, milk, eggs, etc, but I don't think that happened in this city. I kinda think the mix comes in big hug and they just pour it out onto the griddle.  In all fairness, I came here expecting a breakfast place, and what I got was a bar with an identity crisis. It doesn't seem to know if its a bar or a barn. The waiter's shirt said something about "Farm Food." I guess their farm is in downtown Los Angeles or something. I'm not sure anyone there has done more than drive past a freeway exit that leads eventually to a farm. They seem to be relying on huge portions rather than quality food.

eAgymgmA_Pbe56eidEfgkQ.text: Hash House is well known for their large portions. The food is simple country food with a slight modern twist. The times my boyfriend and I have come here, food and service were great. Staff is extremely friendly, very attentive, and helpful when you have trouble making a selection. Prepare to unbutton your pants because you won't be able to breathe after this.

Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Henderson, NV, United States

2Re6gRKr2lc-TZGDU2xQLw.text: From the moment I walked in door I had great service. Everyone stopped to ask if I needed anything. Never had a moment of waiting for service. And food was amazing

nQw0eVGVKCCTX5j8pQUPHg.text: I had the worst brunch here that I may have ever had. I had the Tractor Driver Combo with a waffle, sausage and scrambled eggs. The waffle was so heavy and thick it was more like a pancake in waffle shape. It was hard to cut it was so cake like. The sausage was the best thing on the plate.   My boyfriend got the Hash House Original Farm Benedict. They definitely go for presentation over palate. More potatoes than anything on the plate and the flavor was lacking any substance.  Our food did not come out together. I had to ask for 2 more servings of syrup as my first serving was less than half full (and I needed it to soften up my waffle to make it edible), we had to ask for knives since there weren't even butter knives offered on the table, and though the waiter was very nice the woman who brought out our food was not very friendly and I felt like we were putting her out by asking for more syrup & knives.   I doubt we'll ever eat here again even though it's very close to our house. The best things we had were the sausage and my lemonade. Sad.

0-MbfQoT4KvZo4n61Ikvhw.text: I was there a little while ago with my honey.  Our waitress was Aimee and she was super attentive, adorable and knows her stuff! As usual, food was AWESOME! !!! Absolutely no complaints here! And thanks. Aimee!

DKJ70FbpvO2ko_J67YYclA.text: The food was good but really could not enjoy because no AC . For the pice of the meals you should be able to afford the electric bill. Will not eat hear again. Service is also slow

6SPRZC1PcswlAgL_nmIVWQ.text: We had Andy man versus food dish.  Incredible.  Can't believe anyone would give it anything but five stars. Our waitress Rachel was the friendliest waitress in a long time. She was extremely attentive to our table as well.  The second dish is a chicken and biscuit it was equally as incredible.

KZDZRQIincgCAkvky-gETw.text: I gave it 4 stars because I went by myself the food was really good but I felt like I couldn't enjoy it because I was sat at the bar and being the only women sitting there around a large group of guys was very uncomfortable I wasn't even offered a table by the hostess which I guess is a little selfish to take a whole table for one person I ended up eating a few bites and taking the rest to go the bartender was very nice and attentive like I said everything was great except being uncomfortable.....

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Henderson, NV, United States. Omgeez to much goodness
Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Henderson, NV, United States

4bGZQLqo0b1vNBgJV7luQg.text: First time here, and loved it! excellent service, our server Jessica was awesome! Great music, and the food was definitely beyond our expectations!

j_ufT7KHM9JqT_Le6ovgQQ.text: My husband and I came here for the first time the other day. The atmosphere was casual and comfortable. I got the Kokomo which is a meatloaf sanddwich and my husband got the corned beef hash. Mine was good, a bit on the greasy side though. My husbands hash was underseasoned and his biscuit was very dry. The corned beef was tender and the best part of the hash. I have to say though our waiter was very attentive. I would say this was nothing particularly special, besides the portion sizes. But the food is really not worth the price. We probably won't be back.

Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Henderson, NV, United States. The Kokomo

jcbI-EK1oTIkjkei29mG6w.text: extra large portions of food for a nice price. in my opinion the service was mediocre and so was the food.

zPQoteZ3hOk-_U1woqdEZw.text: Don't look anywhere else to eat! They have you covered here with some of the best food, service and most generous portions you'll find in all of Henderson!

rhO3kZTOWUCz_wB0xQIl4A.text: I always make it a point to visit hash house while in the Vegas area, the portions are large and the food never disappoints, our usual is the Andy's sage fried chicken and waffles but this time we went for the man vs food special, the chicken egg Benedict with chipotle cream sauce. Holy moly delicious!! So much cream sauce over perfectly crunch fried chicken and mashed potatoes. It's my new favorite and I was overstuffed after splitting the plate. The service at the Stephanie location was good, I have no complaints, however the wait was a little long seeing how many open tables were available. Overall a great experience and even better food.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Henderson, NV, United States. Tractor driver combo with banana brown sugar pancake
Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Henderson, NV, United States. Chicken Benedict with chipotle cream sauce

sxH4mALsjcsQFTDvl1o8lQ.text: I have to admit, I'm obsessed with Hash House and their oversized breakfast portions. Oversized is almost an understatement with this restaurant. I have yet to try their non-breakfast menu because when I think Hash House I think delicious bigger-than-your-head Snickers (or whatever you have a taste for) pancakes and delicious country potatoes. I've dined with others who have ordered the French toast, omelettes, and hashes and they all leave satisfied, as I always do, too! You seriously cannot leave this restaurant still hungry. While the food is always great, in my experiences the service has been a little on the slower side and getting a drink refill may take longer than it should, but the dining room is consistently busy and the servers generally boast a positive attitude despite the (at times) hectic atmosphere.

fkHtSmLwQEPZz6p7ZqB2MA.text: Ugh  This place is the worst I thought that the staff was just mediocre I thought the menu items were like some weird eclectic want to be eccentric, but it's all just done so wrong When the bill came for the first time I can ever remember I actually didn't want to pay the bill I had ordered this horrendous gaudy pot pie.  Nightmare.  My son ordered macaroni and cheese or for kids meal and he actually sent it back I will say that the only thing I can say positive about this restaurant was the Decour was absolutely phenomenal I thought the inside was absolutely gorgeous I do not recommend this restaurant at all unless you just want to go to the bar and drink but this isn't that type of establishment that you would want to hang out with your friends This is the kind of place where the elderly and senior citizens go to broaden their horizons in food

x81Gm8JELOTE5r8Csnv_aA.text: Fun decor. Comfortable booth. The food was AMAZING! We split the crab cake eggs Benedict. It was out of this world. It was a giant crab cake on a moist biscuit on delicious griddle mashed potatoes. It was topped with an amazing chipotle cream sauce. It was so big the two of us couldn't finish it all. We rated this place 4 stars because it was quite noisy, and not even close to full capacity.
