Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Henderson, NV, United States. Outside
Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Henderson, NV, United States. Margie&#39;s famous crab cake eggs Benedict

reYFddVnmTopoZzUKktWaA.text: Hash house has really great food and huge portions. But unfortunately their service is horrible, I went back two more times to make sure it wasn't just a bad day for the server or kitchen. But no the customer service is horrible and for that one reason I never go back.

OXDkxL_aLUcsRzhsv7oN7Q.text: My husband and I went in last week for our date day lunch.  Being in the industry I am very aware.   So first of we were seated rigjt away but it took 7 minutes for anyone to get out drink order and it WANT our waitress it was the hostess who seated us.  When we were ready to order we asked our server if I could substitute breakfast potatoes instead of what they offered.  The waitress automatically said NO , when we asked why . Her answer was because we are not allowed l. My husband asked do you have the potatoes already made . Waitress said yes.. but you still cannot do that. We asked , can we speak to a manager , the waitress SAME her order book closed amd walked away.  5 minutes later the manager came over. She apologized , got us a new server and convinced us to stay (we were about to leave ).  I ordered the Mushroom burger (being a vegatarian).. it was HORRIBLE. . The mushroom was completely burnt .. and I couldn't even eat it after one bite.  My husband ordered the corn beef sandwhich. He had no comaints..  Because of the RUDE service and HORRIBLE food I WILL NOT BE A 3rd time customer.   And the sad thing is the day we went in , it wasn't even busy. . And it still took forever.

oxHv4g3lEun1ooA0fuV3oA.text: I was blown away with the food. I got a bacon avocado burger but quickly had buyers remorse as I saw the mashed potato burger, then the BBBLT. The only reason I'm not giving a 5 star is because the kids meal chicken strips really sucked. Though tender inside, it was brittle outside and the coating had a "dill" taste to it. I later found out it lemon sage. My grandson did not eat his meal and honestly I don't blame him

Tcqp6UtaECq7YRSLJYpfiQ.text: Tried again for Mother's Day. Arrived VERY early and was seated promptly.   I ordered the Tractor breakfast with a pumpkin pancake. I sent the pancake back. Was the batter spoiled? The texture was slimy inside and the flavor was oddly sour. Not pumpkin-y at all. They replaced with a regular pancake which was acceptable.  I say acceptable because, for the price of breakfast, I expect something better. Their pancake syrup is not very maple-y. Is it supposed to be vanilla syrup?   Another person in our party ordered the Fried Chicken Benedict.  I sampled it and it was very tasty.   We've been 3 times to this location. I've ordered something different every time, and I've been disappointed with my order every time. I want to like this place more. The items on the menu all sound really good. But in reality? Meh.

4uhyx1CFDuY7k6vMlwxCRg.text: The service was great, 5 stars. The guy who made a balloon superhero for my nephew gets 5 stars  The food was very mediocre.  Waffle was just ok, an eggo would be just as good. Wife's scramble I could have made at  home easily.  I grew up on a farm in Illinois, so I eagerly ordered the Tenderloin Sandwich. It looked good but was dry and flavorless.    Now for the tragedy. Warning, this is not for the faint of heart: I paid an extra dollar to get the sweet potato fries. When they were delivered I asked for Ranch dressing, and the waiter promptly informed me (as if he gets this question at least 50 times a day)  "We only have cucumber ranch."   Cue record scratch here.   NO RANCH!   I'm pretty sure this is still America, where every restaurant should have Ranch on hand. By not having Ranch, its almost an abuse of trust to even offer sweet potato fries. At least put it in bold ALL CAPS: "NO RANCH" next to the sweet potato fries listing. Like its for people with cucumber allergies.   Whoever thinks cucumber ranch would be an acceptable alternative to normal ranch, needs to go back to the farm for a refresher.   I bet the cucumber ranch would be good as a face mask though.

pa9brl4VZDZYh_P0a7mpdQ.text: We went in around 6:30-9:00pm tonight (Sunday) and it was not busy at all. They close at 9 but they didn't make us feel rushed at all! The hostess made us feel very welcome. Our server, Mathew , was friendly and amazing. We could see he was running quite a few things and still managed to keep up with our drinks and check on us quite a few times. I had the Andy's sage fried chicken eggs Benedict (man vs. food fave) with a hash house salad on the side with extra cucumber dressing. Everything was so delicious I almost finished it all. Very large portions but the leftovers are always even better the next day. My husband had the bacon avocado burger, MIL had the mushroom Swiss burger all were delicious their burgers come with two patties. My son (seven) LOVES the banana pancakes with the cooked banana on the side, it's so yummy he eats the peel and everything lol. It's a super huge pancake definitely something two kids can share easily.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Henderson, NV, United States. Yummy (very sweet) Virgin kiwi, watermelon lemonade. Kids loved it.
Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Henderson, NV, United States. Super huge &#34;crouton&#34; come on the hash house salad. The cucumber dressing is delicious!!

eD7mjZI-1pffxObGaeZ1-g.text: In my opinion, the menu items are a little high priced for Las Vegas, but the portions were really big.  They seem to like to put a big sprig of rosemary into things.  I don't like non-edible garnishes, and a woody sprig of rosemary stuck into my food doesn't impress.  The chicken in the chicken and waffle dish was a little dry (over cooked).  The blueberry pancake was huge and flavorful, but they mashed the syrup container into the pancake and turned the fluffy pancake into a mush under it.  The children's chicken fingers and french fries were OK, but did not seem a healthy choice for kids.

KK_0QI6n3cttXAzP54jMmQ.text: Went for a later breakfast/brunch on a Friday.  Ordered the chicken pot pie and it was devine. My husband ordered a scrumptious bloody Mary and the unforgettable bud in a bag. We thoroughly enjoyed the food but our server Nicole was hands down on top of the server game. We will return ofter just to be served by her!! High five girlfriend...you are the Ace Of HH ...thank you! !

ID5F9qQso4ksS8VRQN90rw.text: We've been wanting to try this chain for a while now and we were happy to find a location near our hotel in Henderson.  We found parking right away and were seated immediately after walking in. After being seated, we were given menus and were told that the server would take our order shortly. The server came, didn't bother asking us if it was our first time there or if we wanted any recommendations. She just took our order and left. After several minutes, someone delivered biscuits without saying anything to us. Since it was our first time there, we didn't know that they had biscuits instead of a bread basket, which most restaurants offered. The biscuit was alright, nothing extraordinary. The jam tasted like Smuckers, right from the jar.  We ordered HH famous sage fried chicken. The cream was too heavy and the chicken was dry. I liked the mashed potatoes and the not-so-crispy bacon.  We knew the order is huge so my husband and I decided to share it. The server knew we were sharing the order but didn't bother giving us plates. Service really lacks at this location. Maybe because they know it's mostly locals who frequent them. I'm sure customer service at HH on the Strip is better because the servers really work hard for their tips.

kRdt2RCH5zGm6YKdXDQL5Q.text: Love the food, costs a little more than I like but like my Grandpa use to say, it cost more to get better quality... so if you want cheap go to McDonalds..

XsjwEJ0gC1Im1dQB-BPVxw.text: I used to eat here for breakfast and it was great.  We tried dinner and its just like truck stop food, maybe comfort food for others as I am not a fan of black bear diner either.   The service was good but the dinner menu is heavy food and tastes heavy as well.  I like to eat and not feel like a at a grease ball.  This stuff would be better as bar food, not a casual diner.

SIOBoe6cB-fleoYZVPaybg.text: The coffee is gourmet excellent, we are here now having brunch at 3 pm because its served all day.My husband is an Indiana native so he loves all the Indiana favorites on the menu lots of griddled mashed potatoes and meatloaf. Man vs food is about to begin because there portions are monstrous. Dine to 80s big hair bands rocking in the background, not too loud tho. Just finished eating and the farm benidict  crab cakes and the sage chicken and we were very impressed , even tho we have been here before they always deliver a   hearty meal we both can enjoy and pick off each others plates. Great food worth the price. Always memorable when we eat here.

w0xHt3KxkiJL-k70OxopJQ.text: Hungry? Then this is the place to go. The portions of the meal is large! The food is great and the staff is friendly.

2SwO_Gj_IAEqf-Yg4u43kw.text: Favorite place to frequent here with family.  Lots of food we end up sharing a plate, but the drinks are fantastic and service is always exceptional.

fYeHbWbeAQOJ3rS7DXeaOQ.text: We came here yesterday and was rather disappointed :/ I hate giving bad reviews. Our server was very nice and good but I got the warm spinach salad with no onions. She did warn me that the salad had onions in there. But I think she should have said like its onion puree dressing making the whole salad taste like onions. I figured it was like pico de galo where it is just cooked with a little bit of onions. Just to warn you about that one. And the hot chocolate isn't good either. It just looks good.

0B9KpnywkFsB5Rbo0FWNGw.text: Tried for the first time today and let me tell you it was amazing and Aimee was absolutely a wonderful waitress. Will definitely be coming back.

MRRXlIAwVkqkCJt4S5-jIQ.text: Great food, great atmosphere! First time here and our family of 9 came this morning (Sunday) and there was no wait  WARNING the portions they serve are huuuuuugggeeeeee!! But overall we had an awesome experience and will likely come again to try different plates

yec3cLaIpiMCxfE1Uvdkjw.text: The food is always on point. The chicken waffles hash and the biscuits are very good. However the service is really lacking. It seems as if there could be staffing issues the hostess was doubling in the bar and the manager was serving. We waited 20 minutes to be seated while more than half of the restaurant was empty. Our server was in the weeds, Im assuming due to staffing issues, it was hard for him to be attentive we didn't get our drinks refilled, the service is REALLY disappointing.Be prepared to wait for your food, but the food is good.

JaVPORkBYUn3xdUnl-aTsA.text: The food was really good but the service was absolutely horrible.  Hostess was rude, server was non existent and it literally took 30 min before they even came and took our drink order.  I haven't been back since: it was a few months ago.  They were not busy kids really wanted to go there, I was super frustrated.  If it weren't for my kids we would have stood up and walked out.  No tip for the server that day.  Didn't even come refill anyone's drinks even when we asked and I had to get the manager to even get my damn check.  If you like the food find a different store than the Stephanie location.  HORRIBLE SERVICE.  It takes a lot for me to get upset!

06-u-IuhmEiV4kQ4hMnWPw.text: Had a really great experience here this past weekend.  Got an awesome deal from Travel Zoo for and app, dinner & drinks for 2, and had been wanting to try Hash House.  We made reservations and were quite surprised we didn't need them; the restaurant was not crowded at all.  Our server, Eddie, was awesome.  He knew about the coupon I presented before I told him what it was, and he gave us plenty of time to look over the menu.  We shared the fried green tomatoes appetizer - it was incredible, so tasty.  I had the chicken & waffles (had to!) and my sis had the fried chicken Benedict.  Yum.  I had the wine spritzer with mango & pineapple...delicious!  Sis had a mojito which was also very good, but she liked mine better and ordered one of those too!  My daughter had a big pancake which made her very happy.  Eddie gave us one of the drinks on the house, which was unexpected and really appreciated!  Although I had the Travel Zoo deal, we agreed that we would've gladly payed full price for this meal.  Will stop here again when we visit Vegas next time.

Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Henderson, NV, United States

z1dGQY_sL2Jw0fYGz5NjNA.text: The food is amazing and you get large portions so go hungry. I specially love their stuffed burger...more then enough to fill you and you do not need the bun. Service sometimes leaves a bit to be desired but the food makes up the difference.

nHHbkyLjJh78_7-5s-5JgA.text: Brought my friends from California here for my friends 21st birthday breakfast, food was amazing, Amy's service was even better. Best breakfast in the area.

xRU41OZUUetOWjiql5mtqw.text: You're in Vegas go anywhere else we ordered 3 meals and they were all pretty bleh you do get a lot of food but they are a bit expensive. The lady working there was nice though!

8Mlc5rIkZNNizBes_BnVHw.text: Umm, so much food on one plate, not a good thing really and kinda weird combinations of food items together.  You only can eat 1/2 of it or less really. Employees are great tho.

WmrvJgxvS6y8e8YTf36QaQ.text: Ordered the Man vs Food bennie and it was True to the name massive, and also delicious.  My wife and I split it and still had leftovers.   Had the whole clan of 5 with us and everyone loved what they ordered, everyone had leftovers.  One daughter ordered chicken fried st8k.  I tried it and it was awesome.  She ate more than usual so that means a lot.    Wife's bloody mary was delicious, replete with it's own slice of toast.   The service was kinda slow and we got someone else's bill before pointing that out to the server.  I almost didn't say anything because it was less than what I expected our bill to be...but then when we got our actual bill, I was rewarded with good karma because it was even less than the other party's bill.  Score!      Definitely recommend for gigantic portions of deliciously food-coma inducing meals and absurd bloodies!

4eJovrHJ2MBi9CJ_TfL_nQ.text: This was our family's first visit here, and I was impressed, stuffed, and excited to return!  Our server was exceptionally cheery and personable - she made sure our drinks never ran dry, and made excellent recommendations for us first-timers. We were fortunate to come here mid-day on a weekday, so there was no wait. Our food: heavens, I don't think I've seen bigger portions! and I mean EVERY person at our table had a gigantic plate. We had leftovers for days. They say this place serves farm food with a twist, and they live up to that name: it was a great mix of comfort food with cool spins, and everything was delicious. I had the Crab Cake Eggs Benedict, and boy, they weren't kidding with that mountain of hash potatoes!  Definitely need to plan a trip back, but not wise to try to come here if you're working on a diet! Expect good food, good service, and exceptional portions! Quality AND quantity in one delicious package!

sevJImiXgirF-z8-Y9s5iA.text: I came here expecting more. I ordered a veggie skillet, veggie omelet and banana pancake. The skillet and omelet left a lot to be desired. The service was subpar. However, I truly did enjoy the banana pancake. It was delicious. Maybe I came on a fluke day, but it isn't somewhere I would plan to visit.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Henderson, NV, United States. Veggie skillet
Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Henderson, NV, United States. Banana pancake

OB-tQ46sz_q3mtGDdEq1ng.text: One of the only farm-to-fork restaurants I know of in Las Vegas! I always make a point to eat here when I'm in town. Love Nicole--funny lady, hard worker! She always makes sure our order is right. The portions at this place are huge, maybe two to three times what most diners give you! There's nothing ordinary about the food except maybe the ingredients, but even then, you can count on everything fresh including house-made biscuits, jams and preserves. My kids love to eat here also!

NfEfQHUNVOYRi6IMwLqL-w.text: OH MY GAWD this place is too good. My first time trying this place was actually in San Diego. Their portions are Gi-Normous but so good. Their breakfast items are usually my favorite, and I've taken mom and dad their once and they loved it just as much.  Their food is just as good as it is in big portions. I would recommend this place at least once for everybody to try! it won't disappoint.

2YOexoXLwdKd7_PyuSqI8g.text: I really liked this place! My husband frequents hash house while in Vegas visiting friends and he kept insisting we eat there at our next visit. I finally gave in and I'm so glad I did! The wait time here was long and the estimate they gave us was easily doubled but I'm glad we waited because the food was great. I had the banana French toast with a side of bacon and I almost finished the huge portion by myself! It was seriously that good. Our server was very sweet and apologetic for the wait time, fortunately our food came out quickly and everything tasted great...so no complaints here. I definitely plan to come back and try the chicken and waffles next time!

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Henderson, NV, United States. Banana French toast!
Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Henderson, NV, United States. Kiwi watermelon lemonade!

5yxxk_p5vU12azidPlC0OA.text: For the food alone I would give it 5 stars because that's simple amazing. But, the service in this location is so disappointing. I've been here twice now and the second time it was even worse. The host on both occasions was unfriendly and she looked acted like she didn't want to be there at all.  My server on my first visit was actually friendly but she did seen rushed.  The other staff seemed uninterested.  On my second visit the staff was very unorganized and not focused on their tables. It felt like they were there to get the tables out asap.  When she took our order she seemed irritated and not genuine. I asked to substitute a side and she rolled her eyes at me and said it was not possible. I explained it was on the first visit and she never said anything about it again up until I got my food.  I've waited 30-40 min for a drink I ordered and I don't mind that when it's busy but it was simply because there was no staff at the bar (I was sitting next to it)  besides what I believe was the manger but she was on the phone for a while looking at all the tickets that came out of the printer but not doing anything about it.  Overall the staff gave me a feeling that they are demotivated and my experience has been unpleasant regarding customer service but like I said I love the food. If I'm going back I'll probably go to a different location. Hopefully the service will be as good as the food.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Henderson, NV, United States
Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Henderson, NV, United States

m404cam5mQsMNIjfXrXKYQ.text: We ordered the country fried steak, red velvet waffles for dessert, a cheeseburger, and the meatloaf. First time trying this restaurant service was great and friendly restaurant was clean and efficient and the prices was reasonable. Will definitely come back here again

DCzBlxxCEuPvy3h3-CcRrw.text: A pretty poor breakfast! Food came out fast, but obviously because it was all precooked and sitting. Bacon was cold and limp. Potatoes were barely warm, bisquit was cold. Eggs were cooked perfect over easy though!

pA6yl48t7WJEWAjDfLYNUA.text: Hash House A Go Go, is an awesome name for a restaurant and they have really good food! The atmosphere was great and decorated for Christmas. Like many reviews have stated, the portions are huge. My daughter got a chocolate chip pancake and it was my only big, but delicious. My wife ordered a goat cheese omelet, with potatoes, fruit and a giant biscuit. The strawberry jelly that came with the biscuit was so good, I ordered an extra one, so I could put extra on the half of the biscuit my wife shared:) I ordered their chicken and biscuits, which was really good, but not something I would order next time. Their burgers looked amazing and I will have to try their fried chicken and waffles, so I can compare it to Metro Diners!

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Henderson, NV, United States
Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Henderson, NV, United States

CuhNChEaL9cqkvb8v4PZaA.text: I don't believe I've written a review for Hash House. Maybe I have, but you can never have too many I guess. So here's another one if I have before. Lol. Well here the prices are good and you get "GOOD" portions and depending on how hungry you are you'll get two (or three) small servings of food on your plate. It depends on what you order. I ordered the stuffed meatloaf which includes: carrots, green beans, lots of thick mashed potatoes, and two slices of meatloaf which turned out to be two meals for me. I don't know if they have dessert (I'm always too full to get it), but if they do I'd recommend you eat half your meal and then get dessert. "Yes, the portions are that big!" Overall I would say my eating experience here has always been good.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Henderson, NV, United States. Stuffed Meatloaf

4QvDnnoCLmN5Z7sJxwU68A.text: So my experience with the food here was no very good. We really wanted to go to Babystacks across the street but it was really full and we didn't want to wait in a very long wait time. So we entered hash house but now we know why it wasn't very full here.  I ordered coffee and I asked if they had any flavored creamer and the waiter said they didn't. He did go on and try to explain to me that he has spoken to management about providing flavored creamer. We then start to order our food to only find out that they also don't have sourdough bread or white bread to go with our breakfast. They only provide wheat or Rye. Well that sucks. When the food arrived to our table the french toast that my daughter ordered was so cold and soggy. Aside from not liking wheat toast our food was ok I guess. Not really going back to eat here. Otherwise the staff was nice it's just my food was not very good.

7Mzf6zVFL_9fQDAgaU0F8Q.text: Participated in a grief/pre planning event put on by Dignity funeral home. They selected this Hash a Go Go for the event and what an empathetic and passionate experience I had. The restaurants ambience adds to this effect. The staff was very professional and patient in aiding the funeral staff and the clients orders.  The manager of the establishment even made his rounds to the back of the restaurant to ensure that all was well for us and we did not need anything.

Dhvaiabr0snLs6fanj_xgg.text: I love hash hash a go go. They have pretty good food with big serving. I love the breakfast with the hot chocolate. Been here many times. Their kiwi watermelon drink is so delicious

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Henderson, NV, United States
Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Henderson, NV, United States
Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Henderson, NV, United States

U81UO2WBJBr1fLTFtChnqA.text: I had the avocado toast and was not disappointed. It's probably one of the liter choices, regarding calories! Some of the dishes are definitely eye catching. If you like to go big with breakfast, this is your place. If I continue to eat here, I'll go big! Lol! So, I'll just stick to the Avocado Toast with some Egg Whites! The server was fantastic. I think this place deserves 5 Stars!

D4Lmn2U6VIBAjFPuYI4Yzw.text: Dulce was an amazing server! Super friendly , kind and patient especially if you have kids. We are coming to this spot in Henderson because of her. The location is super clean, friendly staff, comfortable and inviting ambience too. The bathrooms are always something I judge restaurants on and it was immaculate in there. The food is amazing but the service just is the cherry on top! If you love the 'Hash House a Go Go' then don't go to the strip or any other location, this is sooo worth going out of your way if you're coming to eat here and don't forget to request Dulce as your server! She truly is an amazing server!! Oh yeah and don't forget to come hungry... the portions are huge even for the kiddos :)

aqIahh2r6-vhi2BaZgvEOA.text: Where do I start? Came here cause we heard it was a good place and the staff was just ridiculous and some of the worst customer service I have seen in a long while! Not just to our group either but other costumers as well. The manager didn't even put no effort into trying to help the situation. What a shame!!!

KCYyDzHE-_SR_LXLo3npdA.text: So having visited the HHAGG a few months ago on the strip, I was excited to see that there was a location in Henderson - near our hotel - open for dinner!  I took the servers recommendation of the griddle Meatloaf, with 2 eggs.  It came with mashed potatoes, fruit, and a biscuit.    We started with the fried green tomatoes.  Green - a bit too green - had to have a knife to cut.  We just couldn't find anything about the dish that inspired us.  The seasoning was off, the aioli was off - not sure what it was - but the whole thing just wasn't hitting our palates right.  The meatloaf was massive - but again - nothing really jumped out and said OMG this is good.  Ate about 1/2 of it and pushed the plate away.  TOO many potatoes, NOT ENOUGH gravy/sauce - and what we had was thick as paste.  The biscuit - over cooked - hard - HARD exterior - the interior was ok... but disappointing as well.  The whole plate was thick, heavy, and more bland than I would have expected.  Lots of food, not a lot of excitement. Such an opposite experience from their signature breakfast hash.

lR9wmN3Ho-HFjp8iNJ768w.text: Amazing food & Great service! Giant portions, and the cocktails were amazing...would recommend to Anyone in the area!!  Food was consistent, last hash house we went too was in Orlando and was also amazing!

rwsnqpODsH9-C7JhTcPguQ.text: Meh. I wasn't impressed. It's as if they tried too hard. The Bloody Mary was decent but the big straw is a struggle with lemon seeds and ice chips. Someone ought to test that idea again.   The breakfast potatoes are a seasoning salt nightmare. What a waste of the most important part of the meal.   Portions are huge. Burger was clever and good.   Service was epic and the reason I gave it 3 stars.   Flip flops no problem

sGb18gfJ1PMWGZCQyA0jpg.text: I had heard good reviews about this place so I decided to give it a try. Don't let the cheap cowboy interior turn you off, this food was delicious. The fried pickles were out of this world delicious. And the service was awesome.

q0YIGeOQiCGYV3rNHLeFfw.text: My daughter and I are tying all of the cool Vegas/Henderson breakfast locations. There was three of us. Two kids that ordered fa kids breakfast and myself. The only gripe was the price. Our total for 2 kids meals and one adult breakfast was $75.52. That was after tipping 25%. I think it's a tad bit pricey, but food and service were great.

7dUHDIamMMYRty5C1JKn3A.text: This place has amazing food ! Pancakes are bigger than my whole face . The Andy Egg Benedict was soooooo good . Great customer service. And my pancakes came in a pizza box

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Henderson, NV, United States
Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Henderson, NV, United States
Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Henderson, NV, United States

UhdzCCerI2oPjNfSkCEg_w.text: Great food, crappy service. A food runner brought us meatloaf instead of chicken and waffles and really had the audacity to give attitude to our party. We were shocked. Not trying to discourage anyone to give this place a try, the food it great. But 2 out of the 3 times I've been here, the service was bad.

vJU4qcJrP5-4GMaZvQp7wQ.text: Just had lunch there with my family . My first visit and sorry to say it will be my last. Food was terrible.   Giant portions but it's so bad you can't eat it.  Burgers so greasy the buns ate soaked no flavor and  salad soggy and drenched    All service was  just ok.   The prices are really high and it was just aweful.

t81N8U9NOtzhhbzk7j_dOg.text: I'd heard great things about some of their other locations.  The reviews are right the portions are huge.  But the food was really mediocre.  The service was good, but the food was pretty greasy and not that tasty.

gBcv4WH27oJ6m51cIOyEJw.text: The service is friendly. The food is average and bland, served in giant quantities. The Bloody Mary was the highlight of flavors.

UvwkRZHPq_pimp3KU_X_8A.text: Received a coupon via email: Tax Day! $10.40 off; and in fine print says to print out. This didn't deter me. I've seen that before and folks scan or take the deal off your phone. So we go and I ask the hostess immediately, will they take the coupon from the phone? She says it has to be printed and said she'd ask the manager to confirm. She returns and says again, "Yes, it must be printed."  Imagine how many people who would have "about faced"...the business lost. I asked to speak to the manager. He comes out and I say what if you don't own a printer? I'm a frequent Hash House patron, spent plenty of money. He immediately suggests I forward it to him and he'd print it. Problem resolved!  Tyler, the general manager, of this location knows and lives by the mantra "Make the customer happy!" Great customer relations!!!

1isMOvtfqPqpGDHh8l-upQ.text: Hash House is a must when you go to Vegas. The portions are huge, the food is great, and the drinks are amazing. I don't think I've ever had anything from this place that wasn't good. I've only had Half the breakfast/brunch menu, and all of it was good. Haven't tried anything from the lunch menu though. My favorites are the Bloody Mary and the chicken and waffles. You will not regret it.

QxPg4X_aiReFIq0S-XhIsg.text: This was the first time that my hubby and I have eaten here. We just moved to the area and wanted to find a good brunch spot. We got there around noon and there was about a 20 minute wait which isn't bad. The table we sat at was really small and the place was packed so we couldn't ask for a different table. They have so many options on the menu for whatever you're craving. After we order the food came out within 15 minutes! Everything was hot and exactly how we ordered it. We got the pineapple mimosa which I would highly recommend! I would give it 5 stars but the portions are just wayyy to big. I hate wasting food and it's an outrageous amount of food that you are served. There is a guarantee that you won't leave hungry! I would highly recommend this place if you're super hungry. I will post what I ordered below.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Henderson, NV, United States

r5s0JnXYelbNcdQtznP2UQ.text: I've been to this Hash House location several times and it never disappoints me! The food portions are astronomical, so either bring a maaaajor appetite (a visit to a local cannabis dispensary before would be recommended) or plan to share a dish with someone. Nichole took amazing care of my friend's and I (my friends had gotten married nearby that morning). Nichole was fast, friendly, and efficient. She clearly knew what she was doing and was on top of everything. I had the safe fried chicken this time (I usually do the chicken n waffles, but switched it up slightly). Nichole was a master of up-selling (I'm glad I got the gravy and the extra syrup and was worth it). Visit Vegas regularly for work and make it a point to visit Hash House each time I'm here. Nichole deserves a raise! Thanks for taking amazing care of us last weekend!

co4hbNm8GtjkHZe_g4h-rA.text: Its okay...way over priced. Yes the portions are large but the food doesn't save well so unless you want to eat a whole cow at one sitting its not worth it. The food wasn't bad and didn't make us sick or anything it just wasn't really great either. I dont believe we will go back as there are so many better and cheaper options available.

96bscDFxmINNVQAR-fB4mw.text: Tried the friend green tomato stack. Fabulous!! And beautifully presented. I tried the kiwi watermelon signature cocktail, ordered two. My family all loved their plates of chicken friend steak from my brother in law that said it was amazing! My nephew had Cobb salad, he said it was "pretty bomb". My other nephew said the burger was delicious! My husband had the fried chicken and waffles and said it was phenomenal. I don't know how they have poor reviews!

e0-TK1XNVKYccdEcluWDNQ.text: We waited 10 minutes for a table but it looked like there were empty tables . We were seated and it took some time for us to order because we were so indecisive . Anyway , we finally ordered ... My son and hubby got the Andy's chicken and waffles , I got the mushroom and Swiss burger with sweet potatoe fries. My little ones for the  ordered  French toast plate .  My order was just ok , it was massive and I ate half but I thought it was just ok. My little ones enjoyed their kids French Toast . It came with sausage and an egg. My son LOVED his towering chicken and waffles . Mind you this pile of food is massive .He said the chicken was tender , crunchy and flavorful . My hubby not so much . He thought the haystack of dried grass was too distracting and didn't care for the seasoning in the  chicken or the waffles . Our waitress was ok she asked if we needed anything . I mean my water was empty but never offered to refill it . oh well .  Some go above and beyond mediocre service. Not in this case .

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Henderson, NV, United States. Hubby didn&#39;t really care for his chicken and waffles . He said the dried haystack on top was too distracting ...
Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Henderson, NV, United States. My big boy happy with his chicken and waffles !!

rLdut2Dl6jyy1m6jnUFO2Q.text: Creative and beautiful dishes. Food and service is great. Love going on a lazy Sunday for brunch and mimosas :).

I6QwLaAQ4kHiNkizyCEu5A.text: Food was AMAZING. Good portions. Great service and coffee was delicious. We ate here twice on our 3 day visit to Vegas. This location wasn't as busy as the location on the strip but it was just as delicious.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Henderson, NV, United States. A must try if you&#39;re in town
Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Henderson, NV, United States. Chicken and eggs. Mashed potatoes are so creamy and smooth and the eggs are soooo fluffy
Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Henderson, NV, United States. Banana and brown sugar pancakes. AMAZING

qFke1wI4q4k6BEPNCdZ91w.text: Be warned - servings are huge and really yummy! Service was wonderful! Aimee B you rock!

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Henderson, NV, United States. Sunday brunch  crab cake Benedict. Huge! Split it with Tom.  Delicious and feeling even when split with Tom.
Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Henderson, NV, United States. Back again for more of that Hash House Salad with grilled Salmon. Yum!
Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Henderson, NV, United States

W-A7ue43miT6lhZ-fa4C6w.text: Great food. Good service. Huge portions. Prices in line with the size of the portions. Pot pie can feed a couple people. The pancake is the size of a wagon wheel. E

dBF-FA5T8pKEgRus9Zu1GQ.text: Brunch today. We tried a number of dishes: Corn beef hash - nicely flavored corn beef mixed with cheese, bell pepper and onion. It was served on a bed of skillet potatoes that were kind of bland and overcooked. Probably pass next time. We've had better  Griddled French toast - one of our favorites, served with griddled bananas. Almost tastes like bananas foster with the Carmelized bananas with syrup and butter over the thick sliced toast. We had the combo with scrambled eggs and bacon. The bacon was real smoky and thick cut. Still amongst the top of their dishes.  Beat Salad - this is a big salad with sliced red and gold beets over a bed of romaine. It had sliced globe tomatoes and dressed with balsamic, feta cheese and candied walnuts. Comes with a side of balsamic vinaigrette. If you like beet salads this was a winner

kAzxVhvLdqmOiRWqd9f6nw.text: This location is great! It's huge and we've never waited too long here even when it's busy. The food comes out quick and is always great. Portions are huge so share!

Pmg-dRGMgKp0rduXv2h4Zw.text: Hash house is overrated. You look for quantity over quality this is it. I Had salmon Benny my bf had the mushroom burger. Both had good aspects but overall wasn't great. The waiters were nice. They tried. Wouldn't come back though.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Henderson, NV, United States. Salmon eggs Benny

jW6mDz8W_SMSXJ_3DMAKhw.text: Best chicken fried steak and Bloody Mary I've ever had. Steak portion was huge--shared and still full! Waitress was very nice. Cool music!

kwX5Zb76Wt8SMqx8GkRQxw.text: They are breaking in the staff with a slightly condensed version of the menus you will find at other locations. Sage chicken and waffles is on the menu and only $14.99 from the regular $16.99... which is still a buck cheaper then their location by the Linq. They have half price wine on Mondays as well. No Miscato in the lineup at this time. 8 ( .... the kids menu is loaded with more options then most places. FYI. .. the ladies restroom has large gaps where the stall walls attach behind the toilets. .. if you don't want an audience avoid the middle stall and the first stall if you do not wish to be an audience member. This location is much nicer and has a better ambiance with out clustered walls full of dusty celebrity visit photos. Opening day and you can hear your conversation at your table unlike locations on the strip. Soooo happy they are finally open!  Hash House!

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Henderson, NV, United States. Chicken and waffles... waffles are noticeably smaller then what is served at other locations. Never finish this any
Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Henderson, NV, United States. Happy hour... do note that these specials are only available in the bar area.
Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Henderson, NV, United States. Kids menu.

bUG743An4RPy6U9Cv7MUZA.text: The food was AMAZING!  I had the Capt Crunch French Toast it had grilled bananas and pecans on it!  My son had the Buttermilk Sage Chicken and waffles.  The waffles were cooked around strips of bacon!  My hubby had the stuffed burger with mashed potatoes on the burger!  The food was absolutely FABULOUS!

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Henderson, NV, United States. Capt Crunch French Toast
Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Henderson, NV, United States. Stuffed burger
Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Henderson, NV, United States. Chicken and Waffles!

mIIi3NbPlefYTcDFrbViLw.text: This was everything I had hoped for & more. I had always passed by the original HH in San Diego and saw the never-ending long lines to be seated, so this was my first time delving into the deliciousness that is Hash House. The myriad of flavors combined with the plethora of options left me engorged and satisfied. As a party of 4, we only needed 3 entrees to more than fill us up. *Chicken & Waffles rivals Roscoe's thanks to the homemade soy sauce. *Pub Crawl had very savory corned beef that is cured on site. *Pecan French Toast with fried banana was almost too sweet. Almost. Oh, and the Bloody Mary was spicy, which I appreciate greatly. It comes with bacon, tomato and lettuce at the top of the cup. Strange way to prepare it, but "you had me at bacon." Great service, too. Our waitress was very knowledgeable and gave good recommendations.

2_kT6-vopwgLdXp5gBUCIg.text: Had a horrible experience here!  We love the hash house at Rio, so we're so excited to have one close to the house.  Wow were we disappointed.  Place was half empty when we arrived at 7:00 pm and still had to wait for 20 minutes to get a table.  Once seated we had to wait for drinks, and food that finally arrived at 8:20.  We actually never had a server, but 3 different people that never really helped.  I asked for a side ranch with my fries and the waitress just dumped it at the table without a word.  Sweet potato fries were horrible and the burger I got was dried out!  Side note: went for breakfast this morning and they stated there was a wait of over an hour and there were at least 15 tables empty!!!!!! Won't be going here again.

xjISZ9jC-zp2j50CnRqpPw.text: Came today (Sunday) with my family, there were 12 of us. Literally no one was in there besides the staff and they still took a little while before they got everything together and sat us down. When we sat down, we all noticed our forks and knives were pretty dirty. My 11 year old asked for new utensils and the guy was being a bit snarky and said he would bring us new ones. Bringing us new ones didn't help half of us bc they were still frickn dirty. Then our waitress was super clumsy dropping menus and whatever else was ever in her hand while she was serving us and forgetting drinks. Only one of us in our party got a refill on soda. The food was subpar as well. The women's bathroom was decent and mostly clean, according to the gentlemen in my party the men's bathroom was a disgusting mess. I am not at all impressed with the service, cleanliness, or quality of food at this location. I went to the location in the Plaza Hotel and enjoyed myself...maybe I'll go back there before I write this place off completely.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Henderson, NV, United States. Nasty men&#39;s bathroom
Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Henderson, NV, United States. Replacement fork and knife...still dirty

3FzTUJN29ERuYOfVExAO8Q.text: I ordered the chicken and waffles and the only good thing was the fried leeks. The 1st time my dish was brought out the chicken was cold. The 2nd time it was brought out the chicken was still cold and greasier. I had to explain to the person I was with about how I knew the chickens expiration was done besides the fact it was barely warm. It was gray in color.  Fried Chicken on the bone takes at least 20 minutes to fried in a Henny Penny. This my friends was not 20 minutes, maybe 10 minutes the first time, and less than 5 min the second dish.  Hmmmmm, not what I expected.   I like the other Hash House experiences I've had in the past, but this one in henderson is lacking.

GwwDGEoXo-UcEV0Yvr3Y1A.text: Food is great. Service is awesome. Food portion size is enormous. I love the maple bacon in the pancakes! Love this place!

fCTfpyMoaSSON1XD9W9Jwg.text: So far, so slow. The place isn't busy yet it took forever just for someone to ask us if we wanted drinks. And then another eternity for them to arrive. I'm dreading waiting for the meal. Naps. Take naps while waiting for food. It helps.  Ok, enough about the slow service and on to the food.  Yep, ridiculously sized portions. The meatloaf special (Wednesdays) was, weird. I don't think I ever want to know what was in it, but, oddly enough, the more I ate, the better it was. Dad had the bacon/avocado burger. He said it was good and ate the whole thing. But he never was one for leaving food on his plate. Never made it to desert as everyone was stuffed from the main course.  I wouldn't search this place out, but of people were determined to go and I 1. had a lot of time and 2. was really hungry  I would join them.

l7BhTqNtV6TjGsyo5tQD_g.text: Every time I've come to Hash House, we've always had good service, good food and a good time. It's always fun to surprise guests from out of town with the portion sizes.  Today was our best visit yet. The biggest factor was our server, Margarita. She was very attentive, checked on our table regularly, always offered to bring refills and even bringing them before we had to ask. I'll be asking to sit in her section the next time I bring the family to eat here.

MrLpKGMJ7bjV4d648xYhIQ.text: This place is way overrated!  The food is absolutely horrible!  The prices are outrageous!  It's Hash House a NO NO for me!

Qzgl-TaOmoavKEfBkuP29w.text: Opening day with a 20 min wait.  We counted 20 tables open and 3 parties ahead of us. The parties were of 2 people so 6 total people. Having to wait with that many open tables and no line is dumb. Considering it's their opening day to be under staffed is ridiculous.  See pic of all the open tables.  We were also just informed that if we wanted a booth it would be an additional 10 min wait. There are more booths than tables open.  22 mins in: We finally sat down and lighting is not very good for a (rainy day).  Service at the table is going good so far.  32 mins in: Food is out and easily comparable to the other locations. Presentation was great!  Getting better.  45 mins in:  All done!  Notes: Amanda and Kelly (the servers) earned this experience the extra 2 stars.  They did a great job!  Banana latte had an after taste of sugar alcohol so be warned. I made a recommendation on what they could do to improve it. Only complain was the initial wait did not make sense to me.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Henderson, NV, United States. 10 additional mins for a booth that is open. I counted 11 open booths on the left side. 10 min?!?!? Wow!!! Horrible opening day!
Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Henderson, NV, United States. The other side is not full and still 20 to 25 min wait!  Way to start on a bad note!
Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Henderson, NV, United States. Opening day.  All open tables on one side the other is just a open, and we have to wait 20 to 25 mins.  Big thumbs down!

sEyntNOyVq9PguZPOUU_NA.text: I wanted to like this place but I will not be going back due to the food. I ordered a vegetable hash with 2 eggs over easy. 10 minutes later my order is brought to my table in a cast iron skillet. I knew it was for decoration since the skillet was cold when the server brought it to me.  My vegetables were soggy and my eggs were cold. I only ate one because  cold runny egg is not very pleasing to eat. I turned my other cold egg over and it was black on the bottom so whatever skillet it was cooked in (not the one delivered to my table mind you) was dirty so there was no way I was going to eat the remaining cold egg.   The servers were really nice but their cooks ruin the experience. My mothers toast were burnt. ALL THREE were burnt so if you can't toast bread what does that say about your food? I did notice a lot of large customers eating there so if you want a ton of so so food on your plate, go to this place, if you have taste buds and don't want burnt toast, cold eggs and soggy vegetables, run.

Uzf2Tc3QvuL7NY0RP9YefA.text: What a disaster. The first experience I had was at the linq hotel and it was fantastic. The meat loaf was outstanding and was looking forward to that again, so when this location opened a few weeks ago by our house I was excited to bring out of town friends here.  Yea, not so much. First off all they fail to tell anyone that it's a limited menu. And that would have been fine but they failed to execute anything right. Food was cold, well, warmish at best. The wait staff was totally inattentive.  Seemed like they were doing us a favor by working there.  Needless to say, I will not be going back there again. Substandard food, crappy service unless cooperate gets involved, I predict this location will be closed within a year. And that may be optimistic.  Too bad.

6E0LBkFDGezmJFaESzAhRA.text: Worst experience I ever had at a restaurant and I am not a picky eater. I only ate the sweet potato fries. I ordered the portobello mushroom burger and it was awful. For the first time in my life I had an item be taken back. My mother ordered one of their hash skillets and it had no flavor and the potatoes were soggy. My brother ordered the egg scramble with salmon and they totally screwed up his order as there was no salmon in sight. They took his back and remade his but by that time everyone was ready to go. Our server had eggs all over her shirt and when the manager came by to ask how everything was he was dressed so casual I thought he was another customer. The only reason this gets 2 stars instead of one is because they took my meal off the bill.

phr3kZsV0mfqxH2iD8O-sA.text: I was disappointed with the service here. I've been to the location at the Quad and loved the service the moment you walk in. However, there are quite a few things my family and I were unhappy about:  1. The runner dropped off our food without asking if we needed anything. Actually, she walked away right before we could speak. 2. The creamer we had look spoiled because it was curdling in our coffee. We asked if we could get another one and the waiter poured the coffee out and just added new coffee to the cup. How could you tell? You see coffee splatters outside of the mugs. 3. 30 min into our meal we still haven't received our pancakes, which one would think would be the first thing to come out of the kitchen.  I wouldn't recommend this location. If you want good quality service, definitely the location on the strip.

WVobxHRhEhbi6rdVXPQddQ.text: I came here for breakfast with my wife and parents the other day to find out what the heck "twisted farm food" was. I've known Hash House A Go Go from the Man vs. Food episode and having passed the other locations here around Vegas. We ordered the following:   Kiwi Watermelon Lemonade  Andy's Sage Fried Chicken Benedict w/ maple reduction, 2 eggs, bacon mashed potatoes & biscuit  Corned Beef, red onions and swiss cheese  Blueberry Pancakes   First off, the drink was pretty good. It wasn't too sweet and refreshing. When the food came out, the portions were HUGE! The corned beef was fresh (not the mushy kine you get in the can) and chicken benedict was very filling with layers of fried chicken, scrambled eggs, fried pasta strings, cheese, and biscuits. FYI, order the sauce on the sauce or else your fried chicken and grilled potatoes will become soggy. The only thing that was a negative was that there weren't enough blueberries in the pancakes. The pancakes were like small pizza sized so it would be nice that the filling/toppings are a little generous as well to balance the dish. Other than that, I would come here again for breakfast to try the other dishes. If you're super hungry, Hash House A Go Go has very filling, american comfort food with generous portions.

l7FwqpmYIQ3FOacoufcMKg.text: Amazing food! Been 3xs now and have not been disappointed yet!! I love it there! Servers were all fantastic and the managers are awesome! So happy I live right down the road from them!

L8lh7zeHbMpJui_0Oq9g1A.text: Food was alright, but they are pretty pricey for the quality of food. Portion sizes were decent though!

KpDg725RygfKeWYj4zI4yQ.text: Like most of the reviewers, we did not have the best experience at this location.   We have actually been here twice: once  during their 'family' soft opening and once a week later when they were actually open. The first time, although brief, was not the most pleasant. We walked in following another couple and were greeted by a host who told us they weren't really open.... They were packed. They turned away both of us and told us to come back when they open. The host was kinda rude. They almost lost customers that day.  The second time we came we were told there was a 45 min. wait or we could sit at the bar. The obvious choice was the bar. We looked around and saw tons of tables open...why was there a 45 minute wait? The bartender was cool and took our order but things went south quickly. We ordered a specialty pancake and the chicken and waffles. It took almost 45 minutes to get our food and they brought us extra food. They brought the pancake out without the eggs and bacon I ordered, then the chicken and waffles, and then ANOTHER pancake with the meal. Anyone who has been here before knows that portions are not small here. The waiter said we could take the extra one home since they'd "have to throw it out anyway." So we ate our food which was pretty good- hence two stars. However, the bill came and we were charged for the extra pancake that we never ordered and were told to keep. The bartender took it off the bill and all was well.   There is obviously something wrong with the staff or management at this place because they're inconsistent. While we ate our food, a lady sat down, ordered the same thing we did and was brought her food within minutes. The managers/ owners don't seem to be so organized. We might give it another try, but I don't know.

VZOG7U9-bLC6y1eiURA2Mw.text: Went there with the family. I asked the waitress of they had a lite menu because I am currently on a special diet. The waitress responded "Do you know where you are?" Seriously.

r3YpDZur4M2vIgtoAq47xA.text: I would definitely recommend this restaurant to anybody with big appetite for all american Breakfast or western style dishes. You get a great deal of food for the price and they have a way of making a big Pile of food look pretty appetizing.

6jyzMcxKM8BbxvcAJtbyZw.text: Worst service ever. I specifically asked if I can get my kids meal first. Of course not. Not busy at the. Place need to train the servers.

RotS4t4UxYFjFnLvfADN1Q.text: Love this place. Great atmosphere,  drinks are delicious, food was abundant and staff was attentive and helpful! My husband and I have eaten there a few times at the request of some of our friends, fantastic choice. I enjoy the cucumber salad. It's fresh and light with the cucumber dressing especially during our hot months,  to die for!

IJVlKF4TaeXqbQ1Ga_C0Xg.text: The bad reviews here baffle me. Those folks just don't seem to get it. What you do get are very creative menus, huge portions and great service. It's a unique dining experience. Forget the bad reviews here -- just try Hash House -- you'll love it.

y4f9SbP6MJEnOT5gdbu6-w.text: One of my favorite places to treat myself every once and a while. My boyfriend and I wanted something with both breakfast and lunch items, so we decided in Hash House. First, this location is quite compared to its sister location on Sahara, which is nice when you haven't even had coffee yet. Second, the wait is still long, but they are pretty friendly and keep menus at the check in so you can browse around the food items. I will warn you, the portions here are HUGE, so come hunger. The service is good, they are very good on refills. I would suggest The Komokko ( I'm pretty positive I spelt that wrong) it is the sandwich with meatloaf and cheese. It was so amazing, but I could not finish it. It's a little pricey, but it's good food and you will not leave disappointed.

zVNvTRgEgGw0DN229krnDA.text: Serving sizes are huge and well worth when split for two or more. Best tasting sage chicken and bacon in waffles I've ever had. Friendly waiters. Place is kept clean and music isn't turned up too loud. Service for food was quick, but there weren't too many people around for brunch.

wGKhAahmiXhkxamr3r4nMw.text: Was told my many friends that this is a must stop.  While in town for a competition, happened that it was on my way out of town and I stopped for a very pleasant solo breakfast dining experience.  I sat at the bar and received stellar service and enjoyed my meal before hitting the highway back to AZ.

ED1vsBYU4CvTiaUnyt3Xhg.text: Hope I don't get sick from the burger. This place is empty. Sent my burger back. It had a very funky taste. I don't think it was safe. My husband smelled and tasted it and he agreed - funky and rotten. Waitress was acceptable. Lots of dear and hun. We will not be returning or recommending this place.

yYNfCGQcUEuM3Fa0o95L-A.text: Sahara location much better....rushed to order...didn't get what we wanted.  Wouldn't let us change type of cheese we wanted on a scamble??? Literally 3 pecans on french toast.  Super disappointed.  Picked Hash House for birthday meal with family....could have gone anywhere!  .....and it is right down the street. Too bad!

dAuHryeJHph3nAPZRRupaA.text: The only thing good here is the service n some of the staff. The food is garbage, literally. I went there with my gf n her kids n it got all of us sick. If U want good food go to Baby Stacks if U like throwing up n pissing out Ur butt then come here to Hash house

4FNRtt8yARGUdMxxDcS9RA.text: This location is great! We have always been treated great and the food is always up to HH standards. So happy that they are in Hendo. The HH bloody Marry is the bomb just make sure it comes with the Goose.

OpxmkC0WAQ6OqcE68nDuOA.text: I just had dinner here. Ordered the Chicken & Waffles which was great and the Chocolate Waffle with Vanilla ice cream was simply perfect! Although, the menu was a little boring especially for somebody like myself who doesn't eat meat (besides chicken & seafood). There should have been more options for healthy eaters and kids.

oA9qANtPs4H7H_wPBl_PTw.text: The kitchen sink was clogged, so I can't do dishes. That's a good enough excuse for me to go out to dinner.  I've been to Hash House A Go Go before, but never to this location. It's a little smaller than the other places, but it still has the same great food. I had the sage fried chicken eggs benedict. The thing was huge! It should have come with a shovel and a feed bag. I'm embarrassed to say that I wasn't able to finish it all and had to put the rest in a to go bag. Now I'm questioning my manhood. Damn you Hash House A Go Go! Now, as for the service; Even if they had defecated on my plate and kicked me in the man parts as I was leaving, I  would still return just to be waited on by Kris again! What a delightful young lady! She was friendly, fun, funny and attentive without hovering. Congratulations Kris! You have just found  yourself a new stalker! Overall, it was an excellent experience and I will be going back again.

reX8CZTDI2M9mfJAvs5Rhw.text: Service is okay. Low quality over priced dry food. After several bites I pushed the plate away. So disappointed. Not coming back:(

tq54mde9pWtOfWlYzbwo4w.text: The food was very good, and the servings were huge.  My only complaint would be that it was a little pricey.  Other than that, i would recommend this to anyone.

dcPHNSFuwj8E5-1TkIMM8Q.text: I really don't know how this restaurant can even have a 3.5 rating.  From the rude hosts to the rude managers.  The servers seem to be at least trying but in a environment like that.  How do you have a 30 minute wait with only a few tables taken?  Then the food comes out and I am sorry but I would rather have quality food over a lot of food.  They same farm to table but I really question that.

yW2o1F_XjY7xOswBxVfkdA.text: I have eaten here twice now mainly by urging of other family members. The food is ok but not really worth the price other than by sheer volume. My main complaint though is how uncomfortable the seating is. We were seated in the bar area and while I can't speak for the restaurant portion, those metal chairs are uncomfortable. The tables seemed low and too narrow for the size of the plates. Add on the ridiculous garnish and the giant knife sticking out of every plate and you start to feel like a juggling act. The layout of the tables is a bit awkward if you have any sort of assistive devices. A party with a walker that was seated further in had a bit of trouble getting between the table and a divider chain between the tables and restaurant. Ultimately they had to pull the walker through leaving their party member to walk those few feet without it. Given the totality of the experience I doubt I will give them a third try.

L2_UrzFD3WVoEmT04SzdKw.text: We got there and the service was okay they were like robots, no greetings or anything. The food is expensive and the sides just add up more. While yes it is a big portion the food is very bland and by bland I mean I couldn't taste the waffles I was eating or the salad. I won't be going here again

NJ3L8HjVxHg9moCQ_wP2rQ.text: This is a great restaurant! The service was perfect, Aimee checked in with us often but not excessively. She provided suggestions and offered opinions that were very helpful. The size of each dish was very large and half of my meal came home with me. The food choices all looked so good. I would absolutely recommend this restaurant to anyone that likes a filling and well prepared meal!

Hs_3t4zDwHm4zhwu6638IQ.text: Not my first time @HH but first at this location- first let me say I'm a fan of this chain- portion are crazy- this experience started great- no wait, my server, Carrie, was awesome- helped me with my selection, prompt, helpful- food came- the presentation was awesome as usual- taste was great... But it was cold.. Cooked thoroughly- but just sat too long before being brought to the table- inside was warm-not hot- I merely mentioned it so they would know- I wasn't upset - didn't cause a scene or anything- just wanted them to know- their handling of the situation was above textbook perfect- above my expectations - having been in the business I know things happen- especially at a new location- so Thank You- I will be back thanks to True professional waitstaff personal like her.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Henderson, NV, United States. Chicken n Waffles

EYPlnrSP0mTt0hWDCyTN1A.text: One star for having an hour and a half wait on a Sunday morning. Are you freaking kidding me? I know you just opened but you have several other locations in town and should be able to figure out how to seat people in a timely manner. This is ridiculous. Your food isn't THAT good. Never coming here again.

OopUhkrtpjrz62NjIukmrw.text: The worst! We should have been tipped off when we drove into the parking lot and the dumpster receptacle was running over and the doors not closed from customer view. Very telling that management just does not care.  We entered the restaurant (around 3pm) and was greeted by a young man who walked around the hostess stand and stood behind 2 women who were going over paperwork or schedules or something having nothing to do with the customer. The one women held up a finger and continued to ignore us. As we stood in front of the stand about 2 feet away, I swear to god a server walked right between us and the hostess stand. So close that we had to step back. And she giggled. I said to my husband loud enough for all three to hear me that if we were not seated in the next minuet we needed to leave. NOTHING. We turned around and left. No we are sorry or have a nice day NOTHING.  Having been a corporate trainer for 15 years I know that when it starts out like this, it continues and I also know that the employees reflect management.   Sad

wS2qiANzu9AaY503l5sKzQ.text: The place just opened a few days ago but the service and food were perfect. I tried the chorizo hash for the first time and loved it. The s'mores mocha was like a perfect desert. We will be back.

YczI7AIvrcgdq1Yjw-XOSg.text: Don't waste your money here!  After you wait in the rediculously long line, you wait forever to get a drink and order. The food comes out cold and tasteless and the place is so loud the wait staff can't hear and messes up the order. I have been here a few times thinking it was just that occasion but no everytime I went it was the same.  No service, horrible food and expensive

DkGEv5mArn3nytueMo39Pg.text: Overpriced...yes, portions are huge, but food is less than average. I had smoked salmon hash. The salmon tasted old. I had a cranberry mimosa- not cold and sub-par ingredients. My friend had corned beef hash. She was disappointed in the taste. Bisquits were great. Waitress new to job. She was okay and checked with us. We didn't bother to complain...we just won't be coming back.

nU6BW0Q5fMib5x641yokWw.text: Just lacked a little flavor to me. The portions were big as usually but the taste seemed as though it was missing something.

L9kjwouT2X0bQPlJuBJCFw.text: My friends and I came here and what a poor choice! First the menu is varied and a bit confusing so my friends needed more time we ordered water with lemons since there was three of us we asked that the lemons be in a separate dish we were told that was an extra charge. Our meal came with a sauce but there was very little sauce so we asked for more sauce. Again we were told " that would be extra" why is it our fault the pork was fried and dried out ? I asked for the manager Lelani although polite she explained that there was a miscommunication. Bottom line she did not put the extra charge for the sauce. The portions may be Hugh but the quality just was not there. The overall service needs improvement and management lacks customer service skills.

eKe-Vj3ZZScU939yD4ktZw.text: Been here many a busy Sunday and the bartenders Yvette and Robert always go above and beyond with their professionalism, speed, and a desire to provide amazing customer service. As a former bartender, their attitude under pressure is spectacular, and I will always be a raving customer due to these two employees! Keep up the great work!

_lPHVCIBmMKvIOJU-xApoQ.text: The wait to be seated was way too long, the service was very slow and inattentive and the food was mediocre and overpriced. We won't be going back there again.

Z2nHVBvsDsGtuvwS1BCL8A.text: Got here Sunday morning after church (today) at 11:45 and didn't leave until now 2:23. When we got here it was full which is fine I expected a long wait, total wait time to be seated was 55 minutes. We sit down and notice there are tables all around us that are open, I figured they are short staffed so ok fine. We sat down and ordered immediately since we had 50 minutes to look over the menu. Almost one hour later still no food! Tables around us that sat down 20-30 minutes after us already had their food. We were only a table of 4 so why the long wait? Our waitress comes and tells us that there was a mistake with the slips and our order as well as a few others never got placed. We asked to speak to a manager and our waitress came back and offered 25% off. Fine, because we were starving. Food came out about 10 minutes later. Food was great, our waitress was great, but the experience was one of the worst, ever! I don't feel that 25% off our meal was enough for the neglect we experienced. I mean really, eating breakfast should not take a whole 2 and a half hours.

ccPS_B5kzZbUWXPtubtzfw.text: Service poor. Staff rude. Food cold. Nothing but bad excuses. Really hope they get it fixed.

4h8okbsuXqZTI-SxW5cdgA.text: It gets rather busy, especially during brunch hour, but it's totally worth the wait! The entrees are huge so consider splitting something. The sage fried chicken is my favorite thing on the menu. Every time my fiance comes to Nevada he wants to go to Hash House. Delicious.

Gl6I1GTETWyCKRZL3m3AiQ.text: My partner and I came here for a pre-fourth or July brunch. We were seated at a table which has awfully uncomfortable. If you're coming here for mimosas I would recommend that you don't. Their Banana French Toast was more than amazing, but could have used a side of syrup which I would've gladly ask for had there had been one ounce of customer service. We only saw our server twice when she took our order, and gave us our check. We were not checked on during our entire meal, and had to wait several minutes for the check. While the food was good, the overall experience left us feeling rather underwhelmed.

69Oo-S59R0DA7yoOq_MwEw.text: Don't go there service sucks and food terrible, I won't recommend anybody to come to this place..  Manager should talk to the employees about the service

W4kcmSn9rtOpC7o-Y_Ml6w.text: First and last time here. Just happened to be shopping in the area and thought we would give this place a try as we had never seen it before.  Way too over priced for the location, this is not the Strip people!    Charge for ice tea refills, really?  Then have the guts to charge me $13.50 for a dry hamburger and fries and charge me extra for mayo?? $2.50 for a side of Ranch?  We are so over this place.  Red Robin here we come!

w7WRsQHm20N1FiWbmJbUYw.text: I cant even start how horrible this place is. They just opened and they already have 3 stars!!! Our food was ok. I ordered french toast and specifically asked to put the syrup on the side. But I still got the syrup all over my french toast so it came out soggy. Who charges refill $1 for an ice tea??! Even at the strip doesnt even charges for a refill. Our server, Cristina took 10 mins for a refill. Our server is horrible, her attitude is bad the whole time. Funny thing is, for a slow night she should be more attentive with her tables. We will never come back here.

UrQOjwvM7skXOXchkt9ghg.text: So after reaching out to the company, it basically was our fault for not coming in earlier to make a reservation... Even though we tried doing that. They didn't even offer any solution or something to entice us to try the restaurant again, basically just blamed us for the experience. What a great place.

SpulAjQozvF_xwJYolrdJA.text: We love hash house a go go! Great food, great atmosphere! Serving sizes are huge and creative, delicious dishes.

wSJY9_YB1JGKQ4UeUEk22Q.text: Had breakfast here with my ex-wife on a Saturday morning and it was average. The food was serviced fast and the drinks are of good quality and quantity. I had the chicken hash and the ex had the Salmon Benny. Huge portions but flavors are slacking!

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Henderson, NV, United States. Chicken hash

udHW3mhxZge50TElHioHwQ.text: RAW PANCAKE & COLD COFEE!  Serioulsy, how do you mess up this simple order?!?!  This morning not only was the order bad but the server never apologized nor did the Manager say something.  No excuse for serving raw food!  Hell was in that kitchen today.  This app makes me pick a star but they really don't deserve not even one star!

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Henderson, NV, United States. So disappointed!

d0Nr1zVf44TDGCHcZ01Svw.text: If you've never been to Hash House, consider as Claim Jumper 2.0. It's a little newer and the menu's a bit more refined. The portions are comically large, and the clientele tends to be the type of people who aren't particularly interested in portion control. A lot of older people seem to enjoy this place. That's not a bad thing, but it's a great place to bring your parents.   I had previously eaten at other Hash House locations and had a decent experience. How this location has the same menu, there seems to be something up with the running of this place.   First, there are a lot of people. It's a popular place, so there's a line. But to me that's not the issue. There were only two of us, so we only waited about 10 minutes. But ten we sat there another 40 minutes waiting for our food. The fact we both ordered salads makes the wait even more ridiculous.  When the food did come, that was the last we saw of our waitress for a while. Occasionally she would wonder by assuring us we're doing ok. Not once were we offered a refill during our meal. It was only after the plates were being cleared did the waitress ask if we wanted deserts or another drink.   It's a shame the service sucks, because it's decent food and nice restaurant. I'm assuming right now there's so much business the management doesn't much care about the service level. I'm guessing they'll care a bit more in a year or so when the novelty of being new wears off.  Update: I'm going to update this to a 1 star review. The food is good, but there is sincerely something wrong with the service. Every time I go, I seem to run into a different problem. And DO NOT attempt take out. In the half a dozen times we've tried this, there has never been a time they have got it right. Every time requires me to go back there and get something they left out. And they genuinely don't concern themselves about this. The manager is about as apathetic as can be.   Decent food, but if you can try difference location. Not sure what's going on, but there's just something that prevents these guys from getting it right.

Fa_LPkV68MrQT0qqFYTZPg.text: We came here tonight to try the new place in town and we were excited!  Wait time was estimated at 20 minutes but took around 30 which isn't a deal breaker for a Friday night. I'd recommend planning to wait if you're wanting to try it.  We sat and were greeted promptly by our server but she was not knowledgable about the menu and said their was no special tonight because the kitchen had made a "major mistake today". Awkward start but we had the drink and food order ready since we had chosen while waiting.  Drinks came but we had to wait 15 minutes for my husband's beer.... And then our food just never came. 45 minutes after we sat down the server came back to ask what we had ordered.  We ended up leaving because we had a 3 year old in tow and were over sitting for almost 90 minutes with no sign of food in sight. Anyone with kids knows the nightmare of a hungry kid and extended sitting still.   After chatting with the manager who was a total rockstar and seemed completely on her game we realized this was a server issue BUT I spent years in the restaurant business and a server without experience is not equipped to work at a restaurant with a detailed menu and just opening kinks.  We may try again for lunch and see if we have a better experience. I'll update if we do.

7xGXQuBJc231G4oO2b_8JA.text: Visited twice, most recently on 4/14/15. We had a party of 5 and were seated immediately after walking in around 5:30pm for my son's 8th birthday dinner. Waitress took our drink orders and food order within about 10 minutes of each other and we thought we hit the service jackpot. I ordered the chicken pot pie, my wife had biscuits and gravy, our 8 year old got the kid's cheeseburger meal and our older kids got the BBBLT and Mushroom and Swiss stuffed burger.   Now this is how they brought out the food....Who does this???? 1st out kid's burger 10 minutes later, BBBLT and Biscuits and gravy 5 minutes later the other burger and a whole 20 minutes later the chicken pot pie.  The food was larger than life portions with everyone taking home leftovers, but the pot pie looked like a salad with more veggies than chicken and a large biscuit shell that resembled hard tack! The sauce was thin, runny and tasteless. They would have done better nuking me a Marie Calendars frozen pot pie and bringing that out. We were very disappointed with this visits food expediting and overall taste.

LP5roTVvayiO3w4bh5j7XQ.text: Omg half the restaurant was closed due to lack of servers. So we sat at the bar to have no service 1 bartender say there for over 20 minutes with no service and our group left  Huge disappointment

HBQhu15IIXl5W690y1jwXA.text: Very poor experience here. I've been to other locations and this was disappointing.  To start with I tried to just sit at the bar and I was rudely informed that there was a waitlist for the bar. I have NEVER been to any other place from high end to casual that is anything other than first come first serve for the bar. This is a very bad policy.   The food is nothing special.  They live off of the portion size driving people in.  As they start to add more and more restaurants the quality is decreasing and it is just becoming a glorified chain restaurant.   Everything was just average and the service was horrible it started rude and just stayed bad.

ep5gjiNUbc7ormESx5_wDQ.text: I have been to the new location twice now and it is going in the right direction. My first visit was the week they opened and you can tell the servers were not use to a crowd. Minimal visits during our meal and forgetting to bring us drinks as requested, this wasn't a good first impression. I came back for lunch and the service is slightly improving. A few hiccups here and there but not as bad as the first time.  The food was the star of the show as it should be. I had the sage fried chicken bennedict. The chicken was on top of biscuits and mashed potatoes. On top was the scrambled eggs, griddled mozzarella, bacon all covered with a chipotle cream sauce. Excellent flavors and as always and oversized portion.  The Kokomo. I always enjoy  meatloaf and HHAGG makes one of the best. This sandwich is also stacked with roasted tomatoes griddled mozzarella on milk bread. I have ordered it at other locations and it is always consistent .  I'm sure the service will get better with time and I will definitely be back

YTLieXVYVbjHRuQbWUiIUA.text: I heard so much about this place from friends so I decided to try it. Great interiors, vibe, but you come for the food. I ordered the eggs with hash and was surprised that the hash consisted of seasoned cut potatoes. I expected something different from what they would have served at Denny's. Portions are generous and staff was great. I've had better hash and this was supposed to be a hash house.  Neh.

3LY8sUoi2GeXfcgamIFgxA.text: Very very generous portions, and the food is very good. Staff was all really nice and helpful. I've never had to wait very long, but my visits have all been either fairly late morning or early afternoon.

GeX9HW3gbluAboETklB7Iw.text: So extremely disappointed.  I had been to the Hash House at the M back when it was still open there and the dinner was pretty good, especially the biscuit.  Fast-forward to this morning when a friend and I had breakfast at the HH on Stephanie to understand my disappointment.  A place called Hash House should have actual hash, should it not?  When I ordered the corned beef "hash" today it showed up in what looks like a large cast-iron skillet, but it appeared to be just for show, because nothing in there was cooked in that skillet.  My corned beef "hash" was just a bunch of pulled corned beef with melted swiss on top, then just thrown on top of some breakfast potatoes.  The corned beef was decent, but what part of "hash" does the Hash House not understand?  On top of the disappointing breakfast my stomach was upset most of today, and that is not a common occurrence.  I hate to blame HH, but I'm pretty sure HH was the reason for today's discomfort.  My friend got the biscuits and gravy and was extremely disappointed as well.  Although he said the sausage gravy was good, he also said the biscuits were like rock-hard paperweights.  For the prices we paid it should have been an above-average breakfast.  Unfortunately, it was one of the most disappointing breakfasts we could remember.  The only reason I'm giving them two stars instead of one is due to the service.  The place was quiet, very clean, and our waitress was very friendly and attentive to our needs.  She was the only positive part of our breakfast.

iYCbClvZXD6sFessj7R_Xw.text: I hate to say it, but we expected more. (I know, I know. Never have expectations)  Came for breakfast this morning. Wait time was only 10 min, but instead of being greeted, I was given the index finger and told "hold on". (For the first day, I would have put a greeter at the door. First impressions are everything). It was surprising because it was right in front of a camera crew and people who looked like they may have been investors. So, I was expecting super sweet smiles and greetings.   When we sat down, my silverware wasn't clean (Again, really?! On the first official day open?!)   The waitress was good, but a little snooty about the substitution rule. (Sorry! I didn't know this place didn't do substitutions! I have a lot of restrictions I need to work around....
