And aren't "no substitution" rules for fancy establishments? Just saying...)   My eggs ordered "over medium" came out cold and runny.    I find that I'm impressed when places get "over medium" correct because 9 times out of 10, they do come out runny. But cold AND runny was a first.   My meal was luke warm like it had been sitting. My husband's meal was very good, but he said he had a couple bites of potato that weren't done. We don't like to complain, so we didn't send anything back.   It took two requests to get a box for the leftovers.   Look, I know it was the first few hours of officially being open. I know the staff was a bit overwhelmed (even though the restaurant wasn't full, but I can imagine first day jitters)... The location is great and so is the potential, so we'll give it another shot and see if warrants the other two stars in the future. :)

EibLG7vHhoCul3h45l1yqg.text: This is by far the worst restaurant I have ever eaten at. I gave it a fair 3 shots, but it got worse every time. The waitstaff takes forever to greet you, get drinks and your order. The food is just huge, I mean I understand that's what they're going for, but meat isn't supposed to be that huge and it comes cold and you can't even eat it. I personally think the menu is lacking and the food taste horrible.

kWoOcAkMg6V15dNcMtV_aA.text: Took my senior parents here for breakfast after church. The food is abundant , clever unique menu items, and we all loved our selections. The hit was my father's scrambled eggs dish. His gace was priceless when the waitress set it in front of him. Definately a great breakfast place . We will be back.  They never disappoint! Momhad the beet salad this trip. Dad kept with the scrambled egg dish . The biscuits are huge! I tried the hot spinach salad. Loved the presentation. Fresh flavored iced teas and lemonade make this place unique and above the rest!

OaCEEdYcInlh8DIXR759-Q.text: Hash House A Go Go is what Europeans think every US restaurant is. And if they came here, they'd be right.  This is excess to the point of stupidity, with very little that actually tastes good.  All plates are visual abominations, cooking execution errors abound, from greasy sage chicken and waffles assembled with giant skewers and thickets of fried leeks akin to the the working end of a kitchen broom, to the inedible thickness of anything involving bread, to coagulated sauces and gravies, to gross, sticky drinks - there's not much redeemable here.    Oh and I'll probably go back.  Because sometimes I hate myself and crave True rock bottom.

LxVZ2p9BFfiZ0R_GYfK5CQ.text: Love the food and the amount. They give a lot of food, but boy do you pay the price. Two people having just breakfast nothing extraordinary was $67.59. Well... plus one bloody mary. But still. Who pays $67.69 for a breakfast?!!!   That wasn't even tip included. BEEN THERE, DONE THAT DUE TO THE HIGH PRICES!!!!!

XCYxOOwJu6K6v2TS-yL3XQ.text: Food was good. Service is just okay! Ordered egg white scrambled but got a beater instead.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Henderson, NV, United States. Good roasted chicken dish!
Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Henderson, NV, United States. Scrambled with spinach &amp; smoke salmon that we ordered as an egg white scramble but received the eggs beater scrambled instead.

vJVapoVnsA7zqf105ybyOQ.text: BOMB... Brown Sugar Pancakes... BOMB... Price is a little high but, PORTIONS make up for it...

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Henderson, NV, United States. Brown Sugar Pancakes... Egg White Scramble with bacon and potatoes... BOMB...

JOhlDmCxwIet-X4N7PHIUQ.text: Ate here with my wife for what I figured was going to be dinner, but wasn't really.  We had been to the Hash House a Go Go at the M Resort before that location closed and were pleased with the meal we had then, so we figured we'd try the Henderson location as it's the closest to where we live.    We arrived at about 7:30 and were told there would be about a 10 minute wait, even though there were tables available on both sides of the restaurant . After only about 5 minutes we were seated.  I always find it strange when a couple is seated at a table for four, when there are tables for two available.  It seems like poor planning.  Anyway, after we were seated we waited several more minutes for our server to take our drink orders.  While we waited, we scanned the menu to find that there were no dinner options, only breakfast and brunch.  We asked our server where the dinner menus were but this location is only serving brunch until they "get up to speed" - kind of strange to me, as they've been open for 10 days, and have multiple locations in town.    Since dinner was out, and that's what my wife and I had planned for we really had to struggle to find what we wanted to eat.  We had both read the online menu before leaving the house, so we had our minds set on certain meals, only to have to change ideas at the last moment.  I'd had their stuffed burger at their M Resort location and thought it was pretty good, though lacking seasoning, so I figured I'd try one again.  Although my wife and I debated about getting the chicken pot pie we each went with the stuffed burger.  She selected the Swiss and mushroom burger, while I wanted the Cheddar burger, but I also wanted bacon on it.  When I asked the server if they could add bacon, he said he would add a side of bacon.  At the M Resort location every meal came with a biscuit, and their biscuits were about the size of a saucer.  When I asked our server if our meals came with a biscuit, he said they didn't, but he would add one, so I said we'd each want one.  It took quite a while for us to get our food, I had ordered the biscuits in hopes they would come first as a sort of appetizer as we were both very hungry, however they came with the meal - sort of.  My burger came out first, without bacon.  Then after a few minutes I got my biscuit, when I asked where my wife's biscuit was the waiter said he thought we had only wanted one, and would send out another.  My wife received her burger next, then finally my bacon and our second biscuit.    The burgers are large - 2 1/2 pound patties, but it's almost as if they don't season them when they're being fried, there's very little flavor.  My wife's Swiss and mushroom burger had only one detectable mushroom, but so much Swiss it was sliding off the burger - that's a good thing about the Swiss though!  My burger had a nicely flavored cheddar, but it wasn't oozing out like my wife's Swiss was.  I also find that the bun which is very bland also takes flavor from the burger.  The fries are very plain, with little flavor as well.  The Mac-n-Cheese is not what I had expected - it's thin, with an artificial cheese flavor - lacking substance and just not satisfying.    And then there were the biscuits - The one's at M Resort were large, soft and fluffy, flaky, and full of flavor.  My first biscuit was so hard, I couldn't cut it in half.  When I asked the server if this is how the biscuit was supposed to be, she said she didn't know, she had never had their biscuits.  So we got two more that were fresh out of the oven - they were better, but still hard and very dry and very small.    We were also given some sort of jam (?) with the biscuits - we were never told what it was, even though we got 4 containers of them, and the butter that came with the jam was only about 1/4 of the container.  I had to ask twice more for more butter - and each time only got 1/4 of a container - butter shortage?    Won't be back to this location for a while - might stop in again if they start serving dinner - but can't see ever getting the burger again.  They've got a long way to go, and staff needs to be educated much better (have to ask for everything, ask for refills of drinks, remind servers that you need certain items, etc.) before this location can really carry the Hash House a Go Go name.

XBDzF5HLhC3SIoN2nlyhIQ.text: This place has amazing food and service. Glen our waiter was outstanding, especially with him being new I would of never guessed it. He was very attentive to my table and was happy to help. Great place to eat!

CcWwDrjB0QmRhTo6UTyRMg.text: My party of three was seated immediately and our waitress got our drink order right away. The menu is unique and since we have never been here before we were unfamiliar with it. Our waitress took our lunch order and we happily waited for our food. But that was our only complaint, we waited and waited and waited for our food. We arrived at the restaurant around 11:30 and did not leave the restaurant until 1:50. We waited for our food for more than 45 minutes. And then waited to get our check back for a good 10 minutes. Yet our waitress checked in with us twice apologizing for the wait and another lady brought all three of us gift cards because we waited so long. Our waitress told us that there was only two of them and that the kitchen staff was short handed as well. The food was great though! We all enjoyed the food and had no complaints in that department. We were understanding and did not complain to any of the staff about the wait time, and we appreciated that they took the time to check in with us. Overall I would love to go back since we liked the food but it felt like half our day was wasted just waiting for our food.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Henderson, NV, United States

7tsC2nOko5IQqNI9BbMe2g.text: 10:15am on a Monday. 80% of the restaurant is empty. Party for 3... 10 minute wait... seriously??? Follow up after complaining to waitress. She said well that's how long the host said, that's how long it's gonna take?!? Wtf is the attitude here? Manager comes up, he says to provide better service, we make you wait? Have to wait to flip tables cuz we just missed a rush? Ok well I still see 5 tables on the side your serving open? Cmon seriously? Service your people!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Henderson, NV, United States

E1hqi47CnDdtg5MoDt9Jog.text: Went there completely dead due to the fact it was new years eve had the pork ribs they came out cold my wife got the ceasear salad and not only was it warm but it was super fishy taste! The poor server seemed to be stressed out by the 3 tables she was working she didnt bring us the check for another 30 mins after we finish. Nasty food stay away

IBCN7W942MHdySsZPj07gw.text: Disappointed, went several mos  ago, maybe around July 2018. Not nearly the same as the one that was in The M, Hotel Casino. Ordered a Reuben,  the meat WAS NOT cut against the grain. The sandwich was "small" for the price. I may give this "joint" one more try, before I even think about recommending it to others.

6GSgi0p0uSNgsaheEszVBQ.text: I have heard about how good this place is. Came in to the Henderson location. The minute we walked in, the mood felt weird. Eventually someone came to the front grabbed 2 menus and mumbled something that I could not understand. We followed her to the table (she was a good 12 steps ahead of us), where she then kept mumbling as she walked off into the distance.   We looked over the menus for a good 18 minutes before someone eventually came over and asked in a way that they seemed bothered by our presence if we were ready to order. I guess that was our server?? The next time we saw any employee was when some other person came and delivered our food (if you're counting, that's 3 employees that all looked to be having a bad month). Our server never came and asked how anything was or if we needed anything else. Eventually the hostess came over to refill our drinks (didn't know that was in her job description but, thank you!). At the end of our meal the server came by and asked if we needed a box, then dropped our check off. Horrible service! Horrible attitudes! BUT, the food is wonderful.   In conclusion, I will return to HH but not this location. We will try another one and see how it goes!

inLVYhsphbHRNx4Aqf7OJg.text: The atmosphere and Look of the restaurant was great. The food presentation is exceptional and they have very big portions. However the food is bland and very dry. We had a party four. All of us got to go boxes. This place is good for Tourists as a one time event but I'm afraid not very pleasant for locals. I would rather go to a restaurant where the food is smaller but the taste is on point!

MOEjsqGwlRIzp57iPoz75A.text: This place is as friendly and kind as you would expect to be treated in the farm belt, where this company hails from. Also portions are huge!  A special shout out for Yvette. The nicest and most darling waitress you'll ever meet

-xMf8xg_QeRkCc5DXxc2FA.text: Was really looking forward to giving this restaurant a try with all the good reviews, so we went in sat down for almost 25 minutes and had to leave because I guess they had no one available to take our order since the restaurant was empty.

J9aY588t4Bg-o0uWMA3b4Q.text: This location is horrible!   I ordered a corned beef sandwich and the corn beef was shredded and dried up and the fries were equally bad. I sent it back and ordered shrimp and the breading fell off of it as I attempted to eat it. I give up.  No more Hash House for me.

7GEkQGADx0S40_Fck1zrQA.text: The service is good the portions are huge.  The food is very good.  The banana pancakes and the corned beef skillet were delicious.  I would go back again just for those dishes.

84W55w-XhPRdzDgfXjA43Q.text: This is like the fourth time I've eaten here. First time at the Henderson location. Ordered Andys sage fried chicken and waffles, and biscuits with sausage gravy. So good.  Waitress Nicole was very attentive and friendly.  You'll walk away full and happy.

1GQVPmsljeHvg5DkIRgLbA.text: This is a fantastic place for any occasion! The food is made with fresh ingredients and it comes through. During our visit we had the white chocolate raspberry pancake - I think only "Uncle Buck" could make a larger pancake. It was huge, delicious, and fresh. It didn't even need syrup it was so flavorful. We also had the corned beef skillet hash. The corned beef was very flavorful. We asked them to poach our eggs. It's rare to find a restaurant that can perfectly poach your eggs - but alas look no further - the yolks popped upon puncture, whites fully cooked. We also got the biscuits and gravy. I cannot say enough how the fresh ingredients are really the star of the show. It defines Hash House.  To top things off the service was wonderful! The host was welcoming, the server was friendly, accurate, and prompt. The food came out in a timely manner. The environment was warm. Tyler, the GM, was outstanding! The level of community service that the restaurant is involved with is noteworthy. I will always promote and recommend locally ran businesses that promote social awareness...Hash House is a winner all the way around.  We look forward to our next visit!

BtTK36bFD-njzaxPbVwvfQ.text: It is a cool place to go love the  chicken and waffles but I think the price's are getting just to high for what you get this is a above ave spot but the price's say it is much better then above ave so just 4 stars over priced

UDlv7yL969JJVlEesB2ozw.text: Came out to Henderson to attempt the chic fil a.  Couldn't get near it so we went to Hash house.    Josh was our waiter and he recommended some great options since we've never been there.  Best French toast I've ever had in my life. Bananas pecan a touch of cinnamon some sugar butter and syrup. Wow.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Henderson, NV, United States

-tUgggwOOQ3XOwBQ7YNkow.text: This is my favorite place for a good home cooked meal.   The meatloaf is unbelievable, the portion is enough for 2.  Great happy hour, love the chicken fingers with fries for 5.00, it's like a meal.   Haven't had anything I didn't like.

vTAZIazduEktEYQ2erIclA.text: OK so this restaurant has the best food. But so far I have been waiting over 35 minutes for pancakes for my niece.  It's funny when I read a review from the man who wrote that the food was fantastic but the service here has never been good, and then someone from Hash House answers him back and says "sorry we're  very busy." I've been here three times and it's never been busy. Love the food, but very slow service.

z3dFdHQBv9Zvdp_zgkiTzA.text: If you want good food and lots of it this is the place to go! Always have a great time here usually with a large group and they rock it. Food is always yummy and service is always great. And seriously the food is huge so come hungry or be prepared to take food home with you. It's decorated really cute too like modern farm look or something like that.

y5EBT60LKDnwVchCCCySeA.text: This is the best little breakfast joint! Every time we come into town, we go here. They have the best breakfast food around.   The portions are massive, so come with an appetite. We all ordered something different and everyone loved what they ordered. We also always order a snickers pancake for the table to share. (Try it!).   It's also got great decorations. It's a very comfortable restaurant; all of the chairs and booths are comfortable.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Henderson, NV, United States. Bacon avocado scramble
Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Henderson, NV, United States. Chicken scramble
Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Henderson, NV, United States. French toast

NTsARcAD4Z22J-qjA4tbHA.text: Rachel L. was awesome! My in laws are in town and we went in to let them try the food. From the beginning she was good. She played with my baby and made sure we had what we needed for the leftovers.

CrG7L6ZpoEygSgcD0Yr0YA.text: Just had a wonderful brunch with my boys at Hash House A Go Go.  It's the perfect place to bring them because the serving sizes are HUGE!  My teenager got the Biscuits and Gravy with scrambled eggs and could barely finish half of it.  Most of the time when we dine out, he finishes his and then starts picking at mine!  It's nice that I don't have to share my meal with them!  My little one got the pancake, eggs and bacon which is nice because he got a little bit of everything he likes.  I indulged in their super yummy hot chocolate and their pumpkin pancake.  Overall, a great place to come for breakfast/brunch.  I'm going to have to try to venture here for dinner sometime since we've always come for breakfast/brunch!

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Henderson, NV, United States

8mxp5DEz8S3VUOfRHwCEmw.text: The portions are super large, and the food is pretty tasty however when I was there the service was horrible. They charge for every extra. And I probably will never come back to this restaurant.

scYTfI7cFHXsReCZmK0UZA.text: This location is definitely worth the drive away from the strip; there was NO wait time and we were seated and served right away.  Parking was also FREE and abundant.  I'm not sure this would've been the case with hotel locations like the Linq.  I also noticed that the menu prices were cheaper than the menu prices of the hotel locations, about $1 cheaper.  We ordered the Crab Cake Benedict and Andy's Sage Fried Chicken.  Portions were HUGE.  The crab cake benedict was delicious but I felt it came out with way too much extra garnishes. The dish got really messy without much structure.  As for the fried chicken, the skin was sooo delicious!!!!   I liked that they were served with a large portion of fruit (strawberry and cantaloupe ) which was a refreshing way to end the meal.  For drinks we ordered the Caramel All Over Mocha (you have a choice of hot or cold) and the instagram worthy "famous smores mocha") .  Both were massive!!!  We could not finish either one but the waitress offered to go cups, which I thought was a nice touch I was not expecting.  Would make the drive out again !

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Henderson, NV, United States. Fried Chicken, Skin cooked perfectly!
Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Henderson, NV, United States. Crab Cake Benedict and Andy Sage&#39;s Fried Chicken
Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Henderson, NV, United States. Smores mocha

XtA6G7B_GI6Fhwm0C2YlKg.text: Such a good place to Eat for breakfast in henderson! I always been a fan of hash house and only ever been to this locations on the strip! I was happy to find out that their was a location off the strip in henderson! It is a great place to avoid heavy crowds and to get some delicious food! They have a huge menu and have signature drinks! I got the egg scramble with spinach, fruit and oj! It was a good and healthy breakfast! I will definitely come back!

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Henderson, NV, United States. Scrambled eggs with spinach and tomatoes and fruit

xgZWmv1QA2yytlBz3Q4fsg.text: You'd better be hungry if you're eating here! Portion sizes are easily enough to feed two people. This was my first time at this location but service and quality was the same. I decided on the chicken and waffles for brunch today and it was a hit. The sage friend chicken breast was cooked perfectly and super juicy. The bacon waffle was just the right amount of crisp on the outside and fluffy in the middle. So yummy. Since it was brunch time we had to have a mimosa. I went with the deep eddy that has cranberry vodka, asti and tangerine juice. The bartender accidentally made 2 so the waitress gave me a second one on the house. Two thumbs up as I stumble out of here. Lol

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Henderson, NV, United States. Chicken and waffles
Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Henderson, NV, United States. Mimosa&#39;s

zZVN6ISHrtCydPo-adzqrQ.text: It was my first time at HHaGG and it surely will not be my last. I dont think restaurants realize the necessity of having both pancakes AND waffles on the menu, they're like apples and oranges in my opinion. I notice other people prefer one or the other too, this allows a large group with varying tastes to easily settle on an order. Some people like breakfast items whenever or just in the morning, HHaGG serves "breakfast" food all day, which is another huge plus! If youre taking teenagers and kids out for lunch, like we did, you can not go wrong with this place.   Their portions are very generous, even though I liken this place to a Denny's or IHOP, that vague comparison is where it stops because I consider HHaGG food a better taste and quality. Eggs were a big reason why. I've had eggs at all 3 of these places and HHaGG is the only one to have a nice fluffy consistency and cooked just right.  Im giving it 4 out of 5 stars because if your mobility is hindered in anyway - wheelchair, cast, poor vision, etc. - the aisles are narrow and it will be hard to maneuver the place. Ask staff to help assist you when navigating the area, I didn't have to ask but I'm sure they would have obliged. They do have wheelchair ramps inside and outside though, so that's a start!

4IjCR7W9TA52igKxNbJ9ow.text: Looking at the pictures this place looks great! The reality of the experience is underwhelming. When you walk in they have "best restaurant 2014" hanging on the wall, nothing's probably changed since then. Coffee was burnt, waitress recommended a blueberry pancake- the blueberries were sour. The quesadilla we ordered was drenched in sauce and had 1/2lb of jalapenos in the first quarter.  For the price you'd find a much better breakfast elsewhere (It's pricey). Also everything is "Indiana" themed- being from the state nothing here felt familiar.

QEc6dVjCrhSYe_Qs2Fy5GA.text: I like the food at Hash House.  It's insanely big portions so it's like getting breakfast and a take home lunch.  The Bloody Mary's are great- I could have had two more.  This brings me to my issue- the service is always "meh" in this place.  This particular time, we had a large group- and it took the server (who was also the bartender on the other side of the restaurant) 15 minutes to come over and say hello.  We constantly were asking for our server and it got to be annoying.  Our group consisted of about 5 former servers (so we have extra empathy), but at some point, it just gets to be too much.  Finally, when the bill came, he said he couldn't split checks.  Again, I used to work as a bartender/server with the same system this company uses.  I know you can split bills- it's just inconvenient for the server to do.  It's a lazy issue, simple as that.   We still tipped 20%.  Let me use this platform to say:  Even with bad service, you need to tip decently.  Don't take it personal and tip the few extra bucks.   So, all in all, meh.

SBfnzG6BiRkubHpNOgHVhA.text: Very disappointed This place is nothing like the one that was in The M  Cold food Handful of people on a Saturday night. Not open for long at this rate.

2FPFor4MKp0Ivmps8k1wNg.text: Cute atmosphere.  It was our first time eating here. Our food was good and came out quickly. We got scrambles. Our server was nice. I forget her name though. I wasn't a fan of my strawberry lemonade but it wasn't terrible, just lacked sweetness and flavor in my opinion. And the biscuits are dry. They offer gravy with them but I'm not a fan of gravy in general, so I skipped the gravy.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Henderson, NV, United States. Spinach and ham scramble

-kXpJNrWcuDocn3uFdfPRQ.text: I've been here twice in a month and I wish I hadn't returned after the first visit. I get it, the portions are massive and the plates are decorated ridiculously. But let's be real, the food tastes like Denny's at best and will tear your stomach up like the worst diner. It's all hype.  My first visit wasn't great. I made reservations since it was for a Sunday morning. We still wound up waiting for about 15 minutes past our reservation time, despite checking in 5 minutes early. The hostesses were rude and cold. We sat in Yvette's section, which you should avoid doing if you can. It took a while to order drinks. Once we did, my friend's cocoa took at least 10 minutes. Because Yvette forgot it. She tried to play it off like she was a ditz and it wasn't cute. For some reason, they decorate the top of the cocoa as well as the entire saucer and then stick the cocoa mug on top of the chocolate-covered saucer. Even the handle had sticky chocolate sauce on it and it wasn't easy to drink. I got the bacon and avocado scramble with crispy potatoes and a side of gravy. It was bland and actually much smaller than I was anticipated, judging by the massive plates that were being brought to other tables. I never got a refill on my iced tea and it took forever for our waitress to check on us, to bring the check, etc.  I went back today because my grandma was super hungry and wanted to try a new breakfast place. Black Bear Diner (our usual spot) has been letting us down lately so I figured Hash House would be much better, especially on an early weekday morning. Nope. Same waitress. The place was pretty empty and it still took forever for her to greet us and to bring our drinks.   I got the Nashville hot chicken sandwich which was plenty hot, but not a sandwich. It's literally a boneless chicken breast on top of one piece of dry-griddled Texas toast. How is that a sandwich??? The chicken was twice the size of the bread, so it's not like I could fold the bread taco-style either. The flavor was disgusting. It was like eating a spoonful of cayenne pepper. No other flavors at all. The fries are done in the style of Taco Bell's nacho fries, only somehow worse. Terrible seasoning all over them. The little bug crawling on my obnoxious rosemary spear was a nice touch too. Again, never got a refill. Thankfully, my mom got an ice water with her cup of coffee so I was able to drink that when I ran out of tea. I immediately felt sick after eating my food. Let's just say it's the fastest I've ever made it home from Henderson and it almost wasn't fast enough.  The giant portions and the way they plate their food is cool, but there are better (and local-owned) spots around town that deliver tastier food!

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Henderson, NV, United States. Nashvile hot chicken &#34;sandwich.&#34; Fries were gross, chicken had cayenne only, no top bread for sandwich????
Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Henderson, NV, United States. Red velvet waffle ($10.99), bacon, onion, avocado and swiss scramble, crispy potatoes, &amp; side of gravy ($13.99).

lxchSzaRmogte7qrAF42Wg.text: Wow! Food was amazing and talk about big portions! I wanted to try their signature Andy's Fried Chicken and Waffles, but also try their Blue Crab Cake Sandwich...actually there were SO many options that looked good to try...I almost couldn't decide. Luckily, when ready to order, my sister told the waitress she wanted the Blue Crab Cake Sandwich...so I suggested that we share it and she could have some of my chicken and waffles since I felt that I really should try their signature dish upon my first visit there. So glad we did this so I could try both...and both were amazing! The fried chicken batter was full of flavor even the batter for the waffles had flavor even without syrup. There's about 3 or 4 waffles and a generous amount of chicken to top with a dinner knife piercing it upon presentation(their signature "look"). I believe there's supposed to be pieces of bacon drizzles over the waffles and chicken but since I don't eat pork or beef, I asked for it on the side. They brought me a generous amount of bacon in slices (not pieces) and since my sister didn't want it to go with the chicken and waffles, I ended up giving it to my cousin who was taking home some leftovers. It was enough bacon to make a good size BLT or even two breakfast plates of eggs and bacon for the next day. The Blue Crab Cake Sandwich was really good....you could taste the crab! Sometimes I get weary to order crab cakes of any kind because it's a hit or miss menu item. I've had some that taste like a whole bunch of filler instead of crab. This one was good and the spicy aioli sauce used was really good.   My brother in law had some kind of burger that looked good! My nephew had a simple cheese quesadilla that came with orange slices. My other nephew had a small cheeseburger maybe off of a kid's menu. My cousin's wife had an egg and corned beef meal that was served in a skillet. I'm not sure what my cousin ordered, but I'm sure it was good and a big portion. He and his wife ordered some kind of banana pancakes for dessert...I was so full, but had a small piece just to try it...it was amazing!   It's funny because they're known for their large portions, and when I looked at our plates at the end, almost all of us wiped out our plates.  The food was really good that I still decided to give 5 stars after contemplating giving 4 stars due to poor service. It took a while to have someone take our order and the food took a while to come out. Also, I don't recall our waitress coming back to check if we needed refills or needed anything else; and the funny thing is that it was so slow that night. It was a Thursday night and the restaurant wasn't busy at all. Oh well! I think I will still come back.

tDgqEXvCbYj2E8dr7LdGng.text: My son and I went to Hash House A Go Go this morning for breakfast.  The food was very good but the service was beyond horrible.  Once we got out food, not delivered by the server, we never daw him again until he put the bill on the table.  We never got refils on our coffee nor our water.  He never asked how our food was.  He never asked if we needed anything.  He walked by us constantly, helped others but not us. Chances of our going back are very slim!

JD-sxYBs-fAVH1NTaAZG4g.text: I wanted to update all my reviews and instead of a 1 - 5 rating, I want to use my own 1 - 10 rating because I don't think a 1-5 rating gives you enough room to give all aspects of an honest review.  I base my reviews on several issues, some being, friendliness, atmosphere, being clean, quality of food, value, and overall experience are several factors I consider.  I try and stay away from reviewing places that have been reviewed countless times and look to review more of the smaller what I call "Mom and Pop" type places.  I tend to look more for the positive and realize that many people's livelihood may depend on the  reviews.  I realize what some may like, others may not.  My reviews are  how I perceived the places I reviewed, and the experience I had. I would rate Hash House A GO GO on Stephanie in Henderson a 4 out of 10 as I did not have a good dinning experience.

A73xHgNicpmD9xUYmm6cKA.text: Can't believe I've lived in Vegas this long without ever trying this place! The Sage Fried Chicken was AMAZING. If you've ever had Roscoes Chicken this is WAY BETTER! The menu was filled with many options! Our host was great, as well as our Server. They were accommodating when we requested to be moved to a booth, we were originally placed in one of the metal tables behind the bar. Server came back plenty of times to check up. Overall great experience, will certainly come back! My only disappointment was the Bloody Maria! Too plain nothing stood out about it, for the price I could whip myself a better drink at home. Good portions were HUGE, my friend did not finish her Apple Pancakes, thick and fluffy.

-bR5FJC88GIH7PI0sSG8Ew.text: Loved this place.  It was my First Time being here and the food was great, the service was awesome and the presentation was even better.   They have great plates to choose from.  I picked the waffles and chicken. I wasn't able to finish it so it was a good sign.  Really recommend this place

YNPxFako-NPSQGwkkZsgGA.text: Make sure you are hungry before you decide to come here. The portions are MASSIVE!  We stopped by for dinner while in the area and were surprised there was no wait. Thinking back it really is more of a breakfast/brunch place so it makes sense. We had our choice of seating on a Saturday night which is rare when we go out but it was nice as we were with friends so we could be loud and linger without bothering others.  Three of us ordered the sage fried chicken and waffles, there was also a fried chicken salad, grilled cheese and pancakes around the table. The star was the chicken and waffles which came out stacked high and smelling delicious. The waffles had bacon in them which in theory sounds good but I wasn't a big fan of there bacon. They were still tasty but there was just so much food on the plate I focused on the beautifully seasoned friend chicken. I took a bite of my sons grilled cheese and found it was nothing out of the ordinary. In the end I could barely finish half of my meal and I would do it all over again, we were also treated to red velvet waffles with ice cream for dessert to celebrate a couple birthdays. Unfortunately I was so full I could only manage a couple bites but it was yummy.  The service was fantastic at this location. Our server was awesome and incredibly fast and efficient. Prices were reasonable for the amount of food you get. Be careful when ordering drinks as not all beverages are free refills. We learned the lemonade was a $1.00 refill the hard way.  When back in the area we will be definitely visiting again for breakfast.

WHtj80jERWbOSZONXG4FvA.text: With a full house on a Sunday afternoon for brunch, surprisingly we got seated right away and our server (I forgot his name, he's African American with green/hazel eyes, braided hair, nose piercing, and nice eyebrows LOL). He got to is right away and he was super inviting and accommodating to our needs. It was my first time here because I wanted to have the authentic taste of chicken & waffles. Must I say my exceptions were met! Holy Snapple, it's was HUGE but oh so delicious! My cousin and I had to share the plate. I don't know if I'll ever taste chicken & waffles that good here in NorCal. I also had the Spiked Watermelon Lemonade with their take home glass, that drink was the best! So delicious as the right amount of alcohol for brunch time. I'm totally craving it now that I'm writing this lol they have his cucumber ranch that is to die for! VERY light and fresh!   Their bathrooms are also well kept clean!

zIoJ1jA3orbJ30dT8UZazg.text: I've eaten at two HH A Go Go. Always a good experience.  Today at the Henderson, Nv location.... no different. Great comfort food in large amounts.  Meagan, our Server, did everything right.  Great experience for the dollar.  I recommend Hash House A Go Go to everyone with a good appetite.

Sd62n64sGVI4whvpQQgdqA.text: Went here for mothers day,        Now I know on a holiday not to expect any miracles but I have to say this was the worst service i have ever had at any of the locations ( this was my first trip to this location ).          They where not taking reservations so we showed up about 45 minutes before we really wanted to eat and we where just about right it took about 40 mins to get seated.  So far so good staff was very friendly..        After being seated our waitress came and go our drink order and asked if we had any questions? She promptly returned with our drinks and asked if we where ready to place our order.This is where it all goes down hill.      My daughter asked about a sauce that came on a sandwich she was thinking of getting. The waitress said should would bring her a taste of it so she could decide and took the rest of our orders..  Well the taste never came, our orders came out at different times with the explanation from a manager who was dropping the food off that they do not have a hot plate so as it gets done they bring it out right away. Ok  I can deal with that hot food is a plus. My daughter never confirming that was the sandwich she wanted , got that sandwich. We asked for extra napkins 3 times which never came. My son wanted a different dressing and some BBQ sauce, which we had to ask for 3 or 4 times which finally arrived as he was almost finished. Never got drink refills till the very end after we asked another server.         The food was amazing but the service was horrible at best. She seemed to just not retain anything after you asked for it..     I'll go back but not likely to this location...

5xMKYU3kVrRCXPtGo0C0CA.text: love the food and atmosphere at hh, but for the love of god, turn on the mother fucking air conditioning!

rBhWdReZ5KD5yc4LEh7VOg.text: It's a cool place to eat, but the high pitch hurts my ears. It's something in the kitchen.

RjFvW3324eKlD-gJeSS4Eg.text: we always leave with a big smile. We  order waffles for my kids and andys sage benedict

TF3zdPMGE94SGHIlfwiQLw.text: Decent food and good service.  I was not happy with the lukewarm chicken in my hash though.  The food came fast but I would have rather waited a little longer for something hot.

Qs06jdNrNysccrFp3oQ81g.text: I've tried this place twice. Both times the food was not good. I had the chicken fried steak on my first visit. The steak was real tenderized round steak, but it was deep fried with the coating hard and burned. The green beans were shriveled and dry, obviously not fresh but reheated from the night before. The biscuit was OK, but no butter and the little cup of marmalade had a dry skin over it, having been left uncovered in a cooler for who knows how long. The ice tea was OK, but nothing to write home about. On second visit I had the breakfast platter special du jour. Again, the ice tea was OK. But the skillet meal looked like something that had been made up of whatever would soon be by its fresh due date. How can they get away with serving dry wrinkled chopped bell peppers? It's a mystery.  Both visits cost slightly more than $20 with tip. Not worth it.  Not a fan.

YUikHGWoq_dx-zDqwiDhIw.text: Excellent customer service.. Really enjoyed the #3 stuffed burger (#8 in the world).. The BLT Bloody Mary yummy..

veRq5-cjVNNckssMhTGbTQ.text: So, anyone that knows Hash House, knows this place is amazing! I have been to the San Diego location multiple times and am just as, if not more so, impressed with the Las Vegas location!!! Our server Amy, is the most incredible server I have had at any restaurant ever! She is on top of service and is exceptional! Personal and relatable... ask for Amy and she will impress! Thanks Amy, for creating such an amazing experience for us! And celebrating our future!!! You rock! See you again... and shout out to our Latina sister for the champagne!

lsmlJ8bxd-U1y9urOPbzxw.text: I was so excited to have our own Hash House in Henderson, it looks like if these reviews continue we won't have one much longer. I have been to this location twice. The first time it was very busy,so I thought that explained the slow service. but upon returning to a half empty restaurant, we waited over 10 minutes to be seated, another 10 to be greeted and drink order taken. Food was cold, one person in my parties order was totally wrong, no apology, he had to ask for the eggs to be corrected.  I hope they make the necessary changes to stay open and help Henderson thrive.

geG4lv4PQ7u4IKuWZP4Bgg.text: Ended up going here because the line at babystacks cafe was long. Food portions here is huge! I said, "woah" when my food came. I ordered the hh baby burger with a side of mac n cheese. My burger was delicious! It had so much swiss cheese mmmm. I was very shocked when i saw my mac n cheese cause i was expecting a small bowl. It was good but i will get fries instead next time because it was too filling for me. Plus their fries are awesome cause they're crunchy.

SC8EubsfXmt1EKjCJZfcvg.text: Wow - disappointment !!! We loved Hash House at the M and were so excited when a new one opened up on Stephanie - but very disappointing.    We were quoted a 30min wait for a party of 9 and after waiting for an hour we were told the party of 10 that came after us was seated first since they had a larger party.  Waiting area inside is tiny and no covered waiting outside.  Finally seated us.  Tables are small, chairs uncomfortable, music so loud the waiters couldn't hear the orders.    The food as always was fabulous, but my husband didn't get his chorizo hash till everyone else was almost done- we had to waive down help for 15min prior to getting anyone to notice he didn't get his food.  No one offered drink refills.    We called the manager over and instead of being helpful she argued with us about the meal .    May see about getting their great food to go next time and eating in the comfort of home.

KrmJepBgFB06toupzSBGvg.text: Excellent service and great food.  The wait staff was very patient and knowledgeable.  The food was well seasoned and tasty.  We had two dishes... Chicken pot pie and pork tenderloin.

rHY8gBDZkE0hOdzkAaCCVA.text: Great food, service and easy to get in. This is a great place to take family  and share meals because you get a generous amount of food per plate. I had one of the stuffed burgers and it was awesome! Someone else at my table got the chicken fried steak that looked and tasted great. I'm highly recommending this place.

G31GpW3ri5Xc8YEw5JYMmQ.text: First time I been to this location and I'll have to say I won't be back again. Coming in the place seem old compared to the hash house I've been in before. It smelled like a hole in the wall restaurant and our booth was falling apart lol (No joke) the people and their service was good but now let me explain the food. I ordered a bbq rib meal. It comes out with 3 small half sized ribs and a large corn. The taste of this meal was like something you would microwave and leave in the microwave for an hour. I really really don't recommend eating at this hash house and I know my family and I will never come back to it again.

omUGMBRDSTqVgTqXiiE7dw.text: Sadly it only takes one bad experience to ruin a favorite when one can not even look at the restaurant the same.  First off, the staff is and always has been amazing!  However about a month ago, I went in with some friends and got a formerly favorite of mine but it was severely undercooked.  As many awesome experiences as I've had with this place, the one bad one has me second guessing ever coming back.    I ordered the chicken pot pie which is always amazing.  The ingredients are usually prepared to perfection, from the bowl to the veggies, to the chicken, and the sauce.  (I also love the Sage Fried Chicken Benedict which I've ordered many times here and has always been awesome.)  This time the chicken was severely undercooked.  It was slimy and almost raw.  The veggies were also undercooked, but it didn't matter as my dinner was done after a few bites of the chicken.  I brought most of it home, intending to cook it later.  After two weeks of staring at it in the fridge and almost losing my lunch each time, I can say it was an effective weight loss tool, so there's that.    I've been to most of the other locations in Vegas, and I'll be going to the one on Sahara in the future.  I will not likely be back to this one despite many good experiences. I'm also struggling to ever order the chicken pot pie at any of the locations after this experience.  It is a shame because when done correctly, it is an amazing dish, one of their best.

9GLqGVUJdiIygcCPk9S3RA.text: Food is good. Benedict portion big enough for 2 people. Service is slow. Had to wait a lot to be seated, give our drink order, and food order. The server was apologetic, but it wasn't busy. There were only a couple tables filled on our side. It was a bit more than an hour to closing.  Noticed it was a trend when servers constantly had to get the hostesses attention to seat people. The table near us got their food and was missing an order. Manager came over and comped their late chicken and waffles. The customer commented to the table that it was way too drenched in syrup but at least they didn't have to pay.   The smores mocha was melted marshmallow goodness. The coffee was really strong. Dad ordered the grilled chicken sandwich. It looked soft and moist, not dry and overlooked. He's picky but actually loved it. Brother ordered the crab cake Benedict. It was huge. Crab cakes were delicious and so much better with the sauce. Mashed potatoes and biscuit were heavy and dense, so he ended up leaving half. The crab cake sandwich was good. The crab cake is flaky and delicious.  We'll still be back to try some pancakes and hope service is better next time.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Henderson, NV, United States. Crab cake sandwich, yummy. Crab was delicious. I opted for salad instead of fries. I like the cucumber ranch.
Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Henderson, NV, United States. Crab cake Benedict. Huge portion. Delicious crab &amp; sauce.
Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Henderson, NV, United States. Was smore mocha. Really strong coffee. Marshmallow goodness.

W8qFKImG92bmhXK_EKnZxw.text: I came in to Hash House A Go Go for a late breakfast/early lunch. I ordered a mushroom swiss buger because, well, mushrooms. Rather than fries I ordered my burger with a side salad.   I wanted Italian dressing which they do not have at Hash House. The server told me the salad comes with cucumber ranch or I could choose one of their other dressings. He listed regular ranch and a vinaigrette and a couple of others I can't remember. I chose the cucumber ranch. I probably should have gone with the vinaigrette. The cucumber ranch sounds refreshing but I really couldn't taste much. The salad had potential with the romaine, green onion and radishes. But the lack of flavor in the dressing and the strange chewy croutons (cornbread?) were a turnoff.  The burger itself was good. The meat reminded me of the camp steaks my mom used to cook when I was a kid. Not sure of that is a good thing but it was familiar. It was a big burger for sure. I actually had a hard time finishing it and I am traditionally a big eater. The burgers here are "stuffed." Really it was like having two patties with mushrooms and cheese in between. Then there were the standard burger toppings of lettuce, tomato, onion and pickles. The big a$$ knife stuck through the middle to keep the burger together was a bit much. I suppose it was meant to be used to cut the burger in half but I don't roll that way. To me, a simple wooden skewer would have sufficed. I also didn't appreciate the giant spring of fresh rosemary stuck in the top bun. I like rosemary as an herb to flavor foods while cooking but used only sparingly. I am of the school of thought that garnishes should be edible. A woody stem of rosemary is not. On the subject of strange garnishes are the twiggy thinks strewn about my plate. It looked like sticks of burnt uncooked spaghetti. What was that all about? If it doesn't serve a purpose, leave it off my plate, thank you.  Hash House A Go Go is a popular place. They have many locations nationwide that all seem to be busy so they must be doing something right in some peoples eyes. For me, it seems over rated and over priced. Yes, you get a lot of food so the prices are probably fair based on portion size. But if you aren't entirely happy with the food, bigger isn't necessarily better. I enjoy the country atmosphere but the industrial metal chairs are terribly uncomfortable. For those of us who are a little wide side-to-side, the back of the chairs wraps around and digs into the waist and hips. I wasn't really able to sit all the way back so sat forward which led to slipping off a bit. One would think that a place that boasts larger portions would have larger patrons. Appropriate seating would be appreciated. Please take no offense to that statement as it is not meant to be disparaging. Just an honest thought I had while squirming and waiting for my meal. Having now tried Hash House, the curiosity is satisfied and the desire is gone. Will I come back? Perhaps. But it will likely be a while.

6pGEljGUZGHiKwRZMogrYA.text: Love this place! The meatloaf is the best! Service is always good even when it's busy. It was my first time at this location and it was just as good as the others. Will definitely be back.

Py39qWQ2zool64ZrxJZutQ.text: This was my first time here, James decide we'd try it out. We were seated right away, with a friendly smile. The place was not too small and not too big, the deco was nice. It felt comfy.The menu was unique, prices average to me, so after looking the menu over for a bit, I decided on the Tractor Driver combo with the Vanilla waffle,two eggs, and crispy potatoes. James chose the ham,spinach and cheddar Farm Scramble. (Note: he said he wasn't impressed with the place, food or prices.)Even though it took a bit of time before our food came, when it did it looked pretty on the plate. My vanilla waffles were delish, the crispy potatoes weren't as crispy as I'd have liked them and lacked flavor, the eggs were over cooked, if I decide to come here again I'd skip the eggs for sure and try a different side, even though I didn't eat everything just half the waffles and a few bites of the rest it filled my tummy up! Over all...I give this place 3 stars and the fourth star is because of our server Yvette she was on point with her service. She's a great asset to this place. Let's just say my mouth wasn't full and my glass wasn't empty.

AhDst6VxZv-gl_qrrx5tww.text: Everything here comes in a ridiculously large portion. I look more for quality than large portions. My husband? He would rate this a five because large portions cloud his vision.  I've only dined here for breakfast. The food here really isn't bad, but it isn't the best breakfast food I've ever had. I do like the menu variety and their twists on the usual breakfast foods. This would be a good option for a group that has a variety of tastes. They also have a pretty large drink menu. Last time I was here I had the griddled french toast with eggs and mashed potatoes. The french toast was good and I liked the griddled banana on top. The eggs were cooked over easy as requested, but the mashed potatoes were bland. As with all of their dishes it was way too much food. My husband had the biscuits with gravy and that was actually pretty tasty.  This location gets crazy busy, but we didn't have a problem getting a table at 9 a.m. on a Saturday morning. It was getting pretty busy by the time we were leaving.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Henderson, NV, United States. Biscuits with gravy and eggs.
Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Henderson, NV, United States. Griddled french toast with over easy eggs and mashed potatoes.

87yXov96avUS-rFNijC69A.text: I used to live in Vegas and now I'm back in LA... one of the things I miss the most is this place. So many delicious food items and those Bloody Mary's made my heart melt just a little and now cry just a little bc it's so far away  I MISS YOU!!

MDNHIHZXxu1i3xyCTzW3zA.text: Great if you're in the mood to gorge yourself to the point of illness. The food is good and creative but I recommend going to the location in The Linq. Service with be better and portions will be bigger for the same price. However, you may have to wait a bit longer for a table.   My personal favorite item is the Indiana Favorite, sausage gravy, buttermilk biscuits, 2 eggs and mashed potatoes, all piled high into a massive tower of gluttony.   Just what I want for breakfast when I'm feeling like a fatty.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Henderson, NV, United States. Banana brown sugar pancake. MASSIVE.
Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Henderson, NV, United States. Scramble with crispy potatoes and a biscuit
Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Henderson, NV, United States. Sage Fried Chicken Benedict

TgMNHgeVVHziIgUN05SAOQ.text: So first thing wrong here is I ordered corned beef hash. I don't consider it a long stretch of the imagination that ordering corned beef hash from a restaurant named "hash house a go go" would yield anything but a  delicious breakfast of said choice. I was wrong. If you want traditional corned beef hash, don't order it here. It's just pulled corned beef with random diced vegetables in it. NOTE TO CHEFS: THAT'S NOT CORNED BEEF HASH. From someone who has eaten a ton of corned beef hash for breakfast in my days at diners, delis, and golf courses all over the US, this was a huge disappointment.   We also ordered the crab cake benedict. While the crab cake was good, we didn't care too much for the spicy hollandaise sauce it came with. Normally this wouldn't be a problem, because when a restaurant carries a specialty item that deviates from the norm, they usually carry a regular alternative. But not here. They didn't have regular hollandaise for the eggs benedict. Weird, right? But it gets weirder. I order a side of ranch for my crispy potatoes. This was my answer: "We only carry cucumber ranch dressing. Is that okay?" Again, a normal item ruined by some inane need to make things "fancy" when they shouldn't be. (On top of just the fact that they put friekin' cucumbers in ranch dressing. Seriously?!)  Which leads to my final points: if you're going to charge fancy prices for fancy food, first of all don't bill yourself as a homestyle restaurant. Nothing was homestyle about this place aside from the large portions. And secondly, if you're going to charge fancy prices, make sure you have the quality and the taste to back it up. The food here is nothing special. It's kind of like that deal you get in the mail regarding the 60" LED LCD TV on sale for $99 dollars: it's too good to be True.   Would I recommend this place to others? Yes, if I don't like them and want them to have an overpriced breakfast that doesn't taste all that special for the fare.   Would I come back here again? I wouldn't bet on it.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Henderson, NV, United States. Cucumber ranch. Because they&#39;re too cool to carry normal ranch. Are you kidding me?!

Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Henderson, NV, United States. Allegedly this is &#34;corned beef hash&#34;. But it&#39;s not. It tastes okay, but it&#39;s not what they billed it as. Very disappointing.
Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Henderson, NV, United States. Crab cakes benedict.

asV98LlpQRvLkBr7BfBZBg.text: Awesome service.  Greeted at the door promptly and in a very friendly manner.  Food was cooked to perfection!

XR1cobRFAgwMAciu5hTwog.text: Hash House a Go Go still lives up to its name here at this location. I ordered a Sundried Tomato, Basil & Goat Cheese Farm Scramble $11.29. Along with it came crispy potatoes, honey dew, a good sized biscuit with a marmalade. The biscuit was good and of course the scramble. I would have of course preferred there be more goat cheese. But there was an adequate amount. I just wanted more.   My wife ordered The Basic Two Egg Breakfast. That includes scrambled eggs, toast, mashed potatoes, honey dew & bacon. The bacon was t all that great in this one.   I also had a Caramel All Over Mocha $6.99, cold. I didn't know that they used ice. If I had known that I would've either gotten it hot or better yet blended making it like a frapaccino. Not sure if I spelt it correctly but I'm sure you know what I mean. Those sweet blended coffee drinks from Starbucks.   All and all a good experience here. They take reservations here from Open Table and depending on the time you can get up to 1,000 points. That about $10 worth of points. Not bad if you were planning on going there anyway.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Henderson, NV, United States. Menu 3
Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Henderson, NV, United States. Menu 2
Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Henderson, NV, United States. Menu

rOjJOBqOAvC087dhUdNhzw.text: We visited Hash House on Sunday 3/22/15 and were quoted a 35 minute wait.  We were seated after waiting over 75 minutes.  I don't think their method of calculating wait times is very scientific.  After being seated, our waitress came over approximately 10 minutes later and we ordered our drinks and food at the same time.  It took another 25 minutes to get our food (and to see a wait staff person again to request a drink refill).  Hopefully they are just working out the new business kinks and the service gets better.  On to the food...we ordered the Artichoke, Sundried Tomato, and Fresh Spinach Hash with scrambled eggs, fruit, and a biscuit and the Andy's Sage Fried Chicken & Bacon Waffle Tower drizzled with hot maple reduction and fried leeks.  The portions on both meals was over the top and we took home more than we ate!  But, the everything was hot, fresh, and very good. However, the two hours we spent waiting for it colored our experience.

Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Henderson, NV, United States

Sg70eIa_cujk_nCL60OTXQ.text: There is no question that they have the biggest portions you will ever see and the food is very good quality but the service here is terrible and really diminishes the experience. Our server forgot to bring items, took a long time to get our drinks and made smart-ass remarks while we ordered.  It was very disappointing.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Henderson, NV, United States

fJ6Ifg6pLPU2BTVdMqKHAA.text: BIG! Everything is served in BIG quantities. And the food flavors are phenomenal. I've tried a banana latte, it was perfect. I've had a minosa, it was great. The OJ if freshly squeezed.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Henderson, NV, United States

VRQ8vH0tFmH-kE2IhazDag.text: I was really looking forward to trying this place out after all the rave reviews I've heard about the other locations, but I wasn't all that impressed.   I've driven past this place on a weekend many times and the lines are always out the door, so I waited until I could go on a weekday. There was no line and service was super quick.   We ordered the chicken and waffles and the sundried tomato, basil and goat cheese farm scramble. The chicken and waffles was beautifully presented, but the taste was just mediocre. I've had much better fried chicken, and in fact it wasn't all that crispy. Some parts were even a little soggy. Pretty disappointed. The waffles were pretty good though and I really liked the bacon strips inside. The farm scramble was good, but nothing I couldn't make myself. The potatoes that came on the side were nice and crispy and had good flavor.   All in all, the food was just okay and it's kind of pricey for breakfast food. Probably won't be back.

qlimpgDMQomX5fX5dH37aA.text: Great place to visit.   The service was outstanding.  There was plenty of seating and room in the restaurant, so no wait on a Saturday AM.  The menu is very extensive with many different options and combinations.  The portion sizes are huge, so you could even share if you wanted to try multiple items.  The meatloaf is delicious: flavorful and well cooked.  Everything that I tried was divine.  The bacon waffle had real strips of crispy bacon cooked into it!  I was surprised at how crisp it was and how yummy.

tmVDEdijdnZqvEgcaung4A.text: 4.5 stars   The Andy's fried sage chicken benedict was everything I could have ever hoped and dreamed of. Every element of that dish was flavorful, hearty and decadent: the biscuits, the eggs (tip: switch out scrambled for over easy), amazing chipotle cream, crispy bacon, and of course the fried chicken (the meat itself was slightly dry but I guess that's how chicken breasts are). A tad salty but that's the nature of the dish. ($16.99) Definitely recommend!!!!  Service was excellent. She was attentive and friendly, and warned us of the portion sizes. We came on Friday lunchtime and it was about half full. Food came out quickly, but not too quickly. Easy parking as this location isn't the main one.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Henderson, NV, United States. Everything I could have hoped and dreamed for. Andy&#39;s Sage Fried chicken benedict ($16.99)

Z_me8HueBGd5A6ItlfJ4qw.text: The server was super friendly which was the only good thing about this place. Otherwise, the food was extremely sub par. Imagine airport versions of food, but switch the airport for a subway. That's how bad it was. We all got breakfast & 2 of us barely got through half of the food.   Overly large dry biscuit, huge potato slices, mush omelet with ingredients that were certainly not tasting fresh.   Anyway, welcome to Vegas I guess!?

Nicole was our waitress and she was very pleasant, and she did customize every detail of our coffee order  I'll definitely come back soon.

h8HB_LVHulSgNYbPJsKvRA.text: This place appeals to me because I know there's another location on the strip that is very popular. The food portions are huge and flashy. It's a fun time. The inside of this place is also huge. They have beers on tap, and plenty of TVs to enjoy some games playing. It can accommodate large parties at the tables and singles at the bar. Service was excellent. I splurged with the chicken and waffles (with Louisiana spice) and it was worth 3-4 meals for me but I am very glad I got to try it. It was visually a masterpiece. It was definitely heavy and after I was done eating, it looked like I didn't even make a dent. Plenty of leftovers!

PUtg1XyYcxohH7p6yVBv3A.text: I am here for an event on Wednesday. Chef special. I love all of them except the fried chicken cheese. They have the very special fruit soup called "tropical soup", made by a lot of fruit, it is cold, I love it. It would be perfect as a light desert.  Too bad it is not served regularly.  You may ask for it though, maybe they have it in summer!

qLkjC5Nec6oz2S5YKmDrgA.text: The fried chicken eggs Benedict is one of the best things I have ever eaten! My wife got a delicious breakfast scramble. The menu is packed full of a ton of stuff I would love to try next time. Amazing!

N_lusRw3mtPlfhC5eEpclA.text: Never in my life have I been to an Indiana themed restaurant and yet here I was on my birthday, celebrating Indiana style. What is Indiana style, you might ask? It turns out it's farm decor, huge portions, a giant menu with breakfast all day, and a surprising amount of $11 cocktails that assure you "you can keep the glass!"   Hash House was pretty good. I had the chorizo hash and it was smokin hot (temperature and spice wise). My boyfriend had the largest chicken and waffle stack we had ever seen. This was like three meals per person and the leftovers were put to good use in our house.  Service was great and the food came fast. I did not know this was a chain. It was still a fun experience but next time I would go somewhere else with out of town guests.

UkuyBx7xPGuVzPyXCVbK1A.text: This is a "go to" whenever you're vacationing on The Strip. So, when you live in the Valley, that means you get to eat at this "go to" in the suburbs.  Everything you hear about this place is True! Delicious food! Large portions! Great menu selection! And prices aren't too much of a budget-buster.  But, this location was slow! At 6:00pm on a Thursday with less than 20 tables occupied, I'd expect our food to come out a little quicker (took over 20 minutes) and for our waitress to be more attentive to our beverage needs (we had to hunt her down a couple of times to request refills). Also, when mayonnaise was requested, we were given two of the "to go" mayonnaise packets from behind the bar. Did you not want to go to the kitchen to get us mayonnaise, or do you really give requested condiments to dine-in guests in packets? Either way, I was extremely disappointed.

But this store says that they don't sell that, Just the Marijuana Shirts, I asked about the socks and they dont sell that here.  So I asked again about the coffee, and what seemed to be a manager, Told me that none of the restaurants sell the coffee  to the public.  One thing I strive for in any organization is that one person always knows what the other is doing. For this manager not to know about the retail souvenir shops that each store has surprises me. But oh well, just go to another restaurant.

hpmP8wAfRQRVW_ZBS_UaIw.text: I have been wanting to try this place when I lived in Las Vegas.  I just came back for a visit and decided to eat here before my plane.  The waitress was so nice and got us seated right away.  I ordered the chicken Benedict and my friends got the blueberry pancake, and red velvet pancake with eggs, bacon. potatoes.  The both raved how good the red velvet pancake was and ordered extra frosting.  I loved the chicken Benedict.  I could have eaten on it for 3 days it was so big!  The service was great and our waitress really friendly.  My friend also got some coffee drink with whip cream on it.  She loved it.  I will defiantly be back next time I am in Vegas.   So glad this location is here so I don't have to fight the long lines on the Vegas Strip.

WwigSf06QeuUDhjk-Lr3kA.text: This has always been one of my favorite places to go in Vegas for brunch and I am Soo glad I took my boyfriend and siblings here with me this time! We came here for brunch on Wednesday and ordered 4 main dishes to split and boy was it more than enough food for the 5 of us. We ordered the French toast, fried chicken Benedict, sun-dried tomato, basil and goat cheese scramble and the corned beef hash. Everything was amazing, the fried chicken Benedict being my favorite dish of them all and the scramble being the one I would pass on next time. The French toast to me was too soft and soaked in the egg batter just a little too long but my sisters seemed to love it. The service was also amazing and everything came out in such a timely manner. Our waitress was super attentive and made us feel right at home. I can't wait til I can come back on my next trip!

i4iMVAAf2bxGVjCrAuKL_w.text: We showed up on a Sunday around noon, there was a wait, understandably. There were so many empty tables though. The atmosphere is cute and a good breakfast/brunch spot (especially to soak up some alcohol from the night before). The staff was pleasant and prompt. Would definitely recommend this for an easy, inexpensive spot.

PfqLwuLfU39vyzb3um_Orw.text: Ordered the Chicken Benedict.  The chickens & mashed potatoes were so overly salty I couldn't eat them.  I ate part of the biscuits and the bacon.  When I was ultimately Checked on the server asked if I wanted something else.  Due to time I said no.  She said she was going to speak with manager.  She came back with tab and $4.99 was deducted from my total for the partially eaten meal.  Seemed crazy to me but I was not going to create a issue.  Seemed odd the manager did not take time to come see me.  And odd to deduct such a small amount for basically a uneaten meal.   I have no plans to ever go here again based on this experience.

AJDhrmQZCVKvIjhqqp3AeA.text: After seeing Hash House a Go Go featured on Travel Channel's Food Paradise and Man v. Food, I've wanted to check it out when I'm in Vegas.  The day finally came during my last trip to Sin City. Though there are four locations in Vegas, we stopped by this location since we were in the area.  The restaurant is a standalone location in a large shopping mall.  Arriving around 12:30pm, we were seated without wait. As we perused the menu, our waitress came and greeted us.  She asked if this was our first visit and after we said yes, she talked about their food, the large portions and gave us some of her recommendations.    Our order: Sage Fried Chicken and Waffles - the entree has two sage fried chicken breasts piled on top to four waffles with a slice of smoked bacon baked into it and topped with a hot syrup reduction and fried leeks. The whole tower has a large knife holding it together.  The chicken was moist and nicely seasoned. Ingenious to have a strip of bacon baked into each thick waffle. Delicious and yes, a huge portion.  Famous Twisted Flapjacks with Blueberries and Lemon Curd - Al Roker says they're bigger than your head!  The pancake was fluffy and had a generous amount of blueberries in it.  By mixing a little lemon curd with the maple syrup, it gave it a nice sweetness with a hint of tartness.   Glad I was able to finally try the sage fried chicken and waffles.  It is one of the best chicken and waffles that I've tried.  Our waitress was friendly and I will be back in the future to try her favorite, Hash House fried chicken benedict.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Henderson, NV, United States
Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Henderson, NV, United States
Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Henderson, NV, United States

o3vJ-3ia4C9okJWoLzjo-g.text: Good but not Great.  Ihad heard so many good things about this place, I had to give it a try when I was in Vegas.   I was disappointed.   First, the entire service was slow,  and it wasn't busy - 11:30am.  Waitress never checked on us except when delivering food.  We started off with fried pickles - four slices of pickles with pablo coating $5.  That was $1.25 per slice and they weren't that good.  My wife had a strawberry lemonade  - it was warm.  Had to stir it for a few minutes to melt the ice to cool it down.  Not a good start.  We then had their famous chicken and waffles.  They were really good - chicken is a hit.  I wasn't a fan of the full, thick slice of bacon in the waffle.  I would have preferred the bacon be crumbled up so I could get the flavor in each bite.  The flavors were good and I can see why it is their most popular item.  The portions are HUGE.  My wife and I split the plate and it filled me up.  I am a big eater.  I will probably return, but it just didn't live up to the hype.  Sorry. :(

tBQ7KhdePu40bO4ZRkPphw.text: My very first brunch in Vegas and it wasn't disappointing!   I ordered the smoke salmon breakfast, my husband had the chorizo skillet, both dishes were full of flavors.  My scramble eggs  came with salmon, Brie cheese, tomato and fresh basil on the top. The potato were well seasoned, the biscuit could use some improvement it was fairly dry and not flaky! Also I ordered a cappuccino which actually came out like a double macchiato.  My husband loved his dish too, I tried some of the meat and it was absolutely delicious.  Service was great and professional, the general atmosphere was nice too.  I will definitely look forwards to try more of their menu.

Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Henderson, NV, United States

Krr16upDIcQ-hzXy4AqIKg.text: I usually go to the location on Sahara which is my favorite but this location was pretty good. While the environment doesn't have as much character as the Sahara location it still holds that funky fresh farm feeling. I always order the watermelon kiwi lemonade, it has delightful sweet and sour flavors. It was our first for the red velvet flapjack, let me say it's a must do if you are a red velvet fan. Another trusted favorite is the sage chicken. The portions are huge! Come with a hearty appetite.

qi8KhRFkQAqkvKKoi-vNRA.text: Went here for dinner a few weeks ago with my wife, sister and brother in law to celebrate. We always love the food here. The service was great and overall it was great. But I think we might have gotten food poisoning. Very disappointing

4W_T2J7y_tQ1so87Zw4nqA.text: The food was good; we got a snickers pancake that was heavenly (and I don't usually like pancakes!). The portions are huge, so no one is going away hungry.   My only complaint is that when I visited, my party and I were asked to wait to sit, even though more than half of the restaurant was empty. So that was weird. Once we were seated, the server took care of other tables who sat after us before she got to us, which wasn't ideal. I hear good things about this restaurant all the time, though, so I'll give it another shot.

h11H5rgRQmaGx7KojZj5tQ.text: Today was my second time eating here and it's still so good! Our waitress was so awesome and friendly! I got the salmon Benedict and it was so good! Great price and big portions, I couldn't eat all of my food.

effmIwMp9T9tpi8PSI-R7w.text: The best breakfast in Henderson.  The fried chicken and snicker pancakes are highly recommended!

Wx1fMzt33dZlDA_aSJZQmA.text: Not too impressed with the service or the seating. They seated 5 of us at a small table instead of a the empty booth that was available! I asked for a booth and was told that it would take 20 min longer to seat us. The poor service takes away from what could have been a good meal

RC_34jlLTddGdjFPebLGcQ.text: Worst service ever!!  I have never stiffed a wait staff before.  I typically leave between 20-25%.  We showed up about 7 PM.  Not real late for Henderson on a Wed. night.  It took 15 min to get a drink order in, and I asked about the special on the menu for the wine.  When the server came back he mumbled something, I asked him to repeat it and still had no idea what he said so I ordered a diet Pepsi.  My husband was looking at the beer and was considering which he wanted to order, but he was never given the chance to order.  Even asked if he could order a beverage and the server walked away.  So our food came and we had no utensils.  And no one in sight was going to give us any so my husband went to work and found forks for us to eat with.  Seriously?  This is a service town.  HH has been one of my favorite places for the 10 yrs that I have lived here.  I guess the Sahara location is the only one that is worth going to.  Can't wait to see what will replace this when it closes!

2Ff4vuw_P4uwtrgPYjvqWg.text: I heard a lot of great things about this place BUT it just didn't do it for me. The food tasted OK but didn't have much flavor. I was pretty disappointed.

g8tKfu99rS6mKly2GmSLzg.text: This food arrived to the table looking like an artistic project. It didn't only look good though. The chicken breast was juicy and the batter was unique and delicious. I ate chicken and waffles to contentment and had two more meals at home from the leftovers. Can't wait to go again.

iCvbaXIUoltd70fyMNCf-g.text: Service was very nice, friendly. Nothing else was worth going back for. Service was very slow. My potatoes were good. My husband's were very bland, almost like they forgot to season them. My meatloaf was way overdone and cold. My husband's eggs were good. Overall a mediocre experience. We might give it a second chance sometime, but we certainly won't rush to get back there.

m6W2pBbj0kpZo_iGObcYKw.text: I came here for dinner shortly after the location opened.  I ordered the chicken and waffles and my husband ordered one of the massive burgers! Both were delicious and I have never seen portions so large. Will definitely be coming back to try the breakfast soon.

DewDKQ1pYMH1kn0SAbfGwg.text: Not very impressed with this place at all. Not very busy for a new restaurant and now I know why. What kind of breakfast place doesn't serve a variety of jams when you provide toast and biscuits? This place. Food was well below average. The hash houses in the casinos are far better. Will NEVER return to this location. Waitress to forever to pick up the check and we were paying cash, I needed change, I was going to be late for an appointment so I have her what I had and it cut her tip in half cause I couldn't wait any longer for her to bring change so I could leave her a bigger tip. Sad service.

OcjdtQHRT2QX9nj-nxuJJA.text: This Hash House never disappoints from day one!!  Love The friendly staff, DELICIOUS HUGE FOOD, and amazing drinks. Keep doing ya thing ya'll;)

K2Uk4fuRL2mEDU_BFaZ6Qw.text: My boyfriend and I received a warm welcome and overall good service from the staff. I can't give any good feedback from the food. It seems like a classic case of quantity over quality. The serving size is huge but the food is bland. Their fried chicken are tasteless. They added bacon bits in the waffles, which sounds great, but it just didn't taste right for some reason. My boyfriend says they should have good burgers since he liked it when he ate at the Decatur location but we won't be coming back here.

hl30xtkqRaKLaCbFBqPyjA.text: Great food, great service. See Nicole, she's awesome! Super friendly, awesome ambiance. Definitely coming back.

aVAd9qZiSdQAMZajipXVsQ.text: Very disappointing! We had 2 waiters taking our order because they couldn't figure out who was taking care of our table. When they finally figured that out, they took our order down and took them more than 40 minutes to even bring out our salad. Our burgers and fries were cold! And I forgot to mention they didn't even have their dough ready for their famous chicken pot pie. Horrible! Get it together!

HFKtxDYpSiGgfbwF5xLPDw.text: Hash House A Go Go is phenomenal. The service is stellar and the food is absolutely to die for. Breakfast spot of choice whenever we are in Nevada. Took hubby for his birthday breakfast - he had the chorizo hash - yum!!
