znitnQ4gV4THdI8gp9LGMA.text: Loved it. Got the stuffed blue cheese and bacon burger. Next time chicken and waffles. Hope it meets the Man Vs. Food testimonial.

QjFtyG9bQEXzUuGJiJ0wjQ.text: First time eating here and I'm not that impressed. First of all,i get there with my 2 kids and ask for a table for 5 (i was waiting for my friend and her daughter to get there) the table becomes available but then they tell us they can't seat us til the whole party gets there. WHAT? !!! That's not how other restaurants do it. They normally will seat you even if the rest of your party isn't there yet. What's the deal with that? Then i order the bacon waffle and for as big as the waffle is, there's only 2 slices of bacon in it and to be honest, there's really nothing special about it. I do wanna go back and try other things on the menu, i hope those are better. And they really should change their policy about not seating people until their whole party gets there. If there is a reason for that then please enlighten me.

fqgo99w3kHGiMFgj3tyHRQ.text: Never coming back my family and I came in to eat waited 20 minutes to be seated which is understandable. Took forever to get our drinks took another 20 minutes for the server to even take our order. Than we sat there for about 45 minutes waiting for our food then we asked the server she still said we had four tickets in front of us. I had to be to work and couldn't believe the service so we left letting the server to cancel the order. Poor service I'll definitely never go again or recommend this place.

Walked in and was told there would be a 10 minute wait being we didn't want to sit in the bar area....Okay no problem but then we finally got seated and it was at the bar area ( which we asked not to be seated there) we sat there for about 15-20 minutes before someone came over to our table. The waiter didn't know the specials and the menu was very small nothing like the other locations and the waiter said the reason was because the kitchen couldn't get it right so they are going to offer that for now. So we sat and waited after a while we decided just to leave. Very disappointing never got our drinks and didn't get to order food.

PaR4muBho2w-CrtfLAooYw.text: The atmosphere and amount of food you get are both great.  But the flavor was seriously lacking.  We tried the salmon hash scramble thing and the chicken & waffles.  Both dishes were very bland, and the salmon tasted like it was canned.  Will not be back.

CCDCz_nUMK4RYUfd6FFsjQ.text: Great food ... Portions aren't as big as the other locations but service was great and food tastes amazing ... We ordered the banana waffles and they made a special order smores latte for my daughter with no expresso.

r5U8V_blfcDMQtL5XaPbrg.text: I love the atmosphere and the service. The portions are large and the food is very good. Unfortunately, it can get very loud here so I am giving it three stars for the noise and the small child that was allowed to run freely throughout the restaurant.

2yKkK-7MGAIdYIEpNE2pEg.text: Not sure why the bad reviews!! This was our 3rd time here since they opened!' I  that we don't have to drive across town now. Amazing food and we have always had above excellent service. One of the waiters even brought my son a free Watermelon Drink today. (Said because he wasn't smiling) We always try to visit in the not peak hours to avoid wait times. My ONLY critique is the chicken was a little dry this time. Still worth 5 Stars. Can't wait till we have out of town guests to being them.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Henderson, NV, United States. Tried something new. The Chicken Pear Salad! OH MY!! Yummy!

JnqPWjIc5SOLoQx-7QMdZA.text: I kept hearing about this place all while I was in Vegas. We finally tried it for dinner the night before we went home. Crazy portions! If you can't eat a lot, you WILL be taking some home or sharing. I had a burger, my boyfriend had a sage chicken dish, and his grandfather had a breakfast meal (not quite remembering what it was). Long story short, good food. Nice atmosphere. Clean. Nice wait staff. I liked this place a lot! Reason being that I did not give it 5 stars is because I feel that there wasn't anything incredibly special about it except for the big portions. It was good food...but did not stand out to me in taste. I would love to come back for breakfast sometime and see how that compares.

SUPKzXybLXmbsttbAeqt4Q.text: If I could give zero stars, I would! It started out with us walking in. The restaurant looked pretty empty so we thought we would be seated at a reasonable time. Nope! It still took almost 10 minutes. Once we were sat, it took another 10 minutes for a server to finally arrive to our table to say, "I'll be with you in a moment". That moment was another 5 minutes. She finally came back, we gave her our drink order and our kids' food order. We ordered the kid's hamburger, the kid's chicken tenders with ranch, the meatloaf skillet and the pancake. I also ordered the hot chocolate. She took our order and I didn't see her again for awhile. A food runner brought out our food. My youngest had the chicken fingers and he didn't get his ranch with his food. He won't eat it until he has the ranch with his meal. Unfortunately, by the time we got his ranch, his food was already cold. My husband's potatoes on his dish were cold and underdone. My pancake had a horrible aftertaste. It also tasted like they didn't clean the flat top because it also had an odd savory taste. I took 3 bites and could no longer stomach it. I couldn't touch my hot chocolate either because nowhere on the the menu did it mention they were going to drench it in cinnamon. I didn't even taste it because I absolutely hate cinnamon. My husband ended up trying it and said that it just tasted like cinnamon water with a hint of chocolate. Only 1/4 of the food was eaten. The server obviously didn't care that we hardly touched our food. The next time I saw her, instead of asking how everything tasted or if there was anything wrong with the dish (since I clearly didn't touch it in awhile), she asked if we wanted boxes. At that point, I was livid. We ended up just asking for the check because I was disappointed and angry. It took another 5 minutes for her to grab the check! We left there with a tab that was over $50 for food that was hardly touched because it was inedible and no service. To top it all off, we left there hungry! Apparently, I paid this place money to leave hungry, which makes me even angrier! So disappointed! Thanks hash house! I now have to go to another restaurant and pay another establishment after leaving and paying your establishment to eat some edible food since you miserably failed to provide any service or food that we could eat.

X2b7QN53Qi650RwcxUkFKw.text: Absolutely the best place to go in your Chest day!!! Good farm fresh food. And lots of it!!!

cjpSbzE4V5qpIV1yjODIgw.text: I ordered the one thing on the menu specifically designed to induce immediate diarrhea, The Ranchero. Two bites in and I could already feel the squirtles.

N8EWGkxNutsaeOdSRvWJ4g.text: Good food, nice atmosphere, good wait staff.   Matt Diem took care of us and he was energetic and very helpful with the menu.  You must try the pancake (no "s")  you can get one  giant pancake that will fill your plate.  Great Menu !

Restaurant seemed well maintained and the decor is interestingly nice :)  Overall it was okay. Will we be back? Umm, maybe but not too soon.

People say it's expensive, but for the quality and mountain of food they give you, it's quite a deal! Good for families and adults without kids. Rxq3nH8j2_q9EXJTkivl5g.text: The food is very expensive. Vanilla wafers are dry and you get 3 teaspoons of syrup. The cobb salad is soaked with dressing.  The bread pudding dry, hard. Don't bother to eat here. If you are in the area cafe rio in same shopping  plaza is 100 better. Or go to Panders around the corner. Or go to zuppas. Really not worth the $$$ and service sucks.

rwEVG1VSwrpeWRUJ2SlOpA.text: The portions are Ridiculous and a waste of food because in the end its all about the food...pass....booths are cramped for a party of 4.... They do have a different spin on the presentation of the food but give me good food to go along with that hearty portion...

y3IIoDpLKjwnQSHyTRm-1w.text: Sad to say... That night that you go out for your cheat meal and it wasn't worth the cheat. I was so looking forward to this date night with the fiance, celebration and a cheat meal, what can better? But unfortunately the dish I ordered was terrible and cheap tasting.... I could have gone to macaroni grill or out back, but I thought we should splurge and eat some amazing food, food that should have stood out from the rest. But I was sorely disappointed and wish I had choose some where else. The waitress was friendly and the service was fast but I recommend that you stay away from the smoked salmon pasta salad that advertises sun dried tomatoes, smoked salmon, spinach, pesto and bacon. Sounds delicious , but it wasn't! The salmon, pesto and sun dried tomatoes where no where to be found and I could have made it better myself.  If only I had read the reviews before I ate there... I had high hopes for this chain in Henderson, because driving across town for the other locations was always a hassle, but if they keep this up, this restaurant will be closed in no time. #canigetmymoneyback #hashhouseagogo #$72

7syXA605IJC9EN1B-84ZSQ.text: This is more like a 2 1/2, than a 3...  From the moment you walk in to the restaurant, the fact that they couldn't care less is abundantly clear. From the attire and looks of boredom on the hostess staff, to the blatantly empty tables - hash house wants you to know they are a different kind of restaurant.   (Side note - I work in a restaurant and understand that sometimes certain tables cannot be sat. It is brunch at a brunch restaurant - seat all the tables or put a "reserved" sign on the table. Period. )  We are seated in the time we were quoted (15-20 minutes) and waited about 4 minutes to be greeted. Our greeting was bizarre since the server was just "helping out" our actual server. She was all over the place and couldn't even make eye contact. Our bloody Mary's took a while and were mediocre. Our food took a very long time (we were not alone in this as several tables around us seemed agitated by the amount of time the food took) and our server came back only after a manager had stopped by to check on us. We were abruptly given a check while still eating and when I asked for a refill on my soda, was given a mountain of ice. Overall, not a great experience and we will not be returning.   Food - 4 stars; corned beef hash was delicious, but not what you may expect. Chicken and waffles: beware, the chicken is bone-in, but delicious. Waffles were dry. Fried leeks were a great touch.   Service - 2 stars; if you want a bizarre experience and have your schedule clear...this may be your spot...

XFMJ66p-HsVIoZqOun99HA.text: Our waitress was extremely pleasant. I wish I could remember her name, but she is from California and enjoys beach volleyball. Lol she was awesome.   The fresh squeezed orange juice is amazing! It's actually fresh squeezed and you can tell it doesn't have a bunch of sugar added.   Portion sizes are huge so be hungry when you go! :)

Dissapointed with "eggs benefict" style with mash potatoes and red sauce.   No holladaise sauce here.  Wife's order wasnt complete.  Better luck finding a hole in the wall

TNLUwORFfptVYx49J8QHoQ.text: HASH HOUSE A- NO NO!  This is not our first time here- the first time my husband and I went, we LOVED the food and the service.  We couldn't get over the delicious Bacon! Bacon! Bacon! Appetizer and the Huge, yummy burgers!   However, this time, we brought our kids with us as we were celebrating a special family event and the events of the evening (Service & food) absolutely tainted the rest of the night and the mood of our celebration!  We ordered the yummy Bacon appetizer that we'd been telling the kids about and when it arrived- it was cold, floppy bacon covered in congealed grease! The smell alone was off putting and we were dumb founded! We sent it back and our nice waitress was horrified that the busboy, brought this "Unacceptable" product out!  When she returned with it she told us that they put it on the grill - UH, not even my kids would eat it! Sent it back-and moved on with the meal- still trying to keep our smiling celebrating faces as others who arrived well after us- were getting their meals- (So, no appetizer, no meal) Finally, the food arrived, the kids food was delicious  Pancake and bacon waffle (yay- that bacon DID taste good!) We had mentioned that my hubby and I were just splitting the burger because they are enormous - but it was brought out on a single plate (not a big deal, but the nights errors were starting to add up) the busboy brought us a plate and he just sort of flung it in my general direction-(still trying to be polite and smile) I ask for some mayo from our waitress- by the time our waitress came back to see if the busboy brought it - I had already finished my half!  With all this  happening, I was no longer happy, but the kids were happy so we were going with it- as we were wrapping up the we asked the waitress for a "to go" box for my daughter's pancake remains and we waited for 17 minutes for her to come back to our table and by time she returned, she had forgotten that we ever asked for it- (seriously, it was 15 feet from our table!) My mood ruined, feeling frustrated and incredibly disappointed in this experience- we get ready to pay, now, here's the thing- as parents of twins a night out a huge deal for us, so we pick our places carefully- I am very sad that this happened, but more needed to be done to recognize that we were the Murphy's LAW table.    Although, thoroughly disappointed in the experience we still left a nice tip because we understand how the food service world is, however, I am so saddened that it had to be on a night that was so special and we left deflated. So, it seems that consistency was the issue- why was the first time so wonderful and this time terrible? I've no idea, but we will not return to find out! :(

tygRp_YfFCmiEor36tRFoA.text: I had heard such good things about this place so I was excited to try it with my parents who were in town for the weekend. For being a Saturday morning, we were actually seated quite quickly. We looked at the menu while we were waiting so we were ready to order as soon as we were seated. Our server promptly took our order and made some helpful suggestions for things to order. The portions are HUGE so my parents and I shared a hash and flapjacks which was enough for all of us. I wasn't particularly impressed by the food. The hash eggs were a little over-cooked and the flapjacks had a rubbery texture. We also had a side of chicken sausage which was probably the best item. Overall, a decent brunch restaurant.

hDGCWJWTgWJpd_lVj_WOOA.text: We have loved Hash House on Sahara for years. Then moved over to the one at the M. Equally good. So we were excited when the one on Stephanie opened since we live in Henderson. Wow! What a disappointment. We've given them four tries. No more. Service is ridiculous, food sub par and the music was so loud we couldn't even talk. There's hardly anyone at this location. I doubt they remain open.

cTEQkFPheH_8VYyl0866ng.text: Our party of 5 sat comfortably in a booth and our service was excellent. The meals were delicious and the presentation was excellent. Ricardo was our server and he had a great attitude and made excellent recommendations for meals. Only disappointment was that the eggs benedict only had one egg. Otherwise, wonderful meals and I look forward to dining here again.

1aDTH0HZ8EtOQ7_d9ygNsA.text: Maybe it's just me but, I was not impressed. I had heard so much about how great Hash House is. I found it average. The portion sizes are insanely humongous but, it is okay food. Not bad but, just okay. There are better places to pig out on breakfast. Meh.

LcJMwC9h3SAQPcZ2EdPAvg.text: This place is very yummy. My first encounter with a hash house was in Hillcrest, CA. I've had a fair share of taste with the menu but the one thing that has stuck out was the Andy's Sage fried chicken benedict. The portion is huge, my boyfriend and I always share and he eats like a monster. The bottom layer is a large biscuit, tomato, spinach, chipotle sauce, TENDER fried chicken, bacon, mozzarella and scrambled eggs BUT we get our eggs over medium. I love breaking the yolk over everything and eating it together. By far, in my opinion the best thing on the menu. I love a hearty breakfast and this place hits the spot when I want to leave full and satisfied. On weekends plan on waiting a long time though, this place is a trendy breakfast spot on the weekend so it does get busy.

knUHBpkdf0BR9MgWJL2JNw.text: What a great place. My husband and I just grabbed a seat at the bar. Robert served us. He was very pleasant and attentive. I ordered the kiwi watermelon cocktail. It is so refreshing and delicious. We decided to share two plates. We got the #5 hamburger with the bacon, avo, and cheddar cheese. Amazing! We also got the bbq chicken sandwich. That was very tender and juicy. Great if you want something a little healthier. We will definitely come back!

We were pleased with the service and the food. The staff were great and we had the pleasure to meet Jason the GM. I will definitely come back.

WI8UElLSuhrP3SNyOUMU1Q.text: Came out to Henderson for work and my friends recommended this restaurant. Specifically the bloody Mary's which were so good. The food and staff were just as exceptional.

i8vtpoH6g0KduHMMpcAAig.text: We've been in Vegas for a couple days now spending a ton of money for 2 ppl for mediocre food when told some places were "amazing" and have been disappointed.  Found out about this place on a blog I follow and so glad we did! Food-5 stars, service-5 stars, Prices-5 stars.  Portions are huge, which sometimes I feel makes food lose its flavor because they want to impress you with size and not taste or consistency, not the case here.  My husband is the pickiest eater and he said "wow, this is pretty good." I about fell out of my chair.  Go here, you won't be disappointed!!!

oqtJTDcvB8qAmBBTK4hGdg.text: Ridiculous portions.  Food was good.  Service was ok.  Not many people there so we were worried.  But very interesting twists on items.

i8qkDtT-M0UfeO7T6cTx0A.text: This place is amazing! Expect to be immediately overloaded by Carbs and accept your fate.   The menu:  1.Blackened Chicken on Pumpkin Mash- Great favor and not at all dry. The pumpkin mash is mixed with old fashion spuds and is well flavored and not overly pumpkin.   2.Marshmallow Cafe Moca- This may be closing into a new addiction. Blow torches melt down the marshmallows creating a soft shell over the Mocha. Chocolate powder and sauce is liberally drizzled over the cup adding flavor and flair.   3. Fried Green Tomato Stacks-A good solid choice. Not too crispy and not soggy.   My party was too full for dessert. I fully intend on returning to try them, if not just for the Marshmallow Moca again.   On a final request to the house:  Stock Ginger Beer mainly for Moscow Mules!

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Henderson, NV, United States. Marshmallow Moca!

1fEqQlfS1IRaV-CN4eoDMw.text: I went to this location for my birthday dinner last night! I am vegan and they were so accommodating! I got a customized scramble made just right AND they honored my request to not have it prepared on the grill they cook meat on....it came in it's own sizzling cast iron skillet! I normally get so frustrated when I go to non-vegan restaurants because they are not very accommodating. I wish I could remember the young lady's name who served us...she was awesome! (I was there at around 4:45 pm on 1/2/18) I have already recommended this location to all my vegan friends!

xJmE7E3PdFOwsfqDz8hFqA.text: Hash House always underwhelms me. The raved about sage fried chicken and waffles made me sad, and the sage chicken and eggs benedict, while better, was still nothing to call home about. I did quite enjoy my tangerine juice, and service was good, but I would not return any time soon. The portions are outrageously large, whether that's a plus or minus, I'll leave up to you.

jYHZ2KfTuh5i5b4imkBfdw.text: Mmmmmmm.....  Yummmmm......  Well worth price/portion!  Even though Josh was busy he still was sure to check up on you.   It was fairly busy we had visited on a Thursday.   Our party of 3 had:  1. Crispy hand hammered pork tenderloin w/ market yellow tomato, spinach, bar b' que cream and topped w/ scrambled egg 2. House smoked fresh salmon, basil pesto, fresh tomato and melted brie cheese 3. Sage Fried Chicken & Waffles Two sage fried chicken breasts with hardwood smoked bacon waffle tower, hot maple reduction and fried leeks It was all delicious no complaints!   Even got The Famous HH S'mores Mocha - DELISH!!!

LT0TwKdl5HPlvIk2zovWCw.text: Huuuuuge portions! Chicken and waffles is literally a mountain of food. I had a pork dish i think it was called a hammered pork loin or something like that. There was a ton of flavors going on. Not sure all of what was in it but it was good. I had to tap out though, no way i could eat it all as it was too big.

drh3lRTBefJRkPT3vmFQKg.text: Came in without reservation with 10 people and were seated in less than 15 min. The meals are HUGE. Fast and friendly service. Highly recommend!

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Henderson, NV, United States. Spinach side salad + chicken
Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Henderson, NV, United States

clkybeq_BeHZMhpLsB11BQ.text: Wow! What a great find for happy hour! Super fun bartender -Glenn! Looking forward to coming back to try their brunch and dinner!!

eHy3iLitHgzv0YUSr82PGA.text: It was my first time to Hash House A Go Go in Vegas. I heard about this place through a friend and thought I'd check it out. If you don't know about this place, they're located on 555 North Stephanie St. Henderson. We didn't really have to wait too long, we went around 10a with no reservation. As for parking, there's plenty of it being that it's in a shopping center. They're open from 7-9ish I believe but close on Mondays.   The staff is really nice and our waiter explained the menu being that we're new comers. They're known for their chicken! It was on Man vs. Food and that's what we went with. I ordered Andy's Sage Fried Chicken ($13.79) and it was Ono (Great)! The chicken was nice and juicy and the sauce was really good too. I recommend Andy's Chicken.   I do have to let you know that the portion size is huge. I did not finish and you can easily split the meals there. They do give military discount (25%) so make sure you ask. The restaurant is nice too. It's clean and has a little rustic feel to it.   If you're ever in the area, I recommend checking this place out.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Henderson, NV, United States. Andy&#39;s Sage Fried Chicken ($13.79)

qhVUDVk8pllNal_18cczDA.text: We came on Christmas day, and THANK YOU for being open! Plus thank you for not charging for parking and serving some huge amount of food. Everyone was wearing very cute sweaters and most seemed to be OK with working on the holiday. Our server was very happy and patient. We have only eaten at this chain maybe a few times, so neither of us thought we got what we ordered (I really think it would be great to have a picture menu!) My husband wanted a Benedict and by no definition did he receive one . It was simply a pile of food that somewhat contained what the menu said, and he was disappointed. He has lost a lot of weight over the last few years and his plate was covered with biscuits and potatoes, so he ate the chicken and eggs and put the rest in a to-go container. Oh well. I thought I was ordering something with a smoked salmon but got a odd cooked scramble that I ate, but would have never ordered again. In our opinion cooked salmon and eggs don't compliment each other well. Needless to say, I too had to box most of what I got.  He did enjoy his nitro coffee, the jelly on my plate (peach) and one waiters Darth Vader sweater. lol  We will return, happily. We will just try to order better next time! You are still a chain that I love and wish would appear in my hometown!

E9p3cz_JMTrq-dVlGtbt7w.text: Okay, I've eaten here a number of times, and can truly say that I am un-impressed.  Once you get over the hype/ theme of the restaurant, you will quickly come to learn that the food here can be easily made at home.   Now here is my criticism : 1. The food lacked flavor  2. The price for just a single pancake ($7.99) is outrageous  3. The food is never hot 4. The coffee is always closed  5. The only free refillable drink here is water  Overall,  my brother enjoys this place but I can definitely miss this.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Henderson, NV, United States. Cheeseburger and fries
Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Henderson, NV, United States. Buttermilk Flap Jack

GlbuxBvNoFOGLQ_zKGimHg.text: Service was terrible and the restaurant was pretty empty. Out of some of the drafts. Sat at the bar.  Only had a beer and left.

DZlJZ9W-rkQPsuJVmihTqg.text: I have been going to Hash House, since we moved here and when it was at the M casino. The move to Stephanie was a good idea. Better parking and you don't have to walk through a casino. This location is definitely the non-busy one. You don't have to wait forever on a weekend morning.  Now the food, I have tried many of their dishes and my favorite is their legendary chicken and waffles. The other items, it was a "nope not again" deal. Not a big fan of their sundried tomato and feta scramble or their smoked salmon dishes. The chicken and waffles are pretty bomb though. The meatloaf is good and anything with syrup is nice as well. I have brought many guests to HH and it's always a win for out of towners.   The servings are huge, so more than likely you will have take away.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Henderson, NV, United States. Front: chicken n waffles - Back: chicken bennedict
Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Henderson, NV, United States. Meatloaf
Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Henderson, NV, United States. Honey glazed biscuits

T7INhA0Pne7oThbAZruuWQ.text: Our family loves this restaurant! It's family friendly and the employees are so nice! The food is amazing it's home style cooking and it has large portions. We split our meals because they are so big! Definitely would recommend this restaurant!

ketO_yNoc50NE2EGAjOzLA.text: Portions are huge. I had enough for left overs. I loved how the food was well seasoned. I'd definitely will come back!

9O63l3RHvJZUHQn6e_Z6Xw.text: The food this trip was bland and the server was busy doing side work so we had to flag her down for water refills. Not planning to go back anytime soon as there are so many other choices1

FI2iYyfff59ApFnmvNU4TQ.text: We decided to try this restaurant since we'd never been here before. We ordered the hot spinach salad with a cheeseburger that we shared. The servings were huge and definitely enough for two people to share. Our waiter Glen was fantastic!!     He was attentive and made the experience fun!

cgRonnN975o9B13Vi7bMUw.text: Yummy yum  I really liked this pace. Great service the moment I stepped foot in the door. I like dining in restaurants that have their own twist on classics especially when they rock! Will definitely be back

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Henderson, NV, United States. Bloody Mary
Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Henderson, NV, United States. Sage Fried chicken &amp;Waffles
Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Henderson, NV, United States

eAHvmyhxxod3-Qm3u_BY8Q.text: Sunday morning family get togethers over breakfast are a tradition so we headed to Hash House on Stephanie. Not our 1st time here. As many know, this is a place where you had better come hungry as the portions are healthy. I had the bacon waffle and it stood True to its name. Bacon strips are intertwined with the batter to make an incredible waffle. It came with scrambled eggs. The food was on par and the server was friendly, polite, patient, and accomodating. The other destination was another of our sunday morning breakfast joints ( The Coffee Cup in Boulder City ) but in the end Hash House won the unanimous decision.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Henderson, NV, United States

VBLUUyN73Nb8W14zXs-tIw.text: For some reason the air was not on for almost 30 min we were here. When your server is dripping sweat, no one wants to see that. Food as a prior reviewer said is nothing special, and will tear your stomach apart. Got the giant pancake which was good, but only a handful of eggs with it, and 2 undercooked strips of bacon. No one wants barely cooked flimsy bacon. Server brought me out a properly cooked one not much longer though. I can see why it's no longer one of Vegas' top restaurants. Wont be coming back.

l-Rm0DcyI3H7nGBzzy-5HA.text: It's been a while since I had been to any Hash House but not much has changed with the exception of this visit having outstanding, efficient service. The food is still delicious and make sure your appetite didn't go on vacation before you come here. In fact, do a two mile (or more) charity walk like we did before you dine.  Our party of four arrived around 10:40 on a late Saturday morning to a restaurant at capacity and on a wait, we were seated before 10:45, and we were walking out the door at 11:25. We sat in a booth in the bar area and Yvette took great care of us. Although she was busy, she was quite pleasant, informative, and efficient. From our experience on this visit, we did not have any service issues that have been described about the restaurant in its opening months.  I had the gigantic pumpkin flapjack which was light, fluffy, and the pumpkin flavor was tasty but not overpowering. This was a good start to many other pumpkin flavors I'll be experiencing this fall. Also ordered were the barbecue chicken sandwich with fries, the Warsaw hash, and the basic. Everyone was hungry and finished within 15 minutes with every single plate being clean. We cashed out and left happy, full, and satisfied knowing that we didn't spend the majority of our morning hungry and waiting.  The restaurant still kind of reminded me of the Tony Roma's that was there previously, but there is plenty of seating and if the service is capable, should be able to handle large volume of customers. Although pretty classic comfort/farm food, the extra "twists" and large portions makes this place unique and will have us coming back for more.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Henderson, NV, United States. Warsaw hash- crispy potatoes, ground turkey, hardwood smoked bacon, smoked mozzarella cheese, two eggs, and a buttermilk biscuit.
Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Henderson, NV, United States. The Basic- two eggs, potatoes, fruit, and biscuit or toast
Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Henderson, NV, United States. Barbecue chicken sandwich

eKxlReUJ-v7ayFToJkCo5A.text: Hash House A Go Go overall was fantastic!  It opened at 7:00 for breakfast and we arrived shortly after and were seated immediately.  There were only a handful of customers already seated, but the server was slow.  When we finally saw her, she stopped to let us know she knew we were there, but then we did not see her again for (we timed) seven minutes for her even see if we wanted coffee, which ideally she would have asked the first time she stopped, so I subtracted a star (minus only half star if option) for the initially slow service.  When we finally received our coffee, it was fresh and flavorful.  My husband enjoyed a vanilla waffle which he said, was the best waffle ever and he consumed all of his breakfast, which included eggs and hashbrown.  I enjoyed an excellent potato, cheese, onion, bacon and avocado hash that included sides of fresh fruit and a biscuit with leftovers for 2 more breakfasts!  The price exceeded $30 for two breakfasts, but factoring in the leftovers (two more breakfasts) making it technically four breakfasts, it was great value and great food.

nyN2r6DCSE4K9d8dy6hyKA.text: I went here because I really felt like it was going to be a great experience.  After all, I have been to the one on Sahara and the one in the former IP.  The exterior of the restaurant is nice and there is ample parking... but unfortunately that is where my great experience ends.  Our waitress was ok.  It took her a while to come over to us, which was shocking because the place was a ghost town.  We sat for about 10 minutes waiting for someone to even acknowledge us after the hostess sat us.   There were a few wait staff walking around the place and we were promptly ignored by all of them.  there were people seated in our section and they were acknowledged, but not us?  Weird.  So lets get to the good.  I ordered a blueberry flapjack which was tasty and freshly prepared.  Unfortunately the corn beef hash that my fiance ordered for us to split came out on a cast iron skillet and it was COLD.  here is the deal:  either this was not freshly prepared or it was not heated to proper temperature before serving it to us.  we waited 10 minutes to be acknowledged and waited like 6 minutes for the food to come out.  It was shockingly fast actually.  But not in a good way.  We also asked for the biscuit on the side because my fiance cant have glutenous biscuits, but that was ignored as well.  I did not complain at the restaurant nor did we request to send it back to be heated because we all know what happens when you send food back.  They get one star for the facade and parking, and nothing else.  I am done with you Hash House for you are a has been... I guess its better to be a has been, than a never was.  get back to your roots and forget about crazy expansion, or you will lose your fan base that made you so popular to begin with.

TU8o3eaffjc6EiJLPXxtkg.text: The restaurant was not busy but we waited 20-30 minutes for a table.  The staff seemed to be running around at 100+ MPH.  I ordered the Kiwi Watermelon lemonade and it took 15 minutes for me to get it.  My order was incorrect so I sent it back and my mom's drink order did not arrive until the 3rd reminder.  The portions are huge so expect to have leftovers.  The food is good but the staff needs to work on their service.

j_hB8u_mJu-SpfFSAI-icQ.text: For a place just opening these guys were great.  I will say though that you might want to order only 1 meal.  The portions they give you is gigantic. I had one of the hamburgers and couldn't even find any room for even 1 french fry.  Our server was a delight and yes there were some problems with service but staff are trying to coordinate meals, serving and kitchen.  If you go during the first week you have to remember that the staff are learning the timing along with the cooks.  It takes more then a day or two for the pace to get set.  We waited a bit longer then expected because they ran out of french fries.  However, it was worth watching other dishes coming by, other patrons reactions when their order was delivered and the smiles on everyone's faces as they ate.  Try it another time if your experience this opening week did not meet your needs, it is a wonderful place.

Fj8708QNhMRzHfUnTccwNg.text: Wow! I haven't had an experience like this at any restaurant, EVER!  Ordered a pOrtobello mushroom sandwich that has goat cheese on it so I requested cheddar cheese instead. I was told by the server that the chef would not substitute the cheese but he would give the piece of cold cheddar cheese on the side if I wish. I was in shock. The aggressive manager came over and said that they don't have microwaves or any way to put the cheddar on the portobello and that was why they can't do it. I asked how they put the goat cheese that normally comes on it, on the sandwich? She said that they used the griddle. I said can you please use cheddar on the griddle rather goat cheese.  She said she couldn't do it!  We obviously left. I was floored about this experience. I then remembered going to the one across town when they first opened and tried to order the same thing, the same way and was denied on the basis that they can't because their menu is made the way it is.  Omg  Avoid this place like a plague I look for good  customer service not dictatorship run restaurants

UsE3VtVJk_tzp5ykcAeNxg.text: Came in on a whim,   Wow!!! Chicken pot pie!   Definitely for two.   Flavored are all pronounced and fresh !   Pub crawl may have been the best corned beef I've had since New York!  About $13 per plate and worth double that!  I'll be back!

czSPKbXhJUIl4yvPSfNTyA.text: First time here ever.  Heard many great things from food to service about this restaurant and we had to try it out for ourselves.  First off, the wait time was friggen ridiculous.  We had 3 of the 4 people in our party present but they would not seat us until the fourth person arrived.  Total wait time was 75 minutes.  They could have seated us and at least we could have had coffee.  I had a 68 year old with us and no courtesy at all was given to her.  What if that fourth person changed their mind.  we would have been waiting for absolutely nothing.   The food was cold and should have been sizzling for the dish I ordered which was brought on a skillet.  The waitress was great though. The hostess and manager were totally rude and unprofessional.  I was reading the menu while I was waiting and tapped the hostess on the back of her shoulder to get her attention.  She rudely turned around and snarled at me.  She then told her manager about being hit by myself.  The manger then comes over and say," next time, don't hit our worker."  Totally unprofessional.  If I socked her in her eye, that would be considered hitting.   The portions were very large which was good.  The taste and quality of the food was not too good.  Egg works on Eastern is far better for cheaper pricing without the 75 minute wait and piss poor attitude hostesses who had attitude problems. No one were smiling and the mood was just herding you through, clean the table, and sit another un happy customer down. We will never come back here again and we will pass this information onto all our friends to NOT waste their time and money here.

-i4dCwMFoxq6KVT3RSiIcw.text: It's different.  High rating for portions.   Club salad great.  Alcoholic drink horrible and the waitress was arguing with me how I wanted it changed.  I had one sip and it did not taste like a mojito.  She talked to  as if never had one...boy did she assume wrong!  Dinnerware could be cleaner.  If you want to try different, go for it.  But don't think I would call it amazing/addicting place to go.

mQk9W0kN49s9_Dyrrz9mRg.text: So I was excited about finally getting to try this place since I had heard many things from people over the years but didn't have one close by.  We went relatively late at night with me, my wife, and kid.  First impression was the place looked nice.  The building used to be a Tony Romas and looks basically the same as Tony Romas used to look inside.  The service was very slow, it took a while to get orders and a very long time to get food.  The hamburger I ordered was very good, but I was severely disappointed in how small it was.  Way overpriced for the size of the burger.  The fries I had on the side were very good; however the place does not have RANCH.  So for my kid this was a killer issue since he pretty much has to have ranch for his chicken fingers, but in general who the heck doesn't have regular ranch?  Ok, they have some form of RANCH, I think it was like a cucumber ranch or something like that, I tried it and it was NOT good.  I don't want to be caught up on one simple thing, but really I just cannot believe a place like this does not serve regular ranch, that just blows my mind.  The wife said her food was pretty good, and her portions looked bigger than what I got, but still service was slow and too expensive for what we got.  I sort of want to come back and try something else, but not sure that I will considering this experience just wasn't good enough.

NffXLEqyGb_aoXRL59_3xg.text: Amazing food. Fantastic prices and excellent service. Oh and the place is welcoming and clean. Absolutely worth the drive from NLV

_dQ9ox7demfCAM_hBcoypg.text: Terrible service! Employees Not knowledgeable - poor training - not the same Menu as the other locations! on the positive, HUGE Portions & food was good

EWETn2ANkb85Dr3i1XQYCA.text: This was such a HUGE disappointment. When we tried the Hash House in the M Hotel, the food was great. When we heard it closed we were bummed but then really looked forward to this location opening. The food was below sub-par, very low quality ingredients, bland, and just was overall poorly executed. The worst part was having myself and 2 others all order different meals and we all came home and had to run to the bathroom with extreme bowel issues and nausea all evening from this place. STAY FAR AWAY. NEVER AGAIN!!

JNmwbHCmIT6Chw9mkRSRtg.text: Horrible service. The restaurant was very empty yet it took almost 30 minutes to get our food. Our kids got their meals over 10 minutes before we did. I ordered an egg skillet - the cheese and other ingredients were not mixed thoroughly nor was it cooked completely. One bite would be all cheese, the next raw onion. It had avocado which was also raw. The crispy potatoes were crispy - but also dry and they had no seasoning. The biscuit was okay until I got to the middle where the sprig of rosemary had been stuck inside, and then all I could taste was rosemary. My husband ordered his eggs over medium and they were barely over easy. I was thinking of complaining but couldn't find the waitress and was tired of waiting anyway. Also, there was a table with two women and a baby that left shortly after we arrived. The baby had made a huge mess on the floor, which was still there when we were leaving. Nobody bothered to come clean anything. We won't be back.

O3vNon3nBjTqLGKxpn9lwQ.text: The pot pie is where it's at! Also really liked the pancakes. The portions are huge and the prices are small in comparison to how much food you get. Our server was funny (guy with a long beard). It's really unhealthy food and a little too slow for our taste, but overall a good experience.

jf0C0cTCiDgOGZynOX_zzQ.text: Never got to eat any food...piece of plastic floating in my husbands coffee and then when a new cup was brought went to stir and the spoon was full of baked on cheese! Was too turned off to eat so we left.

Vy7EjCoeULbMKUS0Sdr0KA.text: I've been to the Location on the strip at the former Imperial Palace now called the Linq, and was excited that new location opened up around my area. The food was amazing as per usual, BUT The service was terrible! It looked like they only had one server covering six tables which is tough and I get it but you gotta keep your cool. The waitress comes up to us and asks us if we are ready to order and we we told her no since we were waiting for our third person to show up and she yells THANK GOD, and walks away to oversee her other tables. I'm like I get you're all by yourself and busy but lady keep your feelings to yourself and check it at the door. The entire experience was annoying she later on rushed us to get our orders and our third person showed up and was rushing her to get her order. To the point she drops off our food and not even 10 minutes later she drops off the check! We open to check out our total and put the check book down to continue eating, it felt like a minute later she comes to our table and opens our checkbook to see if we put our form of payment like I'm like excuse me ? And she just walks away. In the end I love the food which is why I'm giving this place 3 stars, but management really needs to evaluate how their servers act and retrain them on how to offer customer service.

lxaNfaUhsvCbLHBlXqdnlQ.text: Pulled up to a line outside but only waited about 10min before being seated. There were plenty of open tables and looked like it was well staffed so not sure why there was a line outside. Anyway I had the salmon benedict and it was good lots of different flavors with each bite. Portion sizes are big. Service was fast and efficient. I would come back to try another dish.

-OjrhPw79H546tO98hd3zA.text: .Large portions of well presented tasteless food. Chicken & Waffles looked incredible. Chicken was dry and the waffles were way under done. Corned beef sandwich was shredded beef they must use in corned beef hash. One side of the bread was toasted on grill the other side was not grilled & soggy. Scrambled Eggs and pancake were comical. The pancake was about 10 inches across and pretty much undercooked with scrambled eggs on side. Once again impressive looking but not good. What can I say? I've seen numerous write ups in the local magazines raving about the food. Maybe this is a franchise now and this franchisee is lost. Certainly can't recommend & certainly won't be back.Will be gone in 6 months if they don't wise up fast

Za8Cl6b1n62YmMpASwbLhA.text: After reading these reviews I was skeptical about going here.  We decided to and I have to say I was very pleased with my choice of the pot pie.  It was extremely busy and we had a group of 9 family members and had to wait about 1/2 hour for the large round table to accommodate us.  But since we couldn't make a reservation on the weekend we understood and made do.  Our service was good, the waitress recommended her favorites and some took her advice and were happy with the food.  Prices were good for the amount of food you got.  We are going to be going again for a ladies Birthday Lunch next weekend, and although we may have to wait a bit for the larger table we understand that is what happens with larger crowds.

QOG8fJGNVKmz0ceGqn6Taw.text: I went to the this location twice.  The first time was for breakfast.  The service wasnt really that good. Food wise...the portion size was huge.  I had the pancakes, with sausage, and eggs over medium.  The pancakes were ok, my sausage was a little pink inside, and my eggs were over easy (Yolk wasnt cooked much).  My boyfriend had the waffle and bacon extra crispy.  The waffle was good but the bacon was burnt.  My son had the mac n cheese.  That was actually really good.  I didnt really knock them this time because I know how it is when a business first opens.  The next time my boyfriend and I came was during dinner.  The store was slow, so we expected to get seated right away.  When we walked in, nobody greeted us., we were just waiting. When we were finally seated, it took forever to get out drinks, and even to order our food.  I ended up ordering the burger with fries.  The fries were good, but by burger was bland, i had to add salt and pepper to my burger and I used a lot of ketchup for more taste.  My boyfriend order the chicken an waffles.  When he got it we had to send it back because he was allergic to the garnishes they put all over the chicken.  When he sent it back he ask for just the chicken and waffles no garnish.  They redid his food and when we got it there was rosemary and leeks all over the plate and his food.  I was annoyed now.  He spent the rest of the time picking off the leeks.  Service this time was worse.  Our server was never really around.  We sat right next to the host stand, so we asked the host for everything.  We were very disappointed with our meal.  It was such a big waste of money.  We left a tip under 15 percent, and we always give at least between 15 to 20% tip.  This was just bad.  When we left we both agreed to never come back and we regret not giving the host a tip (he did more for us than our server did)

8AdOa8UbASka2SxK8JgX9A.text: Amazing Mother's Day lunch & outstanding service from Tracy! Also thanks Tyler (GM) for checking to make sure we were enjoying ourselves! And upon checkout, Tracy, upon finding out Greg is retired Navu, she informed us of 25% Military discount & 50% if in uniform!! Thank you for giving back to those who serve our country! We WILL BE BACK!

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Henderson, NV, United States. Amazing Mother&#39;s Day lunch!!

Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Henderson, NV, United States. Thank you Tracy &amp; Tyler! Crab cake benedict was AMAZING! Our 1st visit NOT our last! AND they give vets 25% discount? And 50% in uniform!

Ljuxr1nDwSpwS902cw5lvA.text: We've enjoyed this location each time we are in the area. We get there early for breakfast. We split our favorite dish which is Andy's Sage Fried Chicken. It is crazy good. Their waffles with bacon inside is amazing also. We haven't tried much else because we have our favorites. Definitely give them a try!

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Henderson, NV, United States. Glad we split this! Maybe a third person could&#39;ve helped!

jIBvWOdLyeWX226s_CzHXg.text: They didn't have peanut butter, feta cheese or avocado. Our server was in the moon. At the end my eggs were ok but they tried to charge me for my potatoes as a side. Pancakes are delish but my daughter was sad they didn't have peanut butter! The girl side I've been looking for the peanut butter and I can't find it lol Maybe I will give it another try...

kU_LEPW06HXQrBPfq6iJJg.text: Went there after recommendations from friends. Going to have to take what they say with a grain of salt from now on.  Ordered the BBBLT, which the server described as "stacked high with bacon". Got the sandwich......it was actually stacked high with lettuce. It was your average run-of-the-mill BLT.  Looked like maybe 4 strips of bacon, tomato, and about 3 inches of lettuce.  Pulled the extra lettuce off. It really wasn't a bad sandwich, but at best, it was False advertising.

N6yrjAareeIXzwobBmoMjw.text: Amazing tastes but definitely not a normal  menu selection. Food actually comes out looking fancy like the pictures. The mashed potatoes...died & went to heaven & then got so fat eating them I fell back to earth.  I'm planning on going here for Thanksgiving this year because the menu looked super duper drooling over it fantastic.

oxBikUgKhVTkDnpa8wQsdw.text: Finally decided to try this place out. The menu is fun and creative  I tried the snickers pancakes. I was very impressed by the size of it. The waitress amy said it was the size of a hubcap. She was right lol. I enjoyed it and would recommend it. My fiance had the spicy grilled chicken sandwich. The chicken was good quality and was pretty good. The only things I didn't care for was the price and the service. It's a little on the higher prices and the service was extremely slow. Amy was our server and her personality was pleasant but with a rush attitude. She would quickly come by with a smile and ask if we needed anything and quickly would turn around and try to leave hoping we didn't have a request.  It seemed to almost be around once every 20 mins she might stop by. I asked for my check and she brought it then dissappear for 15 mins while I'm waiting to pay. If the service was fast I would be back.

UPQT4zl9m7cCJAYGwL56qA.text: Didn't live up to the hype. Extremely overpriced and not the best tasting food. The portions are fairly large , however that doesn't make up for the average food or the inflated prices. My wife ordered breakfast, the toast came out burnt and the potatoes were totally bland. My burger was pretty good, but not for the price. For these reasons we will not return.

AZc1L3YtT3oEa4-BgLyQOA.text: Most excellent food and service! Ordered the veggie hash- so many yummy flavors! I agree you could split this with someone else- was way too big to eat alone. Sat at the bar with Tracey and Josh who are both excellent. Thank you!

D94rSQcFjn2QuGde63BN-A.text: Don't go to brunch here if you expect to wait 45min on food... the place didnt look that busy considering it was around 2pm...I had the salmon egg plate and my partner had the sage fried chicken..there were so many things on the plate that was for decor only.   They mixed the salmon with the egg which was very unique, the flavors were amazing and the chicken was cooked really perfect. Service is great but I think good prep needs some work to have the food come out faster.

nXl4g0He-wxRG5rP2im7nw.text: Couldn't wait to try this place out since I am a local. Its a nicely decorated place and hostess was friendly. Had the maple bacon for an app along with green fried totmatoes which were both delish !. I ordered the chicken benny for dinner and it was amazing the portions are huge the taste is out of this world.The service could have been better server acted annoyed like we were bothering her when asking any type of question. Regardless of service I will be back for sure. Food is very good !

PtqAJcqHNas2LWSsu-DMsQ.text: Stopped thru for dinner and wasn't disappointed. Been here several times and this time got the hammered cutlet. Whoa, this is big but tasty n thin enough to double up n enjoy without chewing around the plate, lol. It's huge Fa real yall.. But don't let this intimidate you. My service and food has been too notch at my visits, so not sure bout previous reviews, but every time I've been there the am & evening crew has been on top of things IMO, just saying. Perception is reality until it's changed. Try the shroom burger, next time around, if you don't like it, I'll pay for it! Just be sure to order a new one and deliver it to me, lol.. Give this place a chance, it's not everyone's cup of tea, I'm alright with it tho.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Henderson, NV, United States. Hammered cutlet, off the plate, all I&#39;m saying.. Not dried out, flavorful, n hot when arriving at my table..

LdkQWLfsJ7R3Bu-s7RYjdQ.text: To categorize this establishment as "good," accomplishes two things.  1.  It demonstrates that I am LYING, and 2. It INSULTS the hard-working employees.  I prefer to use the words "TERRIFIC" and "FANATASTIC" to describe both the food and the service.  I have been dining out since my infancy, and I can testify (under oath, if necessary) that I have NEVER, in 66+ years of living, ever tasted BETTER mashed potatoes, anywhere.  The word "awesome" is inadequate to describe the taste; you have to experience it on your own, and I really hope that you will.  My first-ever visit was on Friday, March 18, 2016, and I'm very sorry I didn't try them much sooner in my life.  I sampled the meal called, "THE BASIC," with 2 over-easy eggs, wheat toast, bacon & the out-of-this-world mashed 'taters.   Everything was super-fine, and the price was certainly reasonable.  But what is gonna bring me back (frequently, I hope) is DEVON, the server.  Good food and low prices mean nothing if the service isn't noteworthy, and if DEVON is "typical" of the folks working there, you are in for a most memorable and enjoyable visit.

Qqpv-tDHJ7YGn1v-WuCBEA.text: Sorry to say but the only thing this place has going for it is there are many other options to chose from instead of here. I ordered the sausage gravy with biscuits and they came with eggs and mashed potatoes. The eggs were burned, the gravy wasnt half bad but not half good either, and the mashed were horrible. Our waitress took forever coming around to us - so long that we finally got up to pay at the counter.  This place is a hash house a NO GO.

ePAM9s2iQkrzuchXj8S6og.text: Went here for the 1st time the other day due to a LOT of hype. The food is great quality and you definitely get your money's worth. We ordered the sage chicken benny and were not disappointed. The only reason I am giving a 4 instead of a 5 star review is because service was slightly lacking. They weren't tremendously busy but our drinks tended to stay on the empty side for most of our stay.  It definitely could have been a fluke thing for sure. I am only going off of 1 visit.   If you are a light eater, then these plates are for sure shareable! Both my boyfriend and I are big eaters and the meal we ordered (and shared) filled us both up! I recommend giving them a try!

SqmUpJSctCrIjbio80qGXQ.text: This place has really gone downhill, food is bland and fried potatoes are unseasoned and taste like rancid oil.  If you want a huge plate of yuck food go for it, but if you want good quality tasting food go elsewhere!

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Henderson, NV, United States

UcisMeSH6VJR1grvgIwhZg.text: The food was great!! Yummy Bloody Mary with jalapeno olives.  I had the Marie's crab Benedict it was awesome.  Our server Jessica was excellent. Huge portions consider sharing

lrNCpSGCRgj1bqSuyY54Lw.text: Our first time here. We opted to sit at bar to avoid waiting for a table. Bartender on gave us one refill even though we were right next to him all afternoon. I got the biscuits and gravy, my wife got the pancake. My meal was hot, gravy was tasty. Biscuits were a little hard. They needed the gravy. Potatoes were ok. The "fresh fruit" ended up swimming in gravy as well. .  The pancake was of course as big as the plate. It was so cold the butter would not melt. Large portions are one thing when you get a pancake that is over 15" across I think a stack of smaller ones would have been warmer.  We have no desire to return. We tried it once.

-5AG2I8o8H7j8EyQ6DbsOA.text: Took a friend for lunch yesterday since she had never been to Hash House A Go Go and it was absolutely amazing!  Ordered the Fried Green Tomato Stack and I think I went to heaven with every bite!  My friend ordered the grilled cheese with bacon and tomato and she thoroughly enjoyed half of it since she ate half of my lunch.  Service was great, food was amazing and so thankful we decided to go there!   I'm seriously craving it today!!!!!!!!!! Thank you!!

q3h4un3Ni-eY7xzbESGOvA.text: Hash House a go go is one of my favorite places to visit when I visit Las Vegas. We visit the restaurant in Henderson because it's around the corner from my wife's cousins home. The food is appealing and delicious and the portions or out of this world. The general manager makes our visit so wonderful Tyler is such a great guy. Can't wait for my next visit. See you in late August

YoeAUWOEqypAmswLCBtQSw.text: Dont like to usually write bad reviews but this place staff totally didnt know what they were doing. Came in with my family on sunday expecting a good service brunch but got complete opposite. Food is always amazing there. I get the snickers pancake breakfast and its totally something to die for !!! Definitely don't recommend this location at all tho!

5TVfglgT552LGb0NWMiaYA.text: I've been to this location twice and both times have been disappointing. First time my wife got the chicken fried steak and ended up sending it back because there wasn't any taste and I mean it literally tastes like nothing. I had the go to dish, chicken and waffles which again was lacking flavor, The chicken was juicy and cooked well, but there just wasn't any taste.   The second time we went I got a burger because of the bad experience with the chicken and waffles. The burger was hard and over cooked.   I love Hash House and was very excited to see this location open so close to my house. Previously we always went to the one in the M Resort but it was closed so to have one open in Henderson was awesome. I just hope they can get it together because this location isn't on par with the other locations in Vegas.

0t7Ior8zOJbpEobAQuJJyA.text: I kept hearing this place was amazing and gave big portions of food. So I finally tried it with some classmates this morning. Honestly, it's not all its cracked up to be. The portion size is great, but taste wise; I've definitely had better. It was just okay. The orange juice was very good and fresh squeezed.  Honestly,  I enjoyed The Cracked Egg way better.

DlqRjUH22y7ELRf-PKeqqw.text: When you go here for food, bring your appetite and your camera! The portions here are the size of your head - or bigger.  Split one plate! The food was so great and our server Amber was amazing she was so detailed and on point about everything. Great service, reasonably priced, and great food. Large portions We'd come back and try again, a different plate for sure though.

KmBVHt58RQqgJPMmTv8ekQ.text: 1/2 hour wait no food. Waiter comes by with biscuits sorry a big group came in after you. Shouldn't our order be fired first?  My pot pie looked like a space ship attacked by chicken stew. Forgive me for expecting a nice fluffy pastry. Even KFC & Marie C get the crust right. Instead I get a stiff, molded inedible space ship. Guess it has to be tough & stiff to stand up in the bowl.  Hamburgers just so so.  Daughter devours bacon burger at RR here barely ate 1/4. Gave her salad when she ordered fries. Husband only ate 1/2 his burger. Not because it was too big.... Just didn't knock his socks off.  Didn't offer dessert. Guess they were trying to get rid of us. Renaming it HashHouseANoGo had to give 1 Star there is no -10

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Henderson, NV, United States
Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Henderson, NV, United States. Flying Saucer pot pie. Worst crust ever stiff molded inedible (I guess for presentation)

CaO4_LH6gj16gAkP0YL-UQ.text: I'm sad to say that I shared the same experience as most of these reviewers.  Having previously been to one of the other Hash House a Go Go's, we were ecstatic when we saw this was opening up near us.  My wife was seriously bouncing around the car.  She ranted and raved about the Kiwi Watermelon Lemonade.  Finally, opening week came!  We were ready to go that Friday, though worried about getting a table considering how busy the other locations are.  We set out to grab dinner and found that the parking lot was mostly empty.  We actually both wondered aloud whether the place was even open.  We walked in and found a handful of booths occupied and lots of empty tables and booths.  With no one waiting ahead of us, we were told it was going to be a 10 minute wait.  It felt like a joke at that point, considering the place was mostly empty.  But sure enough, we twiddled our thumbs while the very unpleasant hostesses talked amongst themselves and we waited for the poor bus boy to clean off the table that we were being assigned to, despite the fact that 85% of the tables were already clean and unused.  I had looked up the menu ahead of time and was super excited.  The appetizers looked enticing and there were at least a couple of entrees calling to me.  Of course, when we got there, they only had one menu available.  No full complement of dinner entrees, no appetizers at all.  And the prices?   Well, good lord.  The lemonade that my wife had been raving about was priced as if it had alcohol in it - prohibitively expensive.  The entree prices aren't too bad once you realize that their serving size is massive.  My wife and I decided on the Sage Fried Chicken and Waffles as our last resort, though it was not either of our first choice.  The food came out at exactly the 5 minute mark.  It was acceptable, as far as dinner goes.  Not outstanding, but not disgusting.  We didn't so much get the "Sage" part of the Sage Fried chicken and fried chicken is always going to be greasy.  But the waffles were great and the waitress (once we were finally able to flag her down) provided us with an extra two cups of the maple reduction (come on now, it's really just a fancy name for syrup).  The service really is bad.  I have never seen a more dour and frumpy lot of hostesses and servers.  The hostesses at the front didn't even crack a smile.  There was no greeting, nor a "thanks, have a good night!" when we left.  Our waitress disappeared for extended periods, despite the place still not being busy at all.  We caught a fleeting glimpse of a waiter who seemed to be congenial but he too vanished after checking on us once.  I'm optimistic that this place turns a corner once it's been open longer.  Management obviously knew what they were doing with the other locations, so there's still hope of a recovery.  A full menu, servers who don't provide you service begrudgingly and more reasonable drink prices would work wonders.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Henderson, NV, United States. Limited Menu (Side 2)
Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Henderson, NV, United States. Limited Menu (Side 1)

ekjlvB8K5ZLtxzyegDU9KQ.text: We had lunch here at the soft opening. I was really excited because I have heard so much about it and now I had a chance to experience what everyone was talking about. The location is near my neighborhood.    The decor is relaxed, the hostess was very friendly, we were seated right away! Our server was really nice and helped us with our food selection, and made sure we were happy.  The Smores Mocha  was heaven, the Mango tea was perfect. The Snickers Flapjacks were to die for! Big O'crispy hand hammered pork tenderloin with sweet potato fries was very       good! enough for 3 people! The Hardwood smoked bacon, avocado & cheddar Burger was dynamite!  loved the Biscuit  with home made jam! I heard that  they don't use heat lamps in the kitchen! so they bring out the food when is ready to be served.  We really enjoyed our lunch here.  We will definitely be back and I will update if necessary!

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Henderson, NV, United States. Smores Mocha! Yummy!

ZN0NGBrSuEr2M8sVULZKSQ.text: Shout out to management and staff for the wonderful soft opening this weekend!  That's right folks, Hash House is officially opening up on Stephanie February 23rd! Traveling from all the way down from the strip to right here in Henderson. This location is located in the same plaza at Macaroni Grill, Ulta, Sprouts, Old Navy and Nordstrom Rack. (You get the picture)  The location is very nice and clean, which is to be expected, but is decorated and themed very nicely to go along with HH's vibe. I mean, there's a tractor for god sake!  Service was very efficient and friendly and our waiter was very attentive. The food was prepped and delivered in a timely manner and there are no heat lamps or waiting so things come out as soon as they are finished.   As a table we ordered different entrees including the famous Sage Fried Chicken and Waffles, Crispy Pork Tenderloin, a stuffed burger and one of the breakfast scrambles. Our first fried chicken entree was raw in the middle but we were brought another order very promptly and was corrected. The waffles were very crispy and the bacon inside the waffle was delightful!   Overall the food was good and found the quality to be better than the times I've tried it on the Strip. (Hopefully this quality stays consistent looking forward) We also tried the Kiwi Watermelon Lemonade which was delicious and the presentation was super cute!  Our table also ordered the Snickers Bread Pudding, which was very very rich. I'm glad we only got one to share. :P  Cheers to another good addition to Henderson in the foodie circuit!

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Henderson, NV, United States
Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Henderson, NV, United States. Snickers Bread Pudding
Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Henderson, NV, United States. Sage Fried Chicken and Waffles

w-PzQxxGaNRk89tzj5nx9g.text: Decided to try this place out since it was close to my moms house, a friend recommended and my brother had mentioned he ate at the San Diego location and really enjoyed it. I also read the Yelp reviews in regards to the food and it seem like a place to try. Needless to say, I was not really impressed. It was great that we didn't have to wait to be seated. The waitress that helped us was nice however she o lay checked on us maybe 2x and the food took a little long to arrive. The portions are what they say and is considered "farm size" portions, prices were a little on the higher side but I guess that's the norm.  My brother ordered the chicken and waffles which was pretty tasty. He enjoyed his good and had extra leftover to take home and I was also able to take a few bites .  I ordered the Salmon Benedict (their version of a Benedict) I was VERY DISAPPOINTED. I was so tempted to return my order and get something else but I felt a little bad and I didn't want cause a scene ESP since It was my fault I chose to order that. The portion was huge but only because they piled on the mash potatoes and the biscuits were about 2 inches thick and it was very dry even with the sauce over it. I was so excited because I have read that it was a delicious dish , full of flavor and loaded with salmon. I was so wrong .  Salmon Benedict : * VERY DRY * Lacked flavor  * All I tasted was mashed potatoes  * Hardly any to no pieces of Salmon  *biscuit was very think and dry *sauce tastes like cheese   I get it they just opened and need to perfect their recipe but I was sad I spent $40 on lunch for 2 people and only had water to drink and I didn't enjoy my food .   I may comeback to try something else but not anytime soon and maybe not this location.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Henderson, NV, United States. Salmon Benedict Don&#39;t let the sauce fool you, it was very very dry under all that sauce and not very tasty lacked the salmon too
Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Henderson, NV, United States. Chicken &amp; Waffles

LgejfwAqhtLNPanH8xDVLw.text: Stopped by for a breakfast date with the wifey and am so glad we did.  We were instantly greeted and sat.  We were then immediately greeted by our server Myron.  He did a fantastic job and I can't say enough about how amazing the food is.  To top it off the GM Tyler came by to ask how everything was and thank ya for coming by.  Classy touch and thank you and your team for an amazing breakfast date.

QBTSSZfbrYb1L9A2EOlqTw.text: Soft openings are fun as they give the staff a chance to work through service and food preparation kinks.  On the advice of someone who knows the menu, they suggested I try the smoked salmon benedict. It included a more than generous helping of mashed potatoes, several hot biscuits, smoked salmon that were covered in a fried egg with a spicy benedict sauce.  I tried the Kiwi Watermelon drink with a side of spike and ginormous slice of watermelon. It's served with vodka, but I'm not sure which brand. I should have asked my waiter.  The dessert I tried was the tasty chocolate waffles, scoops of vanilla bean ice cream and chocolate sauce were drizzled on top. This was also a dish recommended by someone who knows the menu.  The waffles were just right, not too crispy and not too soft. There was enough for three people and then some. Desserts at Hash House A Go Go are best shared.  The menu has been simplified at this location so some of the dinner items and or appetizers may not be available. They still have a large amount of food though and their portions are huge.  I'm excited to try this location again during normal business hours. I heard that they will be having a happy hour from 4-7pm daily.

x_0T1VyXNSiCehWFwkQRrQ.text: I've been here twice now and I have been satisfied both times and will be coming back in the future. You may read some low star reviews about how the food isn't tasty or overpriced,but $10 for a near square foot red velvet  waffle, worth it. $7 for a caramel mocha equivalent to  about 4 or 5 cups of coffee goodness, worth it. Bring a friend,  the portions are HUGE!

zfWu34ioZKkiZY1NlvPbKw.text: Now I remember why I wasn't anxious to go back after we tried HHAGG 4+ years ago.  It seems they focus way too much on ridiculously HUGE portions instead of good tasting food. It's really a shame bc I can't even imagine all the food they waste.  Hubby & I went for breakfast this morning. Wasn't my choice but since they opened this location so close to us, hubby has really been wanting to go again.  He got the fried chicken Benedict & I ordered the Smoked Salmon hash. Out came hubby's dish looking like a platter of food that could easily feed a family of 5 in a 3rd world country for at least a week. Mine was pretty close to the same size which made me feel even worse sending it back bc I knew it would just be thrown away. I just couldn't though.. The salmon was sooo dry, the "crispy potatoes" were a pile of soft cubed potatoes under all the dry salmon & my eggs were cold. I just couldn't take more than a couple bites & I did something I've only done maybe 1 or 2 other times in my life. I sent it back & opted for the basic breakfast instead. Made the mistake of choosing the griddled mashed potatoes instead of the "crispy potatoes" again & it was just bad. The whole thing was bad. Cold eggs again, limp bacon & a somewhat smashed pile of mashed potatoes that I'm sure never touched a griddle.  Anyway, done with that place. My hubby really enjoyed his meal so he may go back sometime & take our kids but I'll be washing my hair or something.

bIzBYjZpkgGyY-9y8qiCfg.text: This is a fun down home place where you can get huge portions with a lots of flavor flare. Make sure to bring your appetite, because you won't go home disappointed. Part of the fun of this place is sharing among your friends and family to taste more of these unique takes on some down home comfort food.

Oecomt6QRm4MchFdzGBupA.text: I do enjoy checking out an opening day Happy Hour! Fans of the defunct Hash House at the M Resort will be pleased that it's returned at Stephanie/Warm Springs!  Another addition in the growing list of Strip area franchises coming to sleepy 'ole Henderson! I was eager to check out the vibe at this location, having been to a few of the other HH locations in the Valley. Happy Hour (Hashy Hour?) consists of $3 drinks and $5 food items. No speciality cocktails are on the happy hour menu. Disappointment! But, it's every day from 4-7. Yay! I had the mac 'n cheese with bacon happy hour bowl. A solid, satisfying dish with lots of cheesy goodness, and green onions. Also a lot of grease at the bottom, but this is the Hash House.  Only a few souls were at the bar, which I thought was strange for opening day. It got busier around the time I left. The bar is nice, it's situated in a square with tables surrounding it. Happy hour is a good chance to try some different food items before committing to a giant entree portion.  Miller's Henderson Ale House, be warned....let the competition begin.

yfxMQbZwnp2CE8LW70991A.text: While the popular chicken & waffles dish is a favorite for the family I had never tried it. Well I know why it's a favorite now. Huge plate. I shared it and still had a bit leftover. Chicken was crispy & tender. The waffles has bacon inside. Really tasty!   The bacon was crisp too. Limp bacon will turn me off immediately. They keep an eye for that sweet spot when the bacon is just perfect.  Great Bloody Mary! The lemon chicken I heard was good. He wasn't giving out tastes, guess it was that good!  The service was great and it was busy. Staff was kind, respectful and patient with our messes and indecisiveness!  So much to choose from!!

e0-Tf9vD_gwpC-o4hKqmyQ.text: Crispy Potatoes - Green Onions Buttermilk Biscuit - Butter, Housemade Strawberry Jam Pumpkin Cinnamon Roll Flapjack - Cinnamon, Sugar, Cream Cheese Frosting, "Maple Syrup" Big O' Turkey Pot Pie - Cracker Crust Hat filled with roasted Turkey, shaved Sweet Corn, Mushrooms, Broccoli, Carrots, Red Potatoes, Pan Gravy with hand-mashed Potatoes Homemade Pumpkin Bread Pudding - Vanilla Bean Ice Cream, Whipped Cream, Housemade Caramel and Chocolate Sauce  Having taken everyone from family to wealthy out-of-town guests to Hash House A Go-Go for their oversized plates of "Twisted Farm Food" it was early morning on Thanksgiving Day that three guests entered the Henderson location, the fifth such Restaurant and second located outside of a Casino every bit as good as the rest but without the wait that often frustrates those stuck in line at The Linq for over an hour.  Founded in 2000 and since expanding from San Diego to several cities from Coast-to-Coast, Sin City actually boasting the most by a wide margin, Hash House A Go-Go suggests that its cuisine is similar to that which one might find in the Midwest by way of states like Indiana and having spent more than thirty years as a Buckeye those claims certainly seem to be valid as everything from Sage Fried Chicken to pounded Pork and Meatloaf Sandwiches are rib-sticking hearty and served in portions large enough for two.  Spacious in design with a central bar area serving Beer and Cocktails while the Detroit Lions kicked-off another Turkey Day loss, the decor best described as Barnyard-chic with an antique tractor out front and everything from Stalks of Wheat to tattooed farmers lining the walls, it was shortly after checking in with the hostess that guests were led to a sizable four-top on the left half of the restaurant, a server soon dropping off menus with a big smile before filling water and describing the daily specials.  Not a place known for subtlety, the festive mood stoked by holiday music overhead with patrons all talking loudly as large parties continued to file in as the morning went on, it was perhaps twenty minutes after placing an order that plates arrived to completely crowd the table, share plates and bowls both delivered beforehand and everyone ready to dig in after a Pumpkin Pancake was topped with 100% Maple Syrup brought from home, the hubcap-diameter disc nearly an inch thick but cooked through with bold Cinnamon notes and quite a bit of pureed Pumpkin folded into the Batter.  Tacking on sides of Crispy Potatoes and a Buttermilk Biscuit served with Housemade Strawberry Jam, the former decent but a bit overpriced at $4.95 in the setting of a menu also offering several pounds of Fried Chicken and Waffles for just fifteen dollars, it also seems as though the Biscuit recipe has become slightly more dry since visiting The Plaza in 2015, though perhaps this has something to do with Yardbird's arrival on the scene with a vastly superior product that is actually priced slightly lower at $7 for four while Hash House a Go Go charges $1.99 each.  Continuing the Thanksgiving feast with two additional holiday specials, HHaGG's signature Snickers Bread Pudding replaced with an equally decadent version made with Pumpkin Bread but similarly decorated with Ice Cream, Whipped Cream and two types of Sauce, it was not without Turkey that the meal would take place, the decision to eschew both a half-pound Turkey Burger and plate featuring sliced Breast plus all the fixins' leaving plenty of room to work on an inverted top-hat made of Cracker-thin Biscuit Dough filled with roasted White and Dark Meat plus shaved Sweet Corn, Mushrooms, Broccoli, Carrots, Red Potatoes and Pan Gravy anchored to the bowl by a generous helping of hand-mashed Potatoes.  ***:  Certainly not a gourmet restaurant, and arguably the sort of place Americans should be rallying against in the setting of an obesity epidemic, Hash House a Go-Go nonetheless provides a good meal at a fair price with service that is better than most while taking several steps that they could get away with not doing in terms of making many of their sauces, jams and gravies from scratch.
