zgd6dL3MLYozRJ0VU2GOpw.text: Delicious dinner. I tried the fried green tomatoes as a starter and enjoyed them. The salmon and mashed potatoes were excellent. The Bloody Mary blt was really good. Highly recommended

CwFWtm6iAkjeEEFIKNLP2A.text: Yesterday was our first visit and we enjoyed our lunch. It was about 1:15 pm and very quiet, that is, after the rush.   No one was at the receiving desk but after a minute or so we were seated and the waiter was ready for our drink order. He was helpful in decifering the extensive menu. I ordered the massive chicken pot pie and my wife got the fried pork loin sandwich, another huge portion.   The food arrived and was so pretty on our plates, as was the food of the other patrons around us. Presentation was awesome.   Everything was good, but not as good as it looked. By that I mean my pie was a little bland. The crust, while stunning in appearance, was not flaky and buttery, instead it was heavy and dry. The filing was full of healthy veggies and chicken but not enough gravy or sauce for my liking.   My wife said that her sandwich was a little dry and was only OK.  The waiter started out great, and then literally did not return until I requested the check.   So we see potential here but it was not realized yesterday. We both want to return to give them another try and will do so soon.

o68sZ3FTEw6o7rdsjr4a4w.text: I've been coming here for 15 years. It gets better and better. Same location on Sahara. The menu has gotten better. I used to just like the portions and mango coconut pancakes. I moved out of Las Vegas but come to Hash house whenever I'm back. Pleased to see that they opened so many more locations.   I've had pretty much all the breakfast offerings and it's taken me a decade to work I to the lunch menu. I would say pass on the Caesar salad, it was too heavy on the dressing. But absolutely everything else delivers!

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Henderson, NV, United States. Chicken and waffles with the bacon cooked into the waffle. What? Amaze

IVtnrZ5Iq7eEQID6RNftTQ.text: My go-to meal is the breakfast farmhouse scramble with swiss cheese, eggs, avocado, bacon and onions with a side of garlic mash and homemade biscuit with homemade peach jam. Also the banana latte is bomb! Most recently I ordered the chicken pot pie and while delicious, was not seasoned enough (very bland) and was like a chicken cream soup with enough food for 3 days' leftovers! I was sick to my stomach after eating this and thinking it was a fluke, ate leftovers of this a day later and got sick again! Avoid this dish but the others I have tried are fab! They have a huge menu and I want to try many more things here.

nJ_oRwnGInp5OPp4rRuL7w.text: Delicious food, good service, and great atmosphere. I loved the decor. The portions are grand and very large but it's a great way to share and have a bit more of a intimate meal with who ever you're with. The food is amazing and so unique. I'm not much of a breakfast person but I'd happily eat here any day.

-NjGfOSpMiOD9gCRUnO7Dw.text: We've eaten here several times when we make trips to Las Vegas. The portions are huge, so plan on sharing! My kids thought it would be fun to order their own and hopefully take some home, but one ordered a chocolate chip pancake and another ordered a waffle. Both of those come with sides, but my big eaters could barely muscle through their main course. Unfortunately, they poured syrup on it all before I could tell them to do it bit by bit, so it was no use in asking to pack it home. Their hash's are the best. I love the corned beef hash that comes with potatoes, fruit, a biscuit and eggs, all served in a cast iron skillet. Share it, it's a lot of food!

haZRsC1p2Fg0jf4vZ11rng.text: We have eaten here a few times. The food is always fresh and tastes good. Service can be a little slow at times, we had to ask for refills on our drinks.

ckw67W1DHAej5L0x_WbAXQ.text: I fell in love with Hash House A Go Go the very first time I ever ate there. This last weekend my husband and I were looking forward to a great breakfast. Our experience started off bad when our server did not acknowledge us for quite some time. We have previously been here when it has been packed and had excellent service.  My husband is currently missing his entire top row of teeth due to major in progress dental work and therefore can only eat soft foods. He had several questions about menu items. Our server Dulce, appeared annoyed with her quick, short answers, most of which were "No." He then asked if he could get a short stack of pancakes. Dulce replied, "No." Her negativity put a damper on our meal and my husband left there hungry.

CAQJVbxXxHtjS8P6pAsbcw.text: Food was good. I ordered chicken & waffle, and other friends ordered different menus and all of them were tasty. I haven't seen chicken & bacon waffle combination and it was actually good. The amount was too much, so I had to get to go box.

LjILMTJ-xL40IO3DHX3OSw.text: Came here for breakfast a couple days ago. Never been a fan of this chain to be honest but the wait at IHOP was too long. And with all honesty you get the same quality at IHOP for a couple bucks less.  Let me start by saying that the service was exceptional! The bartender seemed to be the one taking care of us. I want to see her name was limit or a net or something that sounds like that. Extremely helpful even though she had a lot of tables and a lot going on. Very professional, I knew the menu, and always kept our coffees and our water is filled. The three stars just for the food.  I want to head and started off with a traditional bacon and egg combo. Bacon look like it had been cooked way early in the day and simply reheated on the flat top. Dark and caramelized in color but extremely soggy and cold to the touch. Ordered the eggs over medium and well it's kind of hard to mess up eggs so those are pretty good. Went ahead and chose the biscuit as my side and did a side of gravy. Didn't want to fork out the five dollars for biscuits and gravy. The biscuit has a weird consistency. The outermost layer is flaky and Chris while the inside has a very dense and chewy consistency to it. Not in a good way. Tasted more like flower than buttermilk. Highly disappointed. The gravy, sausage gravy, was well seasoned and very good. Went well with my soggy potatoes. Potatoes are also called. I'm used to country style potatoes being crispy on the outside and nice and cooked on the inside. These were soggy all around.  We also had a pancake combo. Pancake with eggs and potatoes. Same thing here. Can't really screw up the eggs so those were OK. Potatoes, or the same. Soggy. Pancake were slightly disappointing.  One side have been cooked a little too long. So while the majority of the top part was nice and soft and tender, the bottom part had a thicker harder chewier layer. Couldn't really get past that.  Honestly like I said, the service was five star by all means. The overpriced food was not.

CR9t3foRmuZiQ4jUNItQ-g.text: Hash House was our 2nd choice because the wait at Babystacks was 20 mins too long. When in Vegas, just like in California - I want rapid accommodations. So by default ended up here, and to our luck got seated in less than 5 mins.  My husband ordered the Chicken Benny, and I ordered one of their Farm Scrambles that had bacon, avocado and Swiss cheese. His stacked tower of fried chicken coruscated of greatness, definitely a 5 stars. The chipotle sauce it was drenched in was madly delicious. Wish I could say the same of my meal, the scramble was just okay. And it came with too much mashed potatoes (yes I did order that) and the biscuit was bigger than I imagined. Both kind of dry at first. I asked for a side of gravy (which the waitress mentioned I could put on the biscuit at first). Well, to my dismay, I was charged $4.25 for the gravy (boOoOo!). I didn't contest though, because I used most of it. Just wish she would have told me it was extra -_-.  Service was good, but food coming out was pretty slow. Guess because it was Sunday and they were busy. At any rate, I'd probably order something different next time.

nODzB3YXQhXcgri1A3fFFw.text: It was a nice diversion away from the hustle and bustle of the strip. I had the chicken and waffles and ate every last bite. The server a little overwhelmed and it took a while to get our drinks, but she was very pleasant and we weren't in a hurry so we didn't mind. All in all it was a great lunch!

toYXsRI3W_ftuv3F4vRDOg.text: Good ol Henderson never fails for making a brotha feel unwanted or less of a person. I was in there with a friend, she went in 1st while I was still outside. She had ordered her bloody Mary, it came with a BLT on the side. It had just came as I sat down, however the waitress never acknowledged my presence. I played it off at 1st but for the next 25 off minutes we were there she never came back to check on my friend nor did she, or the other 2 waitresses acknowledge us again. Only after I put the payment up did 1 of the other waitresses come take it but still never spoke to me the entire time I was there. 1 star because my friend enjoyed the bloody/BLT

6nnmQ1zzRGsw6norWDtUTg.text: Just recently moved on this side of town and looking  for breakfast.   Hash House A go go has great variety of foods . Great food,  great service.  Will definitely go back to this Location.

WghMiofslrcoCXOc1KpYsA.text: We hit this place up while my in-laws were visiting this past weekend. It was a Sunday around 9a - there was no wait and we were seated immediately.   Everyone ordered something different - the chicken and eggs, pancakes, hubby just got eggs with the plan of eating off everyone else's plate and I got their towering Sage Fried Chicken with bacon filled waffles! That chicken sure had a nice crunch and some decent flavor. And when are bacon filled waffles not a good idea?   While I enjoyed my epic food, I think I'd like to try something different next time. I saw one of their stuffed burgers go by and it looked huge and delicious! And the bread pudding listed on the menu sounds like a good idea, too!

-hrCvYgzk6cbS40O8ldaLg.text: This place was amazing one of the best breakfast/ brunch places I've ever been too . The waiter was the best his name was Bren he was so nice. Gave my mom a to go coffee cup . He's a 11/10.

gJ7JcA7uohGiwh4Ggqr4fQ.text: Had hoped for more but the food was just okay. The portions are enormous and fit for a king, but the seasoning was a little lackluster and the food was not served hot which is a must if my book. Our family ordered the chicken and waffle, the fried chicken dinner, a waffle and pancakes. Everyone was full, but nothing to write home about. Not sure I'd go back to try again. There are lots of amazing restaurants to choose from on the strip.

DFaU3Vj1sGoeht2wZOkorg.text: After seeing Hash House A Go Go on a Food Network show, my hubby wanted to go for the famous chicken and waffles for Sunday brunch.  We arrived around 10:40 and were immediately seated Ina large booth in the corner. Our friendly server came over right away and took drinks orders while explaining a few particularly popular many items.  Items chosen; chicken waffles (he loved it), apple-cinnamon pancake (yummy and seriously the size of a medium pizza!), kids hamburger (huge, said to be a little oily tasting), and egg white scramble with avocado and sweet potato fries (good).  While the portions are easily large enough for 2 people to share, one will not be disappointed if comfort foods is your hankering.

XZpUOnjCuo97WYMySx7Q3A.text: Food was amazing, definitely get the eggs benedict or the pancakes. Service was a little slow but they were jammed packed on a Friday morning so its not really a fault. Easily my favorite spot in Vegas.

kRI3H8yj9pdv8n-VS9aERQ.text: So here's the deal, if your claim to fame is breakfast then one would expect cooks who can provide customers with eggs prepared as you ordered them, right? When our server brought the chicken hash I saw immediately that my requested "over medium" eggs had been cooked to hard crispness. Server saw this too and scooped the eggs up and said she would get some cooked properly and left the hash sitting in front of me. I'm not thrilled but decide to eat some of the hash while I wait for my eggs to be cooked. The hash had big chunky cold potatoes in it and the chicken was unappetizing, honestly all very greasy and not nearly as hot as it should be. Also the biscuit was cold and hard and my dining mate said we should call our server back and order something else completely and I had to agree. We didn't see our server anywhere so she asked the hostess if she'd mind sending her over and she literally didn't even acknowledge her asking?! I requested just have some hash browns and a couple eggs with toast instead and found out they only have the greasy chunky potatoes no hash browns. The manager had come to our table when I told the server I didn't want my food and he assured me my potatoes would be hot this time. So my mate dives into her food which is a house salad with grilled chicken. NOT! It was their version of a Cobb salad with big chunks of unappetizing looking chicken plus a grilled chicken fillet on top? We were just amazed that kitchen staff could be so clueless. The manager returned to the table and they brought her another order to go with what she ordered originally. I told him that the hostess was unfriendly and that his kitchen staff must be high to mess up a simple house salad. He obviously didn't appreciate my feedback and told me he couldn't relate to what I was saying nor how I said it. BTW the second set of replacement eggs weren't an over medium either, I'm just saying. I felt somewhat vindicated about eating a crappy meal on my birthday after reading other people's reviews of this restaurant. They obviously have problems with staff and from my point of view back of house needs training on egg cooking and salad making while the hostess gets a lesson in friendliness. Wish we'd gone down the street to Metro Diner.

icZYhoU1dR44YNWXq4fsfg.text: Hash House PLEASE come to NW Peoria, AZ, (Happy Valley and Lake Pleasant is the PERFECT location ;)!!  We just stopped in during our annual Vegas trip. Doesn't get any better and you'd be a HIT in AZ...AZ needs you!

2Q1CglOzunn5I1-xCPX2dw.text: Food portions are gigantic. I ordered the chicken and waffles amazing ! The waffles had bacon that was perfectly crispy. The chicken was moist and perfectly seasoned. The hubby had chicken something it looked great, but I was focused with my waffles ! It looked good though. The portion size and quality of the food are worth the price.  Customer Service was good. Everyone was very friendly, and professional. We went for lunch  and were seated promptly in a booth. We ordered drinks and received them within about 10 minutes. Make sure you have your I.D if you don't they watch your table like drink security making sure your not drinking someone's alcoholic beverage. Really ! But this is Vegas so Kudos... Our food was brought out in a reasonable amount of time  and everyone's meal was served together at perfect temperature.   Atmosphere was very clean and comfortable. I felt like I could bring the family or, a group of friends. There was bar, table and booth seating available.  We will return !

L2orJxXwaYDHbj3NoraMmg.text: What can be better than a place that serves brunch 7 days a week?  We came here for Sunday brunch and the wait was about 20 minutes for a table at peak brunch time.  Our waitress gave us some very useful advice while we were perusing the menu.....the portions are huge and can be shared. She was absolutely right. My dining partner and I opted to share the crab cakes Benedict and I'm glad we did. It was enormous. I thoroughly enjoyed it and we barely finished it.  I will definitely be back to try more of the items on their brunch menu.

Mp2mQj5SsARLPDWwVn9ScQ.text: Had pub crawl again. Still very very dry only mustard on it.  It needs some thousand island. Bread was perfect this time.   Server was very slow.  Love coming here but it's coming to and end.  Too much useless garnish. Too much mustard on the end of the plate.

j9SmZnjPS7d9zOhSfGD8Rg.text: Much improved service.  Stealth bar. Evidently not popular but the food and service is finally good.   Menu changes so if you gave up on the place like we did some years ago and are giving them yet one more try you'll see changes in it too.   We like it and will return.

sts7HTKrPQkLtM2dOnxRmA.text: Shitty customer service from the hostess stephanie  and the manager allison. Having several empty booths available and only one family ahead of us, they quoted us a 45 min wait time. Now we were a big party and we told them that we didnt mind sitting in different booths. The hostess went to see what she could do and when she came back she quoted us a longer time saying it would be an hour! Really?! Then we overheard stephanie with other hostesses say that the server didnt want to take such a big order. We walked out and when I spoke to the manager she went on to say that her staff knew what they were doing . Apparently not if you have people walking out!

A8BypEVJkByOvrwrbVlZ3g.text: Cool atmosphere, great service, overly generous portions, and NOMZ.  Hash House A Go Go food is deeeelish. They're not the cheapest, but their portions are gargantuan, comparable to Claimjumper.

odacwIKv1foYuYGhnH_hXA.text: Terrible service. First off, they are short on servers even though they have countless tables open. Second, they actually charge $1.29 for an extra side of ranch. Egg Works never charges for more ranch. Third, they bring you a biscuit without any butter. Fourth, they give you two lousy napkins. I understand that I can ask for butter and napkins but I should not have to. This is basic customer service. In addition, waitress/bartender takes your order and then she never comes back. I have to get up and ask her the bill. Well, never coming back here again. Management is apparently very cheap here.

OIsr7R5--DDtThfc9I6bFg.text: We normally like this place, but they are getting 1 star today strictly for a lack of planning. More than 2/3 of the tables in the place are set and ready, but all parties are being made to wait 45 minutes for a table because of a lack of staff. As I look around I can count 6 or 7 dozen empty seats, while the are only about 3 dozen more actually seated. Just silly....

BLxxSmCLgpTvg5aiJJrh-g.text: Went late at about 8:30 and were greeted right away. We just came for some coffee and deserts and may I say we definitely came to the right place. I ordered a s'mores mocha and I can't even tell you just how good it was. I found my new favorite treat! It's coffee and dessert in one! Yesss!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Henderson, NV, United States

RQXL0766rUIKFWTgfCWUwQ.text: We chose Hash house for our easter brunch since it was close to the church we were attending. It was a really disappointing experience of gigantic portions of mediocre food.   We ordered the lamb chop hash (medium rare) off the easter menu. It wasn't a hash at all, just two very rare chops on top of potatoes. A hash is diced up meat cooked WITH potatoes, not just put on top. I like rare meat, but the chops were very rare, I should have sent them back.  The biscuit it came with was very dense and dry.   My mom ordered the fried chicken benedict. You couldn't even tell it was a benedict, it was just a mountain of food piled together. It didn't even look appetizing. Lastly was the cobb salad which wasn't bad, but not great either.   I have to agree with Lauren C and other reviewers, I definitely prefer quality over quantity and unfortunately Hash House is all about quantity.

vRhH8cCgMPsgfQMfA8ojrQ.text: Good service and the food was good. However, ridiculous huge portions. I'd prefer they focus more on the quality and less on the quantity. For this reason it won't be a regular stop of mine.

5DxSzA6XHoEpqiYKo5Ejcw.text: [occasion] -  Sunday brunch date.   [Parking] - the lot is as large as their portion sizes. plenty of room to park your car.   [Space | Looks] - home-y interior with wood-based furniture throughout. it just replicates your standard southern restaurants and you'll find all their award-winning articles and a picture of martha stewart (lol) posted near the entrance wall. pero like, it felt like a sauna inside.  [Service] - prompt service and our helpful waitress guided us through the menu since i mentioned i did not eat meat and pin pointed all the seafood and vegetarian options.   [Food | Drinks] - if you're hungry (like REALLY hungry), you'll love it here. almost every dish came at a monstrous size. i decided to try something vegetarian-friendly and took on our waitress' recommendation: the portabella mushroom sandwich with pesto and red peppers, which was delicious. if you're a sweet potato fan, replace the fries with that! my boyfriend just had to get the sage chicken and waffle signature dish and he really enjoyed it. bacon is mixed in the waffle, but you have the option to opt out. my bf is generally able to eat heavy portions, but even he was unable to finish his meal. "only a monster could finish this" - bf.  we also tried the spiked watermelon lemonade and it was tasty, but where was the alcohol. super sweet and it was straight juice.   [Recommendations] - i wish we had tried more of the menu since hash-hash is known to be a LV staple, but we'll definitely go back when we make the visit again. you can't go wrong with the chicken and waffles as it seems like everyone gets it.   [FINAL THOUGHTS] - hoping to come back soon :)

YgEshNM7L2m0uGJoFxUbMA.text: Yum yum yum. Bloody Mary spiced and real!  It was a morning where the crew needed fuel for the long hikes. I chose the egg whites with spinach and mushrooms! I know BORING! But let me tell you .. what the heck did they put in the eggs. Fluffy, buttery and yummy. Perfect portion to fuel my BODY. And yes I ordered the famous Bloody Mary.. can't revisit YELPING a Bloody Mary. It was OH SO perfect. Of course the boys gorged on the BIG BREAKfasts. They loved them! We can Thank our Avis Car Rental host for mentioning this place. who Knew?! Everyone except  us! We are hooked! Cheers!

qE8mu-9-ce9vvZds-Pw-gQ.text: Always heard of this place for having huge portions and plates. Decided to try it and loved it. Came on a Monday so it was pretty slow, not busy at all. Service was friendly but the food was great. BLT's are very standard and simple. There's not too much you can do too it to make it more amazing than it already is. But I added over medium eggs to mine and it was delicious, I forgot about avocado but that would've been good too. The sandwich was so huge I wish you could order half of it. Cause I'm not a fan of taking them home. They don't taste too good as leftovers cause of the hot and cold components. But the food was very ginormous as I expected portion wise.   My boyfriend really liked his Texas Benedict, it's like a Mexican sopes dish with a whole lot of mashed potatoes on the plate. The lemonade was pretty good, however I got my strawberry lemonade with ice and the lemonade is very fresh and sour. So ice would've helped water it down. I asked for some after lol   But overall this place was pretty cool. Definitely a place I'd recommend for people to go to that visit Vegas. It's one you have to try.

ReW7UUc6hsGIZ5jv7RimFw.text: Food 3 stars.  Servings 5 stars. Service 5 stars.   Waited about 15-20 mins to get seated for a party of 4 around 11:30am. Server was really friendly (forgot her name), though she called my 9 month old a baby girl, (he gets it a lot, coz he has a lot of hair) lol!! I asked the server to give HIM (my 9 month old) an apple juice, she still called him a "her". Wth. So anyway... Their servings are just about right for the price. The food is kinda tasteless though! My meatloaf is so bland. The chicken is....meh! The only thing i liked is the waffle and my iced pistachio mocha, and the service. This place is huge so even though there are lots of customers, it doesnt feel crowded. Our drinks were always refilled.

Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Henderson, NV, United States. Servings are big even for a kid&#39;s meal!

x5VHn1OZdpf02_7jrykAMg.text: I took my wife and some friends here for dinner.  The service was good and quick.  The waiter kept or glasses full.  The food looks good and there is a lot of it but the flavor of the food wasn't to my taste.  It wasn't bad but sort of ordinary. A plate was on average  $15 and large enough for two so if I go again I am going to split a single meal.  If your looking for a quick bite out and haven't tried Hash House it is probably worth trying once.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Henderson, NV, United States
Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Henderson, NV, United States

pMKRABJSGJjGXXvkBXsyQA.text: A great place service a shocking amount of food.  You're not going away hungry.  Reasonable value for your money as well.

LwQ6wWnoxU133IQVhLLZTA.text: Tried 3 times to contact Allison or Tyler the on duty managers about an order that was not placed or handled appropriately.   I have had good food their in the past but the service is the worst!

iq8_ikckJC4HttUDgZZIug.text: Really good food. I shared the HH Meatloaf with my husband and it was really good. Glad we shared it because the portion was huge. My son had the HH French Toast and he really liked it too. Our server was Jessica and she was AWESOME, best server I've had in awhile! Will definitely eat here again!

R4-MF91YftGYab_mTRZnDA.text: I have heard many things about this restaurant and was excited to finally give it a whirl. We arrived at 4:00 for an early dinner. The restaurant was not busy but we found our service to be extremely slow. We ordered an appetizer and did not receive it for over 25 minutes. The food then arrived moments after. Our table was stocked with dirty dishes and trash. Being that the restaurant was slow, we expected a higher level of service. I enjoyed the chicken pot pie and the waitress was nice enough to take care of the appetizer. I'll give the restaurant another try but perhaps another location.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Henderson, NV, United States. Chicken pot pie.

mNWEMx3dHStzbE2oPC0fGw.text: Staying across from the MGM but decided to go to the one in Henderson about 20 minutes away because the closer one is supposedly always packed and has lines. I'm glad we did.  We waited less than one minute to be seated, ordered drinks and our food. Drinks were less than 5 mins and food less than 15 minutes. It was really nice and the food was delicious! My girlfriend had the Chicken & Waffles and I had the Fried Salmon. Both were good. Waitress was nice and quick too.   Overall great experience, not sure where all the three stars come from.

Qnoj9CiuIxkrx6mZvCXi1Q.text: I have mixed reviews of this place. It's a nice restaurant. Newly renovated and clean. The staff is always nice and friendly. The food is where it gets tricky.   We came for Chicken and Bacon Waffles. It was amazing! Fresh breaded and fried chicken breast over light and fluffy bacon waffles. It was so good in fact we came back a few days later so my husband could try the same dish. I decided to try a burger I saw on our earlier trip.   Long story short, this time around they served two over cooked, dry, bone in chicken pieces. And the plate had a weird teriyaki sauce everywhere! Like they were trying to make it look fancy. But who wants teriyaki sauce on their waffles!!?? Not us. It was gross. When we asked the manager why it was so different he said that's the way it always comes even when I showed him the photo of the awesome meal earlier with the chicken breast he argued with me and said I missed the bone. What??? I think I know what a chicken breast is. Crazy. We didn't even get an apology or an offer to make it the other way that we enjoyed so much the first day and came back for! Also, I looked up the menu on line and posted a pic that it clearly says "chicken breast" on the menu. AND I JUST realized I was also supposed to get 2 eggs!! No eggs were offered either time.   The twisted burger I was so excited to try looks amazing but was also a disappointment. Again with the teriyaki sauce all over the plate and under my burger bun!!!??? Yuck. No. Not that it mattered the burger had SO MUCH SAGE that it tasted like sausage patties.   I posted pics. I'm not sure if we'll go back and it's a shame we really enjoyed our meal the other day. Maybe if we are VERY SPECIFIC about what we order. I don't know, I give this place a maybe.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Henderson, NV, United States. Big O Sage Fried Chicken and Waffle Tower. Says &#34;chicken breast&#34; on the menu but that&#39;s NOT what comes on the plate.
Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Henderson, NV, United States. Looks good but it tastes like a sausage patty!! Too much sage. Skip it.
Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Henderson, NV, United States. Chicken BREAST (not the bone in chicken that it comes with) and Bacon Waffles. No leeks, no sauce on plate. VERY good this way!

1CSKfX-4pXdq9KfsU4ft5w.text: I can see how this place would appeal to some, but I'm not one of them. Huge portions, different food and a big price tag, that's what you get at Hash House A Go Go.   I ordered the Chicken & Waffles and they spice up the chicken too much for me. How much rosemary does one chicken need? The waffle was bland. I've had better waffles at Original Pancake House.   I am glad Hash House came to Henderson as I don't like to see buildings sit empty so I was glad they took this space. I understand why a lot of people consider Hash House a regular, I'm just not one of them.   I would like to request that Brannon R. not comment on this review. When people have a negative review of this place he seems to answer in a condescending manner. There's a way to speak to people who have negative opinions of your business without insulting them, and Brannon doesn't seem to know how to do this.

z0-CL3s5tEu9X59T4Oe4BA.text: Hash House A Go Go is my go to spot when I am craving delicious breakfast foods.  The service is great, portions are HUGE, and the price is very reasonable.  Their menu ranges from amazing breakfast foods to wraps and burgers for lunch.  I usually go with 5 or 6 people so we will order a large snickers pancakes (you can choose from a wide variety of pancake options) and a griddled french toast (Amish style bread dipped in a banana cinnamon cream with pecan maple syrup) for the middle of the table.    Their #5 bacon, avocado, and cheddar burger is amazing when you are there for lunch or dinner.  For breakfast, I have had "Andy's Sage Fried Chicken" which is absolutely incredible.  It is layers of fried chicken, scrambled eggs, bacon, biscuit, and a chipotle sauce on top.  All of their scrambles are delicious as well   The corn beef hash is some of the best I have ever had.  I have never had a bad meal from here yet and will continue to eat at hash house when I am looking to splurge on a large portion meal.   All of the meals are very reasonably priced, between 8 and 15 dollars.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Henderson, NV, United States. Andys safe fried chicken
Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Henderson, NV, United States. Hardwood bacon cheddar avocado burger
Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Henderson, NV, United States. Oatmeal overload

YhPvouAChyJN_1ieHPowxQ.text: Someone please remind me not to come here anymore. The food is bad and expensive, and the service is seriously lacking. Sure, the portions are huge, but I can't really justify paying that much money for such low quality ingredients and poorly seasoned food. I had the biscuits & gravy today - the gravy was COLD. Not room temperature, but refrigerator cold. The mashed potatoes underneath were hot so eating it with the gravy made it acceptably warm. I didn't send it back because I didn't want to have to wait for it again. It was also super bland. My SO had the chicken hash, which he said was dry dry dry. My SO, who, by the way, eats microwaveable chicken, even commented on the obviously low quality ingredients.   My coffee only got topped off once, and the waitress (who never introduced herself by name.. is that the policy here?) tried to remove our dishes before we were done eating (utensils were still crossed, also).   Ugh, I don't know why I keep coming back when I KNOW it's not going to be good. All the menu items SOUND good, but the execution is really just terrible.

ov2g92Kp-LdCjCTW4hss2A.text: Great portions.  Great customer service.  Well ran and clean  A must visit.  Chicken and waffles left us satisfied and stuffed. Quick refill on our drinks and attentive staff.

bUbMFgbkC83LdnIaGs1apQ.text: This not only is Hash House one of the most DELICIOUS restaurants in town (the meatloaf sandwich is a must try!) but they are one of the most charitable restaurants in Las Vegas constantly willing to help charities and non profits!

qksg5z5tbHJXLKqArmqVfg.text: We had a large group for Lunch today. The service was excellent. Most places have a tough time accommodating large groups but our server was on top of it.  As always the portions are huge.  Great selection of things to order.  My only negative was the Sangria.  Not the Best.  Everything else was great.

P7lEccj62RQ0efXobVqIsQ.text: Stopped in here with one of my vendors who was treating. I mean, free food is always a great deal. Somehow it just tastes better. I ordered the fresh toast with banana. It was just ok, I actually thought the banana flavor was going to be part of the fresh toast dip, but it was just carmelized bananas on the side. The french toast itself was a bit dry, which required extra butter and extra syrup. I've definitely had better.  Service was good, the place wasn't too crowded on a Tuesday morning around 11am. Its a big restaurant with what looks like a good sized center bar. I think I still prefer the location on Sahara.

nq6R76x8LVFAcXnePR2t4Q.text: As a place named a hash house..I was surprised that the hash was horrible.....stringy corn beef, soggy crispy potatoes and no flavor in anything but the fruit on the plate.  Service was good..people friendly but the food was terrible bad

aY5QocetVyf1VzgIKs0O_g.text: I come here time and time again everything I've tried on the menu is excellent. My fav is the chicken pot pie!!

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Henderson, NV, United States

a1eJiEOulu67RjjFtpRYcg.text: Came in on another occasion to have breakfast with a friend, and to watch the Chiefs. The owner spotted my shirt that I had on, and came over to greet my friend and I. He asked how we were doing and informed us that we would each be receiving a free drink. There's nothing wrong with a little hometown love! The food as always was magnificent.

f-REYzFTPndZXB9Du0xHNA.text: I've been to this Hash House twice and the one on the strip once, I feel the food quality is the same. I enjoy their signature chicken and waffles dish, especially the bacon inside the waffles. Their portions are huge, so share if you aren't hungry enough to eat a horse. Yet, if you're eating the dish solo, know that it's so large your food will be cold before you're done. It would be nice if they super heated the plates to prevent this.   For food, the place gets 4 stars, for service, mostly 3, often times drink refills take a long time or service is just slow. My friend tried a fresh juice, tangerine I think, and said it was too sour, the waitress didn't seem to care.   Go for the chicken and waffles or the banana and brown sugar pancake, but make sure to be hungry!

1SeBu7Kr1y_RrcWmGlSgqw.text: Never disappointed there's something for everyone and the portions are insane!! After being to hash house I few times I like to share a dish with whoever I'm with!!

MzYw2ivhrmuLtUSoePRC8g.text: We came here this afternoon for a late brunch and there were a few people waiting so it was about a 20 minute wait. I honestly thought it might be longer of a wait so we went to the bar are for drinks while we wait. There were two spots open so we decided to eat there. Tracy greeted us right away and was excellent throughout our entire meal. She is attentive, friendly and went over the top to make sure I tried the homemade jam. We will definitely be back and hope to sit at the bar again! Thanks, Tracy!!

yjXqLOfdgLn4CLITQKaXYg.text: There is a very good reason this has the lowest rating of all the hash house's. Staff was very rude especially the front podium  To make matters worse after I drove 25 min to get home I discover My chicken was under cooked and pink  Waste of $ and my time  Grossly disappointing

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Henderson, NV, United States. Here&#39;s all the gross pink slimey chicken I got here

SXaqtJ4n4W3r-kWk5393kA.text: This was our first time eating at a Hash House A Go Go. The food was delivered quickly unfortunately the children meals did not arrive in a tractor as described in the kids menu. When we asked the server instructed us in a directive and uncaring way that if that is what we wanted we had to inform her while we were ordering. The grilled cheese was greasy, the crab cake sandwich was large but not good. the kids did not like the chicken fingers which is unusual as chicken fingers wherever we go are their favorite. We will not be eating hear again

WhjSW58og7I4TD4hIJyVzg.text: Had a great dining experience. Server (Aimee) was super nice and accommodating. Food came out fast and was amazing. The Sage Chicken Benedict was our favorite.

LsWf4nQpteUbkWdZzUP_4w.text: Hi dinners! I went to this eatery to see what it was all about. I found the staff friendly and the place very clean. The food I was not impressed at all for the pricey bill. Yes they give you a lot of food way to much for the normal person to consume then you have to bring home food that does not reheat very well then you throw out the food. This is a waste of money. Find a different dinner. Enjoy!

DgpYFtuGpV8ukHk6qXtwGQ.text: Service was okay...restart aunt a little warm for summer. I would figure that they would pump the ac in Vegas! Wait for food was decent. The Chicken and waffles were great! Chicken was crispy. Waffles were a bit soggy but yummy. The burger patty itself needs some serious seasoning!! Fires were yummy but by far the BEST was the Banana Brown Sugar pancakes!!!

gPCg35Wyxj5P5rCl4_gkEA.text: 3 people loved their drinks and meals, service was a bit rushed but it is a holiday weekend. We had the blueberry pancake, crab cake, corned beef hash and chicken and waffles. Everything was cooked like it was suppose to be and delicious, I don't know what the crap reviews are about.

n6oMDRRkJL4mSW_rLwyg8A.text: Leaving Henderson location right now.   We had Nicole for our waitress and she was amazing. Great food. Boyfriend and I had a fun experience with delicious drinks too.

Zz3iAIkUI_hfoxSS2YfiNQ.text: Waiter never came by but once. Food was good but service awful. Took forever first time comming here and last time. Come on whats wrong with customer service these days

j9kfXX2Qqm4QSg7M_WSw4Q.text: Such a difference from downtown locations... Food actually has flavor, portions are larger but not ridiculous. If it's big with no flavor, then that is a no go for me... But this location has both.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Henderson, NV, United States. It&#39;s going down good!

MrLy5SZQa0qzD1ekQLRyJg.text: It's was a bit pricey for the quality of food. Huge portions but I would never be able to finish. Don't think I'll be returning.

h-v243k3aZV1RmA4dOsw_w.text: I like it for dinner as it is usually not that busy. The food tastes good and with the huge portions I always have enough to take home and eat the next day.

uQK16m6fj-FYQlXnLpJ2FQ.text: So I wanted to give this place 1 star because how I felt when speaking to someone on the phone. But the server was nice, you guys had soymilk for my coffee, the food was good and he offered to go drinks, so I bumped it to 3 stars. I recommend everyone get familiar with what "vegan" means and whether or not you guys have vegan options. Just because you are catered to meat or most or all of you love meat, when you hear the word "vegan" it shouldn't bring negative thoughts to you. My son wanted to eat there for his birthday breakfast because he wanted chicken and waffles. I called to make a reservation and asked at the end "btw...do you guys have vegan breakfast options?" Girl on the phone says "no." I asked "ok...do you have vegan lunch options?"  She says "No." I said "Are you serious? So you don't have fries?" She sounds irritated at this point and explains that she just says they don't have vegan options because she doesn't know exactly what it is. Then asks if i can eat eggs. I say. No...no animal products. All she had to do was put me on hold and ask. Or google wtf vegan means. Vegan options is just as important as knowing if you have gluten free options. Its not a negative thing, people. Vegans are vegans for POSITIVE reasons. Either to not support animal cruelty,  or for health reasons. You don't have to be vegan but please...if you're going to run a food business or work at one, learn what vegan is. She even says " I know we have a gluten free section, but I don't know if we have vegan. I mean because all of our stuff is still cooked in oil" so I ask "ok is it lard? Or do you use vegetable oil?" She says vegetable oil. Geez...lol. Please Chef of Hash house....know if you have vegan options. I mean even if yall can make a hash scramble without eggs n cheese and u dont use lard or animal broth seasoning, you know if its a vegan option, right?

EJqGa06gXHcZRHPs68X6fw.text: This review maybe coming from a bias perspective, since I have had the pleasure of eating at the original location in San Diego. The food was just a little better then a Denny's or IHOP. Potatoes were supposed to be crunchy they were soggy with no flavor. They came out too fast to be fresh. Vanilla waffle was ok and the bacon is usually nice and crispy, this one was basic. I hope it was just a bad day, so if ever in the San Diego area. The original is much better.

AWOgOZ2psQI7gKGMYQzQIQ.text: The food here is really expensive, and the portions are huge. I would rather have smaller portions for less money. Not everyone likes to eat leftovers, so the food waste in this place is probably really high. I ordered the chicken Benedict. It was ok...  we also ordered a hamburger with mashed potatoes in the middle, and that was really good. I don't know if I'll be back, but it was worth a try:)

AADeBDkdJubIODwkG1186w.text: Awesome place to eat...Great food, service and friendly team!... excited to come again...  and  thank you for giving back to community!

ZjbEAMOdnVNdPNspeJQROA.text: My third time at this location and my last.  It's the little things. I always get something cold, old, not seasoned right or whatever.  I used to like HH but no more. I gave them 3 times...thinking any one can have a bad day or this is still a new location.  Blah! The only good thing was tge customer service. Very nice and attentive waitress.

e9HMHte_G-PG0gxA2YrtNA.text: Great spot for breakfast, lunch, & dinner. The servings are HUGE! Better to share w/your spouse if you're not that hungry. The service was excellent! Yvette was very nice & answered all of our questions. Bathroom was in order & clean. Parking & location is perfect too, no too crowded. There are a lot of shopping stores to go to afterwards.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Henderson, NV, United States
Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Henderson, NV, United States
Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Henderson, NV, United States

jFPJD6HN4R-VFjb2BVRJxg.text: My husband and I workin the food service industry and this is the second time we have visited this location. The food was excellent even though they forgot my avocado and bacon in my burger. When they did bring me the side of bacon and avocado the avocado were brown and gross, me being a server I would have never taken that to a guest. Which was taken care of by the manager and server after waiting 5 minutes for the server. We never saw the manager the server just came out and said the burger was on them per the manager. . My only complaint is that it was slow and there were tables that stayed dirty the whole time we were there. No servers to be found or manager. The hostess was on her phone most of the time and was not very friendly. Coming from a food service industry ourselves where my husband is a manager and I a server you would think they would take pride in their establishment. You would think that customer service is a value as well to an establishment. The food is good but the service here is horrible. The service is what makes me not want to come back nor do I want to recommend this place to anyone.

Tl3A9K5NEY6yAcH3DVZg_A.text: We went in today for a Christmas breakfast. My 85 year old grandmother was cold every time the door opened, as they sat our party of 6 at the table right next to the front door and she was very uncomfortable in the chairs so we asked to move to a booth. They weren't busy at all, it was about 9am. When our server asked the hostess if we could move, GABBY (the hostess) rolled he eyes and said "seriously?" Yes, seriously. We were uncomfortable where we were seated and needed to be moved. After asking our server and another what her name was, they stated she was new and what her name was. It's no OK to act like that with customers and text while on the clock as we saw her do many times with her phone under the host stand. The food was good as was our server but the hostess and her ways is what will stick i our minds and prevent us from going back.

65_bDvSOCb0ipDqozoVatw.text: The chicken was dry, Kris (the waitress) would try too hard to make conversation. It took a good five minutes to get seated even though there were only about 10 other people in the restaurant. The design of the place is nice-but I would not recommend going to this location.

8qQ3GRQLX0cZEwXLcgDOkA.text: We have eaten at all the Has Houses in the valley including the one that has closed. We have always liked the food and serving sizes. We never liked the service until we ate at this location. Although the service is not superb, it is definitely the best service we have received at a Has House.

In1r-xPwv4RGeLvVLmMrWg.text: So disappointed.  We went there on a Saturday night at around 9:30 and were told there would be at least a 15 minute wait.  The restaurant was not full at all.  He said they were getting ready to close so there would be a very limited menu and employees would be cleaning around us.  We asked if we would be able to eat there and he just shrugged his shoulders.  We said should we just leave and he said probably so.  We went next door to Macaroni Grill and were greeted and seated immediately and served with a smile.  How can Hash House close at 10:00 pm and not be able to serve customers at 9:30?   Not a got way to open a new restaurant in town.

vPf2aEclSbTSDorPe2w4QQ.text: AMAZING! Our waitress Tracey was absolutely wonderful, the food and presentation was even better! I ordered a stuffed blue cheese burger with bacon and I've never had a burger that good in my life!! So impressed, we will defiantly be going back soon!!

XZp5u8ff7p0vr9jjj7HdjA.text: Just went to Hash House at 3:30am today and had to leave restaurant without ever getting our food after 30 minutes. Ordered there famous chicken and waffles and my wife ordered there special salad with grilled chicken instead of the fried chicken. They brought out the chicken and waffles and the waffles were over cooked and crispy. So I asked to have them remake the waffles yet they still had not delivered the salad at this point. The waitress apologized and said the chef had just gotten there n it would be right out. After another 10 minutes went bye there was no food and no the salad still had never shown up. We had to leave the restaurant and never received any good. Will never ho back or recommend this restaurant to anyone!!!

SmZazAntEDIIhbpt5_cdow.text: Great food and great service. They serve big portions enough to share. Amazing pancakes!

KA5gaCbELnBauNcYmIw7hw.text: First, let me preface everything I say with an admission of my own shyness. I RARELY write reviews, but this restaurant and its staff go above and beyond their job duties to make you feel comfortable and at home. Here's what happened in my case: my to-go box was heavily filled --- have you seen there portions????!--- and it fell over on its side and everything fell on the floor. A shy person's nightmare, correct? Not with Tyler as the general manager. He made me feel right at home, practically took the blame upon himself--and I don't think he was at fault in any way--- and had an entirely new meal made up for me and repackaged to prevent anything wrong happening a second time. Well, to make a long story short, this shy person would feel perfectly comfortable eating wherever Tyler worked!!!! This place has great food and awesome service.

jB2RLV8_g-WeOvWCpeKFDA.text: We went here for lunch today..  we were welcomed by a smiling face as we entered this restaurant.  They seated us at a table, and a waitress came to our table to take our drink order right away.  She brought our drinks and took our order. I was torn between trying their BBBLT and the stuffed burger with cheddar and applewood smoked bacon, the waitress said if it were her, she would go with the BBBLT...she explained it came with seven peices of bacon, and was on thick sliced amish milk bread... it came with your choice of crispy fries, sweet potato fries or a lettuce salad with cucumber dressing.... I chose the crispy fries, my husband ordered the same thing, but with sweet potato fries.  It took about fifteen minutes and it was at our table, hot and fresh... it was good, I think I was expecting it to be great by all the good reviews... it was tasty tho.  The waitress was very good at qher job, she kept our glasses full and asked us if we wanted a to go cup when we were ready to go....All in all it was good, I want to go back to try one of their stuffed burgers sometime....

photos.caption: Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Henderson, NV, United States. View from our table
Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Henderson, NV, United States. A view from our table
Photo of Hash House A Go Go - Henderson, NV, United States. The BBBLT with sweet potato fries

eHwHVORzVSTAgOkzCYbG4w.text: Good food, good portions but the sorting of the silverware in the what seemed to be in the dining room was mind numbing. The waiter referring to me as boss and bro was unprofessional but he provided good service. I'll give it another try.

K0-snz_FY21YmVviZ71w5Q.text: The pros...the menu is unique and portions are large.  The cons...the hostess and seating crew were a mess. The wait was nearly an hour, despite the 20 minute they suggested it would be. The people around us eating ... were complaining about being cold/not correct/etc. Management came to a couple tables to check on things. Seemed a little unorganized.    Final result: If you have a lot of time and patience...try the chicken pot pie. Its enormous and quite good. I didn't see why all the hype however.

p1iSaRm6IVryRf69cYyT1A.text: Amazing. The food here is insane. Andy's Sage chicken waffle is something you must get. It's the largest serving I've ever had. It's tastes delicious and really is a split meal. Staff are friendly and atmosphere is fine. I always bring people here when they visit Vegas. It never disappoints. Everyone gets selfies with the serving size.

k9mdzKkgSOcuHxnxi7c9ZA.text: The breakfast experience I had at this location around 11 a.m. on a Sunday morning was what I would say is a good first impression since it was very active at the time we arrived. We had to wait about 10 minutes up front until we were able to be seated, despite the fact that there were tables available even though the restaurant was very busy. They do have the front set up very nicely though with framed and autographed pictures of various celebrities who've eaten there so that you have something to admire as you wait to be called on. The restaurant was large and neat, and had a country theme inside and outside with their tractor replicas everywhere, including a very large one outside. We learned after being seated that they only offer the breakfast menu during morning hours, and that they have very large portions of food for their meals. The waitress who served us, a young woman named Rachel, was very inviting and friendly. She was very informative about the menu, which was very helpful in our decision-making. We ordered the scrambles of hardwood smoked bacon, avocado, onion, and Swiss, which is a scrambled egg mixture. It had a good taste to it, but there were pretty large chunks of avocado that both my boyfriend and I found unappealing. We had crispy potatoes on the side with a biscuit. Everything came out nicely and tasted delicious! The atmosphere felt a little cramped since they had the tables so close together, but the food wasn't over-priced and we received the food faster than the waiting time it took to be seated. Overall, I would return again to try their lunch/ dinner menu. They had friendly and efficient service and the food was delicious, so it's definitely worth trying!

K_yxDqKS3eEqBys_PJrceQ.text: We got seated right away and for the most part the service was pretty good. The problem was the food was horrible. I ordered the meatloaf and it was so bland. The wifey got the waffles with chicken and it also had no flavor. My son got the grilled cheese sandwich from the kid's menu. Had to order fries with it. Didn't even come with a side! Yes you do get big servings but who cares if the food sucks.

IvFe7s0mGY6ytY7rAEijZg.text: Recently came in & had my order ready before I sat when it was time to order my waitress chris told me they didn't serve that here because they just opened and has to let the kitchen understand 1 menu at a time , so I was kinda upset was gonna leave but decided to stay . Food took forever I've ben to hash house in the linq b4 and it was very tasteful my pot pie was cold and carrots where to hard manager remade 1 for me taste okay not great . but ill give them a little more time since they are new. But I have noticed they have NO AFRICAN AMERICANS IN THE FRONT OF THEIR HOUSE NOR AT THE OTHER LOCATION JUST A LITTLE CONFUSING IT IS 2015 I wonder if it's just a coincidence or if it's purposely through management, I'm thinking about trying another location and finding out if all of them are like this . It's very concerning but I will give them a 2 hopefully they get it togather kiwi watermelon was a 10 Btw

gmcMHQGheUGWIBtgEA5dtg.text: Went for breakfast with my son today, and we were seated immediately.  Our waitresses, came over within seconds to take our drink order and give us menu's.  We ordered the chorizo hash, the meatloaf hash and a brown sugar banana flapjack.  Our coffee came as soon as we ordered and our food was brought out in 10 minutes.  The food was absolutely delicious, the chorizo hash has fresh jalapenos not the canned vinegar ones, a pleasant surprise. The flapjack was hot and oh so good! Our coffee was constantly topped off and the waitress was very attentive without being annoying.  When we were ready to leave with boxes, since the portions are huge, we found out that our waitress Amanda was training the other waitress, a young girl with dark hair and glasses.  Good job to both of you!  The service you gave us was amazing, the food was delicious, and we definitely will be back!!!

ND6L7fhLSgpCJ4MuUPvyrw.text: I really don't understand all of the hype.    Big food..............little flavor.    I guess I just expect too much since I add flavor in my food.     I think it's a complete waste of money.

phJmseCsSUvn8QP955DtmA.text: Food is okay, however the service is horrible. I cannot believe how long we had to wait for a refill for my water. There was literally two other couples in the restaurant and we had to wait forever. There was so no staff on the floor for a good 15 minutes. WE HAD TO GET UP AND GET OUR OWN! Our waitress also forgot to ask our order, didn't even come to check on us. Hence, we had no water. Almost wanted to dine and ditch, but being in the service industry myself I did the right thing.

HpADZpGsnHfUeD4dUPmQHg.text: This resturant is a perfect example that huge portions doesn't nessessarily mean good food. I personally would rather have quality over quantity . My meal was meatloaf, eggs, mashed potatoes and a biscuit.  Huge piece of meatloaf that was grilled, but no gravy on anything so everything was super dry. When I asked for a side of gravy to make this meal edible and not so dry, the server ended up charging me $3.95.  This was my third time trying this restaurant and I won't be back.  It's just not good food.

LYAiCnd0yLak7EKxhZpHxA.text: Love everything about the place! Really cute decor - spectacular hash (I had the jalapeno and chorizo, but shared my husband's veggie hash, which was also great). My son had a huge corned beef sandwich - and the meat was perfectly done and very high quality. My daughter had the biggest chocolate chip pancake I've ever seen (I had a bite - it was stellar too!). The manager stopped in to check on us - really great guy who obviously cares about his customers. The soundtrack was fun too - not typical, rather alternative rock from the past 10-20 years, very cool.

QM4t8gvCSSYYtA9ZQ3xDHQ.text: I don't know what all this hype is about waiting forever to be seated , waiting forever for the food & rude employees . Granted it is irritating when you are waiting to be sat and you see open tables. Have you ever thought that maybe they are trying to time out the wait so we can experience great service. For a server it is nerve wrecking when they get 3 or 4 tables all at once and they are trying to greet them all at once , & mind you this is a new server in a brand new restaurant. For us we are looking around impatiently wondering why we have not been greeted. As for the food... The food may be the same at all locations but have you thought about the fact that this is a brand new restaurant with brand new employees that are just barely getting their feet wet? Every employee I had an encounter with tonight went above and beyond for me. My server knew the menu enough to sell but still had to excuse himself to find out some information on some questions I had. No big deal, he was new to the menu. And  I would rather have a server excuse themselves while they find an answer for me than assume and my order be wrong. Fried chicken Benny and Sage fried Chicken and waffles tonight were amazing. The kitchen seemed like it fell behind for a bit , but I would definitely say the food was worth the wait! If your impatient and don't like to wait long. Come eat here when right when they open. Otherwise chill out relax and let them fix their kinks..
